prompt: A Google Maps review about a casino.
completion: We went on a Monday night to celebrate a 21st birthday. We ate at 99 Hops House. All the dishes were really good, I had the chicken panini and it was full of flavor and really delicious. My dining companions had the pot roast sandwich, the burger, the BBQ chicken flatbread and the fish & chips. Everyone said their selection was really good. The service was great, they even brought a happy birthday slice of cheese cake to the guest of honor, we did not order or ask for this, it was a kind gesture from the establishment. Afterwards we went into the casino gaming area and we're happy to see it wasn't crowded on a Monday. This gave us an opportunity to learn different games and we especially had a great time at the craps table. The pit crew were really informative and helpful in learning the game, it was a tremendous experience and a lot of fun! It was a great birthday celebration and the welcoming staff made it feel even more special.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion:
I was very disappointed.  My stay lasted no more than 20 minutes.

When I arrived, the Clerk was disinterested.  I was told to park in the "school" parking lot.  What I was NOT told was that someone needed to be there to unlock the gate.  When I pulled up, the lot was locked.  I had to drive around the block to get back into the hotel, to inform the Clerk it was locked, for one of the bellboys to say someone needed to meet me out there to unlock the fence.  I then drove around the block again and was able to get into the parking lot.

Upon entering my hotel room, I was in disbelief.  I understand this is a historic building, but was surprised to find that to them, historic meant outdated, dingy, dirty, and simply un-maintained.

I rented a 2 bedroom suite.  The kitchen was in a room off of 1 bedroom, while the bathroom was in the other bedroom.  So, to use the restroom, you had to enter the other guest's room.  If you wanted to watch TV, you had to go into the bedroom with the kitchen.  The kitchen was outdated.  The kitchen sink did not have handles and was filthy.  The fridge didn't shut unless you slammed it.  I understand now why their website has minimal photos of their rooms.

There is no AC or central air.  The wall heaters were on when I arrived.  I turned them all off.  To cool my room, I opened the windows.  I was on the 4th floor and had no screen on my large windows.   A loose nail was just sitting on my window ledge.  I called down to the front desk and had them bring up 2 fans, which I put in my windows to attempt some form of cool air in my suite.

There were dead flies and bees on the floor, on the heating units, and in the windowsills.  A live grasshopper was on my bed.  Again.  I was on the 4th floor.

The bed in the room with the TV was broken.  When my guest sat on it, I truly thought she was going to flip off the bed as it sank so far down, so quickly.

After maybe 20 minutes total, I could no longer justify the extreme expense of my room ($630 for two nights).  When I went down to the Clerk, I asked for a manager, and she came up quickly.  I briefly explained my concerns and without hesitation, she said she would cancel my room.  While I was pleased with this resolution, it seemed odd that the immediate response was simply to remove me from the hotel rather than find a more acceptable room.  This leads me to believe this is a common occurrence.

Overall, I would give this hotel 0 stars if I could.  I've read other reviews of this hotel and am floored by those who had a pleasant stay.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion:
Hotel rooms are not great. They have not been updated since the early 1900s. The room my family and I stayed in had 2 bedrooms and a kitchen room that had the sink drains covered with a sign saying " Do not use sink ". The bedrooms didn't have doors. The only bathroom was very small and was in the room with the two beds. The king bedroom used to have a bathroom but the door was locked with a table pushed up against it. In the entry room there was a big closet room where the king bathroom used to be,  which obviously was not useable. The entry door wouldn't lock. I had to stick a folded up card behind the door lock to make it latch properly. I was worried about a fire in the old building. I made sure I knew where the fire escapes were. One was out of a window in the main hallway that led to the fire escape stairway. Room left a lot of room for improvement.
The gambling hall was old but had some new remodeled bathrooms with gold bars and new tile.
The dining room downstairs was very nice. Newer design features with newer bathrooms too. Could get down to restaurant from the elevator.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion:
I was excited to stay at this haunted hotel until I checked into the hotel. The lady at the check-in deck, didn't get her name, was upset and rude when I asked if I could stay in one of the haunted rooms. This is how our convo went:

Her response: "we don't have any. Because we aren't haunted."

My response: "oh that's not what I read online."

Her response: "Idk where you read that because this hotel isn't haunted."

Keep in mind she is saying this as a total Karen.

My response (joking tone): "weird. Better not tell you the website then (laugh.)"

Her response: "no you better go ahead and tell me the website so we can get it taken down. Tell me now. What is it?"

Me: "idk the website"

Her as I walk outside to get my bags from the car: grabs phone to probably look up website.

Overall, I loved the history of the hotel. Its a shame that they added a casino to the old Ball Room. Vintage is what's popular right now. The hotel is owned by the Silverado across the street, maybe keep the slot machines in the Silverado and restore the old Ball Room? People my age would dance and have a good time in the Ball Room to any music. Square Dancing, hip-hop, ect.

completion: Ok, the casino is sharp and they give high marks to the restaurant there as it was featured on some tv show but I can't vouch for that. The casino is gorgeous... the up stairs is so run down I expected to see vagrants lining the hallway. Must see to appreciate what I'm writing here, so I'll post a few pics. It loses a star because some of the food had been sitting in the buffet for a while and started to dry out, but this is understandable as it wasn't very crowded on a weekday. I would recommend this if someone is looking for a prime rib buffet in the deadwood area.

The tables were arranged in such a way that we were very close to the table next to us which happened to have two people who talked way too loud. They were SO annoying after just a few mins. The waiter even commented on them after they thankfully left.
We tried a couple of desserts and both were good.

At times they didn't even dump the trash cans. They sometimes went days without doing this and only dumped them oafter they started overflowing. prompt: A Google Maps review about a theme park.
completion:
This park pays homage to a lot of great shows that older people and younger have had in their lives. Seeing some of your favorite childhood friends being represented by a roller coaster and/or a giant version of them is amazing.

A lot of the rides are underwhelming but there are a few that really stand above the rest. It's obvious that Spongebob's Rock bottom is really a highlight attraction for the park. With not only the most excitement offered for a ride there and with it's intimate connection to the episode of spongebob it's derived from. Up until my attempt to ride this attraction I was super impressed with the staff's ability to load people on rides and keep everything flowing well. The attendant at the spongebob ride was either very ill or extremely hungover. Every step seeming like an even heavier burden on him. Watching a coaster fly around for a minute and then waiting till just before he needs to open the gate to take long drinks out of a water bottle. And some of the slowest checking for seat belts and safety things being in place I've ever seen. Ironically another concern is his ability to pay attention to what he needs to because he just seemed so out of it.

Paying the minimum amount for a wristband to share with my family to go on a few rides is still 54$. After a day of spending too much money at other stores and trying to end it with some great characters and rides we cherish, we left disappointed.

Still an amazing place.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a theme park.
completion:
Needs better training for staff.  My 3 and 5 year olds love Adventure Bay and brought them there for the 5+  times since it open.¬† However, I observed something very concerning yesterday that needs to be¬†addressed to the teenage workers.¬†Better training for all staff.

There were still time to play, but some families were leaving. The worker was kind enough to open the exit gate for people to leave, but then at one point, a kid no more than two years old walked towards the gate and he opened it to allow the kid to leave on his own. The staff wasn't paying attention at all to who he was letting out. The parent was busy with her other child who was still inside. As you know, the place gets super busy for parents to keep an eye on every children and she could have done better too, but how does an employee just let a small child leave on their own without an adult!! Right before I was going to address this, (I had two children who were still in the playground to watch as well), the mother finally realized it and ran to her child who was at least 10 yards away thru the gate in a very busy area.¬† When I addressed this with the teenage employee, he seemed very clueless about his action and did not understand the magnitude for his mistake. I get that other families were leaving, but this child was a completely different race, so even that should have at least alerted him that he should not open the gate for a kid that is by himself.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a theme park.
completion:
Three wristbands were purchased for this visit. For the most part this was a very good visit. I've been here multiple times with my kids. Usually, with my two older ones. I did bring the two year old almost three year old this time. We did decide to go on the Dora Azul Train ride pretty basic right.  She met all the requirements for the ride, but I soon realized I may need to accompany her on the ride. I assume the attendant would understand and allow me to ride with my daughter, no that was not the case.
I was told NO!! Unless, I brought a ticket. I said, "she not going to stay seated she doesn't understand you." The attendant still say no and started the ride. My daughter stood up the attendant had to get on the mic and tell her to sit down and I said again she doesn't understand you. Can I now get on the ride and he said yes.
I soon realized I may need to go talk to a manager so I can let them know what is going on and get permission for the kids rides as chaperone capacity but was that's not possible. I got frustrated and blurted out that she is on the Spectrum which I wanted to avoid in the first place.
My issue is that if a parent tells someone that a kid needs a chaperone, that parent shouldn't have throw more money to your establishment to keep that kid safe. I'm already spending a fortune at your establishment.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a theme park.
completion: Auntie had the BEST Sunday Fun-day date with her Godson at this place! I'd never been to Nickelodeon Universe so didn't know what to expect but it was a definitely a blast. My little guy is 5. There are tons of rides and activities for him (some you can even hop on as chaperone without an upcharge!). The line to the play area was a wait so be prepared but for most of the others the wait isn't too bad. One tip: avoid the Caribou. The staff are not trained to manage a coffee shop and that was the longest wait we had all day for a simple coffee cooler. There's a Starbucks at the opposite end of the park. Just get there before the line gets too long! You will need caffeine to keep up with your littles! Loved the Dora Ferris Wheel, Crazy Car and Bus for the kids. And the Ninja Turtles made an appearance for pictures, at no extra cost! Points band are reasonable and there are many options. Wear comfortable shoes and make sure your phone is charged because 6ou will want lots of pics! Plan for a long day and go get a Auntie Anne's Sweet Almond pretzel with caramel dip for Adulting like a CHAMP.

Thanks for the great stay Hyatt Eden!!  A group of us drove from Winnipeg to Minneapolis to catch a Vikings game. We were concerned this hotel was too far away but it didn‚Äôt turn out to be an issue. It‚Äôs easy enough to drive around the city. Maybe took us half hour to get downtown. The Harley store, Target and Menards are close to the hotel so that was nice.

The rooms are big!! King Bed comfy, shower pressure great and lots of hot water!!!  Pull out sofa.
Could have easily had 4 adts share the king room.

Front staff check in was pleasant. They didn‚Äôt realize we were all traveling together so they ended up placing us on different floors. But that was our fault for not speaking up.
We also didn‚Äôt speak up about having a room away from the elevators. It was annoying to be woken up super early from guests checking out and kids running up and down the hallway etc. By the elevator. Things yah just don‚Äôt think about sometimes.

We would all stay here again!!

There were a few spots on the ceiling where the plaster was noticeably cracked and bubbled, as well as a large spot where it was missing. The curtain was also a tad stained.

Other than those small issues, everything else the room was in great condition. The room was well-cleaned and both the sofa and bed were comfortable. I generally prefer to stay at this location as it's quieter then staying near the airport. The staff here is also very friendly and accommodating, which is a huge plus for me.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a bar.
completion: Just went here for the first time and loved it. Good 80‚Äôs music playing the background and really cool arcade machines including classic games and newer pinball tables like Stranger Things and The Mandalorian, not to mention the big 2 player shoot ‚Äòem up Terminator game. Places like this are hard to find anymore and I really appreciated it. Thanks guys!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a bar.
completion:
I finally got a chance to check this place out. Most of the barcades are in Charlotte so it's nice to have one close to home. I went on a Thursday night which is "guys night" and was welcomed as soon as I walked in, both the owners and the guests were very friendly. For Thursdays, about all games were free (at least for dudes) except for pinball, which were .50 a game. Normally it's $5 a person for unlimited play and pinball is $1.00 a game (ouch to $1.00 pinball!). There were maybe 6 to 12 people rotating in and out while I was there, so not crowded at all. Parking was abundant. It's about a 5 minute walk from Freeman's. Bar can turn cash to quarters or can give you quarters from your bar tab for a 10% surcharge. Bar had food and drinks at fair prices. There are 2 gender neutral restrooms. There are a few TV's playing sports and comic book movies and YouTube videos. Place was open until midnight on a weeknight which was cool. There was one tv hooked up to a Nintendo 64 with a pretty large assortment of games. There were a couple party/board games sitting near a table. There was a fairly large area for outdoor seating as well. I think what made this visit special was how friendly the owners and guests were, felt like you were just visiting old friends instead of strangers.

EDIT: Citycade did a reconfiguration and brought in a racing game, a shooting game, a beer pong game and a couple of pay to win games disguised as games of skill. I believe at this point they've gotten rid of the $5 cover entirely and just made the machines take quarters, which I think was a good move. Pinball is still a buck which is a bummer since there are better options out there for $.50 a game, but it's close to home at least and the price point isn't uncommon. Pinball seems maintained and Citycade has occasionally swapped out for different pins, which is nice. Bathrooms are always clean which is a plus. Only complaint is that sometimes it can get a bit hot in the building.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a bar.

Challenging course. Gorgeous sweeping views. 1) If you buy the Costco vouchers, call ahead. We were fortunate enough to talk with the Pro to validate ours, but he was very forward that we would not be able to play on a Saturday/holiday again.
2) Good people.
3) Interesting carts (you MUST ride the course). DO NOT get close to the green or the cart will shut down. Not fun. There needs to be a better verbal warning.
4) USE the electronic ordering system as you turn the 15th or 16th hole. The kitchen is slow and even more so if you are hungry.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a natural history museum.
completion: Great fun for the family. If you're local you'll want a membership for planetarium discounts. They change up the sky shows every so often. This last show we went to in April was actually boring and I fell asleep but they did the Carolina sky afterwards and it was Great! They actual museum is just the right size. They have manual wheelchairs but my mother didn't feel she needed one she used her walker and it was ok. Although we didn't travel all over it was a good little tour of the facility. My child always has fun here.  If you're strapped for cash every 2nd Tuesday of the month is free after 4pm. Facility closes at 5.  You still have to pay for the show.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a natural history museum.
completion: This is a hidden gem for any naturalist. There's an emphasis on taxidermied animals and American Indians. There are some exhibits that have been closed for renovation for over a year, so there is less to see. Planetarium prices are NOT included in regular admission or even membership. The outdoor area is free to the public and has nice trails and historic structures along the way. Few things are interactive so there's not a lot for younger kids, with the exception of the pirate ship and a small puppet area.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a natural history museum.

As someone who does reptile rehabilitation it was really sad seeing resident animals live in such conditions.  most of the taxidermy pieces in this museum also need to be revived. Most were dry and cracking and alot of the pieces made me laugh because of how unrealistic they looked. Mineral exhibit was pretty cool and the planetarium show was nice.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a natural history museum.
completion: This was our first time visiting and we were more than impressed! My daughter looked it up online and described it as a place with "cool taxidermy" and she and her sister were excited so off we went. Maybe we didn't research well, but we were pleasantly surprised by all of the exhibits and especially the live animals. Great time! Looking forward to returning again soon.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a natural history museum.
completion: Took the girls here for a little trip.  Loved the nature exhibits and the dinosaurs.  The planetarium was by far the best of the experience.   Took the nature trail for a picnic to close out the day.  You can go further up past the pond and there is a covered area with tables there if you need a lot of room.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a natural history museum.
completion: This is a great museum!  It's very family and kid friendly.  This is our 2nd visit and last time the room upon entering was a science room with blocks and such.  This time it was a dinosaur exhibit for kids (kid's dinosaur books, some real fossils, discovery stations, etc)  The animal farm is now open but most of the animals were not available (probably due to the cold weather).  The staff there is very friendly and helpful.  We caught a movie at the planetarium and it was very good.   The screen is not the best quality but it was adequate.  When the weather is nice, the nature walk is lovely!  The pond, trails, and streams are beautiful.  Some of the pics I posted are from last year when it was warmer out.  The outdoor play area is great for the kids (again, weather permitting!)  Admission is reasonable but the planetarium shows are extra but still reasonably priced.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a natural history museum.
completion: My son loved it. Lots to looks at. Planetarium, farm, pond, walking trail, special events, live animals. We spent a few hours here. We didnt do the farm but will be back!!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a natural history museum.
completion:
This was such a cool place to learn about so many different things. Local history, habitats, and animals beginning in the Prehistoric Era. Informative and well maintained exhibits.

The planetarium show was really interesting to watch about the Artemis Mission.

Outside there is a wonderful shady trail that it a half mile that circles the property. There are really awesome exhibits outside as well as a play area for the kids, a pond, an old mill, a stone age heritage site and a Catawba Indian Village.

There is also a small farm that you can enjoy with live animals. The cost to enter is $3/pp but we ran out of time today.

This museum could be an all day place to take the kids, pack a lunch and sit at one of the inside tables to eat or at one of the many picnic tables outside.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a natural history museum.
completion: Really enjoyed the dinosaur exhibit. The planetarium show "The Sky at Night" was fantastic. The museum requires masks and that was fine. Highly recommend!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a natural history museum.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a natural history museum.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a natural history museum.
completion: I stopped to visit the museum while I was in the area. It has many exhibits that are typical of a natural history museum such as dinosaurs, minerals/rocks, eco system displays, birds, bugs, and other animals. It had an American Indian section and a specific North Carolina area which I thought were neat. There were also live animals in some places and I wasnt expecting that. The creepy house and exhibition was very interesting to me because it was based on a real person's experience finding out what was true or false in nature. Overall I would recommend it, some of the areas just seemed small to me or a little older.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a natural history museum.
completion:
We have lived in NC for 8 years and I wish we had discovered this place sooner!! This museum is fantastic for all ages.

From the life-size dinosaurs to the tiny creepy crawlers, my kids were engaged and eager to learn at every turn.

We came during a free Duke Energy Tuesday....they offer free admission twice a month and it wasn't crowded at all! I don't think many people know about the discount.

Everyone we saw was properly masked and social distancing wasn't an issue.

I can't wait to come back to check out The Farm and the planetarium!!

completion:
This is pretty cool place. I have 3 boys between the ages of 2-8 yrs old. The dinosaur exhibits were nice, with sounds and short films. The children's hands on vet/archiology clinic was super cool. The pirate ship was fun. We didn't get to do the planetarium because.. let's face it. My 2 year old wouldn't sit through it. They have small live animals to check out too like a possum, snakes, parie dog and turtles. On the back side of the building there's pigs and sheeps. There's a trail with a pond and other things. It's a nice cheap family outting.

I'm easy to please. I see a well put together museum of natural history with informative infographics and I'm happy.

The museum had some really nice exhibits an dinosaurs, and 'Creepy Nature' as well as a good permanent exhibit area.  The 'farm' area was a little disappointing, but that was probably due to it being November.   There were no staff around to answer questions or monitor the area that we could see.
The planetarium was small, but did a neat little show on the night sky.  Some of the non-sky images were blurry, and the show was definitely geared toward a younger audience than my just turned teenager, but we still enjoyed it.  Overall, I think it was well worth the $ and the time to make the stop while we traveled through the area!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a natural history museum.
completion:
The kids absolutely loved this place. Best money I've ever spent for an outing with the kiddos. The planetarium started the tour and the kids were amazed! Very interactive with even the youngest. There's tons of exhibits, the place just keeps on going and going. It honestly took the better part of 4 hours. Then the outdoor educational section with live animals. Pigs, goats, chickens, roosters, etc, etc. Even dinosaur fossils to check out. Many many live creatures in tanks as well. Owls, snakes, softshell turtles
And a native American section that's very large in itself. We will definitely not hesitate to come back every time we pass through this area. Finally been satisfied with what we get for the cause when it comes to entertaining four kids ages 2,4,6, and 8. Absolutely had a great time as an adult too.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a thai restaurant.
completion:
I live directly up the street from this place on Washington Ave and I have got to say that I am absolutely disappointed with their quality of food.  Today, I just recently ordered their Pad Kee Mao and it looked like someone chewed up the meal and spit it right back out into the carry out tray.  The noodles were overly soggy and mushed up like mashed potatoes.  The salad that comes with the Lunch looks as if someone cut out a large chunk from a piece of lettuce, threw it into the tray, and then decided to splash a little sauce on top of it.

I don't normally complain about food and most times I simply ignore the mistakes but I've been living in Bellevue for 3 years now and this incident has happened more than once.  A customer can only be patient so many times and then there comes a point where a enough is enough.  This restaurant will never receive my services ever again.  I don't know if it's the cook or the management but the quality of food is poor.  Years ago the food was much better. I'm not sure what happened between then and now.

If you want a quality restaurant for Thai food, go to Niky's Thai Kitchen.  I promise you, Niky's Thai Kitchen is the better choice.  Their food quality is suburb compared to Thai Tamarind, especially for the price you'll pay for it.

Please observe the images attached for evidence.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a thai restaurant.
completion:
Wonderful environment and delicious food. Zeta, our server, was ON IT. So sweet and attentive. First time here even though my home is so close, and I‚Äôm so happy to know I can get such authentic food nearby. They‚Äôve definitely earned a loyal customer!
PS. Try the spring rolls, I got a surprise one with my salad and I liked it so much I ordered a whole side.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a thai restaurant.
completion: Went to lunch here Saturday with my son. Limited parking in front of the restaurant but plenty of street parking nearby. Staff and service were excellent and cordial. Our Spicy Prig khing and Pad Thai were fresh, well-prepared, and visually appealing. I love the spices and asked for a five on their scale of five. It was delicious but not nearly as hot as I expected. Overall a great meal and I'd definitely recommend.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a thai restaurant.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a thai restaurant.
completion:
Well, it wasn't anywhere NEAR as good as a few years back but the presentation was decent. Of course the prices went up, lol. An almost 3 star. Almost. Sadly I can NOT recommend  Thai Tamarind any longer since the flavors were incredibly weak and/or bland; so much tasted like it came from a jar and the top of the line "thai spicy" was a powder they sprinkled on top of every dish when presenting your level of spicy. Some of the powder hadn't fully dissolved during your meal so you would gets little clumps of it in your mouth. The "so-called" Thai Iced Tea I had tasted as if it were a syrup from a bottle. Yech!

Pictured you have the Tom Yum soup, Volcano Chicken and the Thai Style Chicken Noodle. All bland and weak. Not pictured but as an appetizer we had the chicken satay, another huge let down since when eaten with a homemade peanut sauce or cucumber sauce, it is DELICIOUS! The peanut sauce seems to have some type of dairy added to it. Gross.

Seated WAY in the back corner in the last pic you'll see your "typical American Ken", who did nothing but complain from he moment he sat down. Entitled as "F".
DONT EAT HERE IF YOU DISAPPROVE of the restaurant or its style a**hole!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a thai restaurant.
completion:
SUPERB AUTHENTIC THAI in the Pittsburgh area, a short 15 min drive from downtown.  Cozy restaurant with no-touch menu, short and sweet. It looks a popular spot to locals of many persuasions. Takeout or sit in (I have done both), it‚Äôs simply excellent food. A FOODIE‚ÄôS GEM.

Start with Fresh Rolls and Fried Eggplant, contrasting but complementary textures and sweet tangy sauces that wake up the palate (very much unlike the cliche peanut sauce in the run of mill Thai-style places.

Any of the curry entrees are very good, smooth well-balanced sauces; none of that pungent sugar-loaded curry so common in so-called Thai restaurants in this town.

My recommendation: Duck Curry, very crispy well seasoned perfectly cooked duck atop the smooth Red curry with bell peppers and cherry tomatoes, carefully balanced with two halves of lychee just enough to brighten the palate: Simply Wow!

Pair the curry with any of the Thai stir fry veggies.  I‚Äôm partial to the Hot Basil fry, extra veggies (natural sweetness of the fresh vegetables complemented with their brown sauce).

By the way, enjoy Thai food with a spoon rather than fork/knife. Spoon the curry or veggies on rice, mix, then enjoy. Spoon allows one to taste every drop of the sauce.

Great service!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: I had high expectations for this property based on its category and price range. It did not deliver in accordance to its value and how it was advertised. The room I was initially given was not properly cleaned. There were clear signs that the fitted sheet was not laundered. I had to switch rooms, which unfortunately was a downgrade, and there were cleanliness issues in that room as well. The room amenities were lacking, which again is surprising based on category and price. The spa was closed, as well as the hot tub. Those items played a big role in my decision, so I was quite disappointed to find out they were closed. Why didn't the price and category reflect these changes. They are being very misleading, and that's enough to turn me away from Marriott properties. My main concern is they are still advertising as if they have everything together during these times and are charging inflated prices. I am highly upset I did not receive what was expected and now feel like my money put into this property is a major loss. The only thing that was nice is the customer service of the front office staff. The lady taking our breakfast room service order was a little off putting. There was a mistake made with my order. I called to let her know but she seemed upset at me for letting her know their mistake. It was corrected, but her tone was unsettling. The toast was overcooked and stale. Everything else, the omelet, pancakes, chicken sausage, bacon, and potatoes, was made fine. Unfortunately, I will not be returning to this property and do not recommend it.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Potential to be a great hotel, however my stay in room 537 left a lot to be desired. Room wasn't ready when's we arrived after 4 P.M.. prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Modern inside look, great breakfast being 5 stars.  The beds were way too soft and warn.  There was no moisturizer in the room, but mostly clean room. prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion:
I've stayed at a lot of Marriotts because of business trips in the past 10 years. They usually don't fall below a certain standard, but it seems in this case they did.

The rooms were pricey and we had booked a room with 2 queen beds and they gave us a room with a king and a sofa bed. Now you might think of this as an upgrade if you had a couple booking the room, but this was for 3 people and getting a sofa bed when you have paid for a queen. When i mentioned this in the app, they said they would fix it the next day and they did, and they have us the room right next to ours which made for a very easy transfer through the connecting door, which is what raised my review from 1 star to 2.

I suspect they changed our booking because they were having a convention and needed the room but this isn't an acceptable reason.

Other things that bothered me were the cleanliness of the rooms. I attached a couple of photos showing what our floor was like in the first room and the dirt inside the coffee maker. In both rooms, the coffee makers were terrible with one even having hair in it.

Finally it saddens me to see a sad attempt to look progressive with 3 places to charge an electric car. 2 Tesla spots of which 1 was it of order and 1 for non Tesla electric cars.

If you want to add electric car charging to your hotel add 10 spots not have a token amount and not even functional

I think they rely on the event housing so much they don't really care about their amenities is status of their rooms so much. Because every night we were there they had all least 2 events going on.

For the price and the quality, might as well just stay in mystic close to everything. I don't think I will be going back to this specific Marriott.

completion: The museum staff is knowledgeable and very courteous. After a few moments inside, you feel as though you have stepped back in time. The Jim Biggers exhibit in December was inspirational. It was a must see event. The gift shop sells quite a few unique items.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a miniature golf course.

The Peppermill Caf√© (formerly known as Peppermill Grill) is a dainty hidden gem located on Lake Michigan Ave. ‚ù§Ô∏èüåø

prompt: A Google Maps review about a american restaurant.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a american restaurant.
completion: Great food at good prices. Service was good even with a packed house. Ambiance isn't the greatest but whatever it's just a local joint offering good food.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a american restaurant.
completion: We had a coupon for this restaurant so we decided to check it out. The outside of the building was a little deceiving. It is a little more run down and looks smaller but don‚Äôt let this deter you. The employees were very friendly and the food was very good. The omelettes are stuffed full of ingredients and they are very large. Everything came out exactly as ordered and tasted very good! The price is average for most any breakfast restaurant..

prompt: A Google Maps review about a american restaurant.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a american restaurant.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a american restaurant.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a american restaurant.
completion: Delicious food! Good prices, and ample serving sizes. Surprisingly I have lived in the Grand Rapids area my whole life and just recently tried this place out for the first time a few weeks ago. I have been back twice since. And I definitely plan on going back! New favorite breakfast joint!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a american restaurant.
completion:
Wow this was our first time here! We came in to try the breakfast and we were not disappointed! The food was good and reasonably priced! The waitress Michelle was the best waitress! I just loved her personality!
We will be back!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a american restaurant.
completion: Less costly mom and pop type of situation. Offers plenty of choices for food with well proportioned plates. Coffee is typical diner drip brew. Fairly extensive wait on food to come out. Pictured, Monte Cristo with raspberry and the California omelette side of flapjack bigger than your face! 4 stars because I prefer fruit pur√©e over syrup and the service was a bit slow, although friendly enough. Perfect spot for feeding many and leaving full on a budget.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a american restaurant.
completion: Great food and great prices!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a american restaurant.
completion: Nice little 'Mom and Pop' breakfast and lunch restaurant in Standale. (Plenty of seating but they were a little short staffed to get the tables cleaned fast enough to seat people.) Waitress was polite and attentive and remembered all orders with no problem. Food was delicious. Price was excellent.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a american restaurant.
completion: Good food at a great price. We had the hash and the American specials.  The corned beef hash tasted homemade.  We had the rye toast and the raisin toast.  Both were toasted to perfection.  My husband said the Coffee was excellent.  I'll take his word on that.  I guess I never grew up enough to like coffee.  I'll stick to diet coke or pepsi.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a american restaurant.
completion: Ordered coffee and Monte Cristo for breakfast delicious.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a american restaurant.
completion: It's great every time. Fast and friendly service. Decent menu. Large portions. Great pancakes. Busy on Sunday mornings.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a american restaurant.
completion: I love the Peppermill. They have great food with surprising variety at low prices. I had the inside out grilled cheese. It has baby Swiss, cheddar, tomato, red onion, and avocado on parmesan crusted bread. It was amazing. The onion was flavorful and the creamy avocado made the two melted cheeses even better. The parmesan added another layer of crispness to each bite. I upgraded to tater tots instead of chips, and I was surprised at the large portion. My daughter had a pancake and tots. The pancake was huge, so she only managed half, but she did polish off her tots and some of mine. This was my second time there recently. I can't wait to go back!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a american restaurant.
completion: The absolute best breakfast around. Huge portions for very reasonable prices. They have breakfast and lunch options. The waitresses are all very friendly and work to help each other out. The pancakes are larger than the plate! Give the sugar bread a try. Yummy hazelnut coffee or hot chocolate covered in whip cream. A must visit. Don't let the wait scare you off on Sunday. It's well worth it.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a american restaurant.
completion: Friendly old school diner. Great prices

prompt: A Google Maps review about a american restaurant.
completion: Always delicious! So much goodness all on one plate.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a american restaurant.
completion: Awesome place and great people  with greater food it's are new breakfast  spot

prompt: A Google Maps review about a amusement centre.
completion: Really nice everything brand new really big but long-term price won‚Äôt work. We definitely will be going to the other trampoline places then to come here because of the prices. Arcade is over priced for what you can win. Which is like that almost everywhere. I do love that they have so many couches and lots of areas for the parents to sit and watch kids. Oh and you have to have non-grip socks and they don‚Äôt tell you that when you come in and they do not have prices for the Sox listed on their board either. They are three dollars a pair of socks and they don‚Äôt have any deals on them like if you buy multiple or a pack or anything to save money which is kind of crazy because if I knew beforehand I could‚Äôve bought some online for way cheaper from somewhere else. I like that you have to wear a electronic wristband that has a green and red light to tell you when your time is up. Everything is very Clean because it is a brand new building and equipment. I just hope it stays that way.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a amusement centre.
completion:
Spent several hours reading my book while my 11 and 14-year-old boys got plenty of exercise. (Adults don‚Äôt have to pay if they don‚Äôt plan on jumping) Many clean and comfortable couches to choose from for parents who want to relax and lots of fun activities for kids of all ages. I saw many small children and big children playing on many different things and it‚Äôs big enough that nobody was getting in each others way. Prices were not as high as expected for how huge and nice the facility is. Of course trampoline parks are pricey regardless but I thought it was worth the money. Will be back.
Side note: I‚Äôve been to several other trampoline parks and they play the best music at Hive by far.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a amusement centre.
completion: Really fun place to go. Only things are it is pricy (but everything is now) and they need self cleaning supplies (oh and a changing table‚Ä¶). My kids would live here if they could! Go Karts are fun but not as much when no one else is riding.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a amusement centre.
completion: Great place to bring your kids. (especially if you want to wear them out) tons to do...jumping, sliding, climbing, running, etc.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a amusement centre.
completion: The place is big and clean. All equipment is new but nobody monitors the activities. My son was jumping on the valo jump (picture attached) and other kids (I think ages 3-6y) joined them. I asked them to wait for their turns but they kept jumping. No parents around to educate their kids + no hive staff.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a amusement centre.
completion: This place is huge, clean, and impressive! We went in the morning, and it was really fun. My kids got a lot of fun and exercise in, in just an hour! Their favorite activity was the go-karts. They're silent, speedy, & so much nicer than outdoor gas ones. If you're short on time, you could even go here for a quick stop-in and do just the go-karts. We were helped by Chase, who was nice and knowledgeable, and Holland, who was helpful and fun. We were also able to talk with the owners on our way out, who were also very friendly, attentive, and excited about The Hive. Good vibes here! Go check it out!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a amusement centre.
completion:
Place has more to offer than those regular ones like airborne.
Blow up obstacles, go kart, team games, tramp virtual games.

Super clean and nice

prompt: A Google Maps review about a amusement centre.
completion: Love that we have this in Spanish Fork! Am awesome place to have fun. Not a big fan of the pricing. I can only imagine families with many kids, it can get pricey. Overall, a great place!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a amusement centre.
completion: Best trampoline park we‚Äôve ever visited. So many options, endless fun for the kids and parents, super comfy couches to sit while the kids jump. Great management. I‚Äôm so impressed!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a amusement centre.
completion: Very clean, staff very friendly and helpful. My grandson loved it there. Well staffed and lots of supervision.  Safe place.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a amusement centre.
completion:
Great place, definitely glad to have it near us. Yes it costs more than Hang Time, but it has more to offer. Plus a bunch of couches and several massage chairs for adults.
At Hang Time I'm always worried about where my smaller kids are because you can't keep a good eye everywhere. Feels like it's for older kids and young adults with more trampolines for tricks.

What I like about The Hive it's good for kids of all ages. There's a tetherball with jumping around it. Two interactive video game screens that actually show their picture on screen as they jump, so fun!
Zip line, jumping basketball, targets, go carts (costs extra), the biggest bounce house/obstacle course I've ever seen. Regular trampolines too, rock wall, ninja warrior obstacles, slack line.

There are drinking fountains, but they're by the go carts (kind of annoying they're so far).
They also have bands to wear that have lights that change color when your time is up. They do have lockers as well.
Overall, we'll go again, but less frequently because of the cost. Still, i thought it was worth it, especially for families with kids.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a amusement centre.
completion: Probably the best trampoline park in the state, at least from what I‚Äôve been too. Very clean, which is the most important. Huge bounce house setup too, even for adults, which is fun. Zip line and video-game type jumps too. Decent pricing. Even Go-Carts for a little bit extra!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a amusement centre.
completion: Best of the best! We go to Family Entertainment businesses around the country and I haven‚Äôt seen a place this quality anywhere else. I‚Äôve seen a few reviews complaining about the price but it‚Äôs well worth it and pricing is more than fair for this premium experience. You really have to go nothing in this review will give this place justice. My kids went for 2 hours and didn‚Äôt want to leave and afterwards they couldn‚Äôt stop talking about it! We can‚Äôt wait to go back !!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a amusement centre.
completion: This place is so fun! From the arcade, to the trampolines and the go karts! We had a blast! The staff was busy, but they were friendly the entire time! We will be back!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a amusement centre.

the food here is awesome and you get plenty. we walked in at 20 min to closing, i know bad on us. the wait staff didnt seem to mind as they were super friendly. i would say this has been one of the better mexican eatery's we have found in our travels. my dish was great, the meat so tender and juicy. my wife really liked her chicken tacos.
