prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: We're trucker park here for the night. Every time we stopped here we always go to the bar. Nice ambiance, very clean bathroom. Great customer service. Crispiest fried chicken we've ever had, it was delicious. Love there steak fries. Salad was good too. Couple of beer and we're good.. Keep this place clean. Free dump and water for RV and large car.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Clean from one end of the complex to the other. Great staff. Comfortable rooms. Lacks a real restaurant, but the short order grill serves up food that is pretty good at a reasonable price.  Very friendly towards pro drivers - CDL rates for rooms,  plenty of truck parking (you can park a bob tail right by the hotel), separate truck stop at diesel island.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Little America is a great place to stop when driving across Wyoming.  The restaurant has good selections, there are lots of travel treats to pick up for the road, and the gas is always a good price with easy access off/on the interstate.  Be sure to get a picture with Emperor.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Lots of parking. 2 stores. 1 for truckers and 1 for cars. Each one has a small fast food restaraunt. Plenty of choices on the menu. Large clean restrooms.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion:
Two stars because of the tiny bathroom.this tiny bathroom had two doors going into it. One from the bedroom, and one from the front room/bedroom.
The place is adorable! What a throwback to yesteryear! Theplumbing going into the wall in the bathroom was shoddily done. The it was just a hole in the wall without the tile put around it professionally. If you are 5 feet tall then the shower will be perfect for you. Beds were exceedingly hard. Dogs are only $10. Room was $104 which is quite expensive for where it is.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Make this a must stop on your 80 drive. This was one of the nicest gas stations I've been to; they even had lounge chairs in the bathroom! A great selection of drinks, snacks, and fresh food. Plus it's a Sinclair so the cute dinosaur is out front.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Clean, well appointed rooms in a pleasing colonial style setting. 24 hour deli, 75 cent ice cream cones - an must stop Oasis...

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: This place is a must !!! Big, comfortable, quiet rooms. Great restaurant as well. Even saw a lot of wildlife right behind hotel. Would definitely recommend. I travel a lot and have high expectations. This hotel met them all !!!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Very neat quaint stop.  Lawn is nice for pets.  Lots of food choices.  And the room is so absolutely cute!!!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: An experience all unto itself, Little America is an historic bit of motoring Americana; a nicely-kept, relaxing hotel, diner, playground, gas station, and gift shop out in the wide-open of Wyoming along Interstate 80.  Stop in and fill up your tank, fill up your stomach, snag a gift or a bit of road trip memorabilia, or check in for a good night's sleep.  The place has been here since 1934, and continues to offer motorists a nice respite from the road.  No, it's not The Ritz, but there is no Ritz within 500 miles, and there's plenty to enjoy right here.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Very nice place, restrooms were the nicest I've seen. They even fold the end of the toilet paper in the stalls.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion:
Absolutely love the 'vintage' decor! Like stepping back in time! Room is clean. Really great room for the rate.
Would be 5 stars if there were a microwave in the room. It's a very long walk to the truck stop to use a microwave. Also,
We were told there is a tub. No tub in this room. Bummer. As a trucker, a tub is a luxury.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: 50¬¢ ice cream cones, clean bathrooms, hot food, gas and play area! We travel from East coast to West coast and back several times and this remains a great place to stop, either with the kids or without. Open 24-7, it's a great pit stop. The kids love it and don't mind shopping for that odd something you don't find elsewhere in the gift shop. It's strategically placed in the middle of nowhere, but has just what's needed. The lawns are green and it's surrounded by trees. A true desert Oasis.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Restrooms were acceptable, but not especially clean. Lots of fun shopping, which was nice, since the food took sooooooooo long. We were really on a time crunch to get to our next destination, due to car trouble, and it took 38 minutes to get 2 meals of 3 chicken strips each. I do not recommend using this as a meal stop...

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: The bathrooms had a cleanliness rating of: fair. I didn't check the actual crapper stalls though. Place was bustling and had a long line if you wanted to get any of the foods they offer. Kids run rampant in this place, you've been advised.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Food and fuels stop. Nice place with ice cream cones for $.50 or something like that. The food is good too. We kept seeing penguins on the souvenirs, which didn't make sense a first but ask the lady at the checkout!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Ate at the lounge/bar, didn‚Äôt know it was even there. :) It was very good, considering the food/deli in the fuel desk side is pretty much hit or miss. The portions were large, the food was very good and the service was great! It got pretty busy in there when we were leaving and the server although very busy and by himself still provided excellent service and even refilled our drinks. I definitely would recommend this place.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion:
Nice clean truck stop with some pretty good made to order food at the fuel island, 4 wheeler gas station, or at the restaurant.   Have always found truck parking here even at 1 am.

Love the little lounge just to the left of the motel check-in/receptionist area.  Pretty close to a full bar and they sell packaged liquor/beer to go.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: My girls loved it and deemed our large double queen room with pink tiled bathroom - a princess room. The beds were comfortable and we had one of our best nights sleep there during our travels. The bathroom fixtures are a bit strange but it just takes a bit of testing to get it right. Overall the hotel was very quiet for us despite the property doubling as a 24 hour truck stop. We were in a very quiet unit (no pets). I've heard others say the other units can be noisier (pets allowed) as they are closer to the trucking amenities. Lastly, there is a playground and fun statues for the kids to get on - the Sinclair dinosaur and a giant buffalo. There is a once live penguin in the check in area. Really cool place with gorgeous Wyoming scenery. Planning a big family trip there again with more relatives! What a find.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: I didn't stay at the hotel but I've stopped here several times for a food break and fuel stop. Bathrooms are clean. The tables could be better cleaned/maintained as customers leave. The food is good. I had the chicken bacon wrap on this visit. Fuel station is large and has I think 12 stalls for autos. Good place to stop.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: So happy this place had last minute availability on Labor Day! So pet friendly with $10 upcharge for 2 dogs. There is a huge grassy area and nobody seems to care that my well mannered dogs were off leash. Cute store/deli, gas station and a little lounge that rocks (ish) til 10. Trucker parking is plentiful and on the other side.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: It's a little oasis in the middle of nowhere. Fifties original decor, middle America greasy diner food, truck stop for the ages. There is even a fake deer mount that they'll drop ship for 600 USD. Clean rooms, breakfast not included. It's a slice of Americana you may or may not want to miss.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Very much appreciated the old/new furniture and decor, great bed and I loved the bathroom. I really love staying in these places that aren't like the new, remodeled, turn key everything. What a great experience with all the amenities. Food was good and very easy to order. I hope places like these stay in business for a while.  It's s fun visiting them.  An oasis in the desert, almost literally. Good customer service and great ice cream cones ( especially the prices at $75 a piece).

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion:
Very nice little place in the middle of nothing. I mean there is literally nothing around for miles. That being said this is a nice little place that is reasonably priced. We got the deluxe room. They are old fashioned style but well maintained and is basicall like a suite. In a big city you would pay top dollar for a room like this but our rate was close to $100... not bad at all. Definitely recommend if you are traveling and going to pass through here this would be a great place to stop and get some rest...

They hotel grill closes at 10pm which no one told us but if you are really hungry you can head over to the truck travel center, that grill is open 24 hours...

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: I ordered their short stack with a side of bacon and coffee. The cakes were huge, they covered a 10" dinner plate and were very thick and fluffy. The bacon was thick cut and the best bacon I've eaten in at least 6 months. All in all I was impressed with the quality and quantity of the breakfast!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion:
By far the cleanest hotel I've ever stayed in. Comfortable beds.
It was like traveling back in time. I love all the antiques and views.
Pet friendly too.
Room 174

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: i can't say enough about the people who work here, especially in the garage. After a motorcycle breakdown the staff went beyond just being the best and got me and the bike to Salt Lake City to the motorcycle shop and dealer. Thank you.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Endless truck parking. Small pet area to let the doggies roam leash free. They also have a nice grill that cooks up quick delicious food at least for a truck stop.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion:
We LOVE western Wyoming's Little America! This was the first Little America we ever visited (over two years ago) and it is our favorite by far! (Little America Flagstaff is a close second.) We've never stayed at the hotel, but the travel center is excellent!

The shower rooms are always spotless and so cozy, each having its own huge, glass-doored, tile shower, and a separate soaking tub as an added bonus that we always look forward to. Showers are $12, and they provide mineral bath gel, bars of soap, and plenty of clean, warm towels. We stop solely for the amazing showers, but stick around a little longer for the food.

The grill has exceeded our expectations as far as a travel center food stop goes - the menu is kinda limited, but they have several different choices, from burgers to breakfast to fried chicken. The food is made to order and everything we've had has been so delicious. (My personal favorite is the breakfast burrito with sausage gravy.) The grill is also open 24 hours a day and serving everything on the menu all day long. Sure beats a basic fast food stop at any of the other travel centers!

In our experience, the staff at this location have been very friendly, welcoming, and happy to meet whatever need that arises, round the clock. If you're a trucker, get here early (or super late night) if you hope to find a parking spot. This is the last travel stop for a while if you're eastbound, and the veteran drivers already know how awesome this place is, so the lot fills up quick and there's usually a ton of create-a-spot tetris going on come nightfall.

The Little America experience is never short of amazing for us, and so memorable that every time we leave we can hardly wait until our next visit! Plus, they have a great view from the parking lot. Rolling hills, plateaus, and snow-capped mountains are hard to beat!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Please be advised that the truck fuel center is under construction in you have to go over to the area where the car is parked to get any type of services bathroom places amazing

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Always a great place as I pash through. Space for truckers such as myself.. Nice helpful staff..super clean.. Go and experience it yourself and the simple vanilla ice cream cone is so delicious

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: I love it !! They have a lot of truck parking, the ice cream was delicious and the food. The housekeeper was super nice and sweet !!!!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: This is one of the few remaining independent truck stops in America. They have a large parking lot for trucks. Clean showers, two stores and plenty of food choices. Also the 75cent ice cream cones make me want to scream for ice cream. Just as a reminder to my fellow truck drivers the parking lot ain't your urnal or your trash can.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Stayed in my truck. The truck side bathrooms leave a lot to be desired. The car side was awesome! Food wasn't anything to write home about. Had the cheeseburger and fries the night before and it was totally flavorless. Had the jam eggs hashbrowms and toast for breakfast and it was worse, if that's possible. Got my eggs scrambled with cheese and the cheese ended up on my toast.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Little America is a good option if you need a break from freeway driving. The bathrooms are clean and the convenience store has about anything you need while traveling. The grill has decent options if you want a hot meal. Gas prices here are always inflated so I generally choose to fill up elsewhere. The hotel rooms seem clean, but the decor is very interesting; it reminds me of furniture and decorations my grandma would have had in her house back in the 70s or 80s. The service has always been pretty good. If you ever get caught in one of Wyoming's infamous 1-80 winter storms, Little America can be a refuge.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Large parking, fresh food,clean restrooms,when I was there they had a really nice Christmas atmosphere with lights and music,it felt very nice.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Beautiful little old fashion rooms with multiple bedrooms. Every convenience surrounding or within hotel to include it's own bar, gas station and store.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Still an iconic stop when travelling through Wyoming.  Pool was down... during peak summer, which was enough for us to continue on.  No longer a dedicated restaurant andngoft shop, which was disappointing.  However the grounds are still beautiful and the rest of the hotel seems unchanged.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Awesome place to stop! Cheap ice cream cones, Deli, rotisserie chicken, hot and cold drinks, awesome Donuts and friendly customer service. Lots of truck parking, showers on, ATM and a very comfortable Lounge. They also have seating near the deli. They have your standard cold to go Foods and Novelty items in store.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion:
Quiet.  Fun.  Great customer service. Fantastic gift shop.  Ice cream cones are a must at the grill.

Great little playground for the kids.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion:
This is a nice Oasis on a long drive. It is clean, well maintained, has friendly employees and a great place to stop with kids because there is a grassy playground.
It would sure be great to see souvenirs from America as opposed to China and Pakistan. Give American artists an opportunity to be part of Little America.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Great place, must stop for ice cream. Free trailer dump. Clean and nice people.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Window screen is broken, blinds are to. No fridge and no hot water. I'm sure front desk was aware when they booked me my room. Room is hot as hell and its November in Wyomning. So disappointed.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: I loved it here.  Nice room, reasonable price.  HBO.  Lots of souvenirs.  You can get something to eat 24 hrs a day.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion:
03-19-19 Back for a shower. Maybe a soak in the bathtub. And definitely some home cooking from the kitchen where the big rigs park.

08-7-18  OMG this little kitchen cooks THE best bacon. Hands down. Also the scalloped breakfast potatoes are excellent and with the very good gravy. It's better than home cooked. (Almost) it IS the next best. Good job to the travel center kitchen crew. Oh ya and the pancakes, they are using Krusteaz mix, it never comes out this good for me at home üëçüëç.

05-16-18 This morning bacon fried eggs English muffin and hash browns. I feeling like I'm eating at home, the best.
Hmmm. Deep fried peanuts? Says you can eat em she'll and all.

05-06-18 Chocolate glazed today. And bacon cooked to perfection. French toast.

04-01-18 Have only seen the truck side. Very good kitchen there and travel store. Good prices on deli food.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: I've been coming here since I was little to get the 25cent ice cream and browse the gift shop. This is the first time I've stayed. Loved the 3 double beds room.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: This is the most amazing place. Free dumping!!!! Free fresh water!!! Everything is reasonably priced!!!The photos u see were taken by where we parked our rv for free! They have everything you need! Restaurant, laundry, post office, gift store, friendly Staff!!! We stayed for three nights and of course contributed $150 in sales from food, gas, and the gift store! Reasonable prices! Best spot! Free rv dumping and fresh water!!!!! I have asked employees for stuff that is a little beyond what is offered and the answer is always yes and with a smile! They have 17 marble showers and lots of washers and dryers with a great room to wait in and watch tv and they have devices in the room to plug in your laptop and charge your phone while u wait. The WiFi could b better.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion:
Had to stay here because of my truck broke down. 01/30/22 -01/31/22
Edited:
I haven‚Äôt complained about it right away because I checked in around 2:30am. I was just exhausted. But, I left a long notice on your check out card.

Bedding were covered in some paint and someone‚Äôs hair. Also, the cleaning lady starts knocking doors around at 8:50am despite the check out at 11am and eventually wakes you up!WHY????
Hopefully, won‚Äôt have to stay here again.
And of course nobody will reply. Because there‚Äôs nothing to say, right guys?!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Hotel is extremely outdated and staff needs to brush up on their customer service skills. The property probably hasn't had any sort of renovation since the 90's and it is long overdue. I was offered a package when I checked in which included a discount if I spent $30 in the gift shop/restaurant/gas station. I was told to bring back my receipts and they would apply the discount. The next morning I went into the front desk with my receipts only to be told I needed to turn them in the night before. I told the front desk attendant that I was not informed that it had to be turned in the same day I checked in, only to bring my receipts back and the front desk lady would take off the discount.  The front desk attendant rudely said,  "yeah her and she's not here". I then asked for a manager who quickly resolved the problem. If you're going to have a strict policy on how long customers have to turn in receipts for credits on a package I didn't even ask for then you need to inform the customers of that policy. Additionally, having a bad attitude with a customer who was obviously not informed correctly by your staff will not earn you business. I will NEVER stay here again!  Gross, outdated and rude staff!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: This place is awesome, and super unexpected in the middle of nowhere. I feel like they could charge whatever they want for their food since they have pretty much no competition, but it was some of the most fairly priced food we've ever had. I had a massive stack of pancakes and was super happy with them. Plus there is lots of room for kids to get their energy out!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion:
Ok, I don‚Äôt like giving less then 5-stars, but between the broken shower head, super slow service & it seemed like everyone was confused/out of it. The food was ok, but between waiting 15 min to order and another 15 for a pancake/bacon, then the condition of the showers (which they were CLEAN! Big difference between clean and something broken, clearly a better cleaning staff then repair staff), I was kinda disappointed after going to another Little America, (AZ I think...)
I will go back though, still got a great sense of safety compared to other truck stops, which makes it super worth it:)

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Really disappointed, I couldn't order anything because I can't justify a 15$ cheese burger or a 100$ hotel room. Especially in Wyoming. Bathroom was fairly dirty and the sinks don't work.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Nicest roach motel I've stayed at.  It looks cute and quaint from a distance, but don't be fooled into booking a room there.  AC was not adequate.  Had to leave the sliding patio door open for air, which was really hard to move because it was off its rollers.  It was also not secure because the patio is shared with every room on that side of the building.  The room was not clean.  There was trash left from the previous occupant: receipt in the dresser, pizza crust under the bed, comb on the bathroom sink, and water in the ice bucket.  There was a brown crusty substance on the edge of the bathroom garbage can.  The bed sheets were too short and because I'm tall my feet were rubbing on the rough protective pad underneath.  Both beds were like that but I was the only one tall enough to notice.  The map of the grounds they gave us was a bad copy and it was hard to read the amenities.  I thought there might be a nicer version in the amenities book in the room but the book had nothing in it at all.  This means we knew nothing about the hotel other than what was on the bad map.  We didn't have any phone numbers to call for service or if it was possible to order food from the restaurant.  We went in the pool, which had several places where it had cracked and was missing chunks of concrete and tiles.  The deep end separation floaters were all destroyed and were held up by the rope.  We avoided several bad sections of the pool due to it's horrible condition.  When we checked out in the morning it was so early (6:15 AM) that we had to check out at the gift shop and the staff there were not pleasant.  This was also where you payed for gas, and it had the restaurant in it.  The restaurant menu was horrible.  I couldn't order anything due to the limited menu.  The payment system was down and they didn't seem to have a manual backup system so we had to wait, delaying our departure.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: We stopped for the dollar ice cream cones-yummy!! The place is filled with tourists which is fine since this is a road trip stop off. The gift shop was overwhelming-they sell so much stuff. I am not complaining because when I travel I enjoy stopping on the road to stretch and take a break-this is perfect for doing that and since the gift shop is so filled with snacks and souvenirs you‚Äôll be sure to find something for everyone. Or just stop for the ice cream cones-it‚Äôs worth it!!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: This was an awesome place to stop for a break on our cross US roadtrip! I can't wait for the trip back to do some more explaining!. We didn't stay at the hotel, we were just passing through to eat, fill up the tank, stretch our legs and play on the playground!.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion:
The suite we were in was beautiful. Like walking into grandmas house. Our sitting room furniture was very comfortable. The whole room was clean and my wife loved having a place to do her makeup.  Beautiful grounds And the hallway wasn‚Äôt dirty. Something I‚Äôve never seen is the refrigerator and microwave Are in the bathroom but they blend with the decor so it‚Äôs kinda cool.  Some negatives. 1. Where you check in is not the hotel you have to drive to your room or as for me (truck driver) squeeze your truck in their parking lot or walk half a mile to get to the suite. 2. Small bathtub. 3. Short shower. If your tall your going to have to bend to get your head under the shower. 4. Pillows got rock hard after laying on them for a few minutes 5. Very few phone charger stations.

They do serve buffalo burgers in the convenient store and the do have a small restaurant in the hotel lobby. They also charge a 20$ incidental fee when you check in.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Pretty neat little truck stop. The cafe is great! Open 24/7 as well. They sell a variety of items. Including cricket snacks?!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: We were getting tired and decided to stop here for the night.  We have been visiting this place off and on for many years but had not ever spent the night.  We were surprised at how reasonable the prices were and the rooms were clean and actually stylish.  Made it feel like a small apartment.  Seem to be fairly well sound insulated as I did not hear much nose which made for a good night's sleep.  The little store has beer which rocked after a long day of driving!!  The staff was friendly and helpful.  I will be making a point to stay here in the future.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Full filled our basic need for a night's sleep while we avoided snowy highways.   Dated interior includes a light baby pink tiled bathroom.  Pine headboard needs securing to the wall, otherwise that could disturb the neighbors.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: It was like sleeping in a mid century museum. Very clean and comfortable. We could not get wi fi in our room or I would have given it 5 stars.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: I always stop here on my trips between Reno and Denver. The grounds are nicely manicured and the store has a large selection of food, drinks, and travel supplies. They have a grill with reasonably price food and $0.75 vanilla ice cream cones to sweeten the stop! While I have never stayed the night, the hotel has a Victorian style feel to it and the employees wear cute vintage uniforms. The restrooms are usually pretty clean and employees have always been helpful and friendly.  I will continue to make it a pit stop on my travels.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion:
I have driven by little America a few time on trips. I had to do some work in Wyoming so this time I stayed there. Really cool place, kind of takes you back in time.
Nothing really negative to say. The key system is a little different. It‚Äôs a electronic metal key. Had some issues getting it to work in my door. Maintanance came got it open. But even the next day it didn‚Äôt work as quickly as it should. Kind of had to find it‚Äôs sweet spot. I don‚Äôt think it would have been as much of an issue during the summer. It was about 10 degrees out while I‚Äôm screwing around with it.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: A great travel stop with friendly service, good, freshly-cooked comfort food and in room convenience as well as motel style access.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: 5 stars for the quality 75cent ice cream cones. Hands down best stop going through Wyoming.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Nice hotel rooms at a decent price. Friendly staff, good food. Made the unexpected pit stop enjoyable.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion:
I was road tripping from Denver, CO to Salt Lake, UT and saw a bunch of signs for this place. We had decided  to stop on a whim. Turns out to be a little truck/road trip stop spot.

The place is a little campy and lovely. Clean bathrooms. Plenty of parking. Overall its a great spot to stop and chill for a bit.

Also, 75 cent ice cream cones!!!!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: We stopped to fill up with gas and purchase some snacks at the extremely well stocked retail store! This store has everything! You want popcorn? They got üçø!!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Becareful when you but something. An item I choose said $16.99 but rang up $19.99. They reimbursed me but it was a hassle. Also I took a picture of history, a large picture of this dinner in 1956. Not a single ethnic person is being served at the counter. Good thing we as a country has come a long way.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Good food at reasonable prices, always very clean, plenty of parking, and an overall fantastic place to stop. Always enjoy stopping here.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Very clean and great parking for travelers. They only have a fast food menu and the hamburger we got was overcooked and dry. Still thankful they are in such a remote place.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Had to stop for ice cream and as usual, the bathrooms were great.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: The guys marketing this place do an incredible job making you feel like you haven‚Äôt been to I-80 Wyoming if you haven‚Äôt stopped and had an ice cream cone at Little America. And for 75 cents, it‚Äôs not a bad stop at all. My son counted over 40 Little America billboard signs coming in from the eastbound road.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a bistro.
completion: Amazing value for an incredible meal. We dine with 4 guest total, all ordered something different. Each dish was delicious, there was nothing we didn‚Äôt like dish to the bread and salted butter. Service was on point and the view was great. 10/10 would recommend

prompt: A Google Maps review about a bistro.
completion: This is amazing. Only problem was possibly the amount of oil or grease that was in the food. Our server Greg I believe was super nice.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a bistro.
completion: Been a very long time since we have been here but glad we returned. Had a delicious meal with great ambience. 4 course meal was the only option which worked out great for us. Wine is pricey though. Had mussels, sole, salmon, duck breast, chocolate mousse and creme brulee. Also a small fried rice ball with a curry aioli as amuse bouche very arancini like.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a bistro.
completion: it was amazing! true culinary food

prompt: A Google Maps review about a bistro.
completion: We sat at the Chef's table tonight (6/14/19), were served by Kira, Jenn and Chef John. We had such a wonderful time through great service, top notch food and a remarkable atmosphere, that I spontaneously proposed to my girlfriend (without even having a ring). If that doesn't deserve 5 stars, nothing does. Our food included escargot, French onion soup, asparagus soup, halibut, the filet medallions, and the mousse dessert. We also had several drinks, and our bill was under $180. A FABULOUS value compared to many 5-star restaurants. Thank you, Joe (RIP), and we will be back!!!!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a bistro.
completion: Our family was there on Easter Sunday. The three course meal was absolutely fabulous. Even though the Bistro was busy, we never felt rushed, and we truly enjoyed our meal. Laura our server was professional and very attentive. Sam was so sweet and made our dining experience very special. This was our son‚Äôs family‚Äôs first outing with their six month old son. It couldn‚Äôt have been a more positive. Thank You so much! We will be back for dinner!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a bistro.
completion:
Our wedding at Lake Park Bistro was absolutely perfect. We had a tented reception with cocktail hour on the gorgeous East Balcony with stunning views of Lake Michigan. The restaurant's white pillars were a perfect location for photos and the surrounding park offered more beautiful options all with in a walking distance. The staff was fantastic and our guests were thrilled with their prompt and friendly service. We also received many, many compliments on the food from our family and friends; even those ‚Äòhard to impress‚Äô said their meal at Lake Park Bistro was the best they‚Äôd ever had at a wedding. However, the best thing about Lake Park Bistro was working with Dan. He made us feel comfortable and welcome every step of the way and provided us with excellent advice to make our day fun and stress-free. Dan was clear in all of our communications and went above and beyond to host a meeting for myself and my other vendors. His honest feedback and recommendations helped make our day personal, special, and truly, the best day of our lives. We truly can not say enough about our wonderful experience at Lake Park Bistro, thank you Dan and team!!

(Photos from Dawn Silva Photography)

prompt: A Google Maps review about a bistro.

Their fresh warm bread and butter is served to you as needed by the servers. They really take care of you here and the view overlooking Lake Michigan doesn't hurt either!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a bistro.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a bistro.
completion: Amazing experience, the waiter Chris and his partner rocked and we cant wait to go back! The lamb, filet mignon and you cant go french without a creme brulee which was was delicious as well!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a bistro.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a bistro.
completion: Amazing food and service.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a bistro.
completion:
I thought my mom and I would have really enjoyed this restaurant, but we were a bit underwhelmed and feel that Le Reve in Tosa and Pastiche in downtown are better options in Milwaukee for French cuisine.

Things we liked:
‚Äîthe view of Lake Michigan
‚Äîfree parking!
‚Äîthe butter (kinda random, but it was really good!)
‚Äîthe wine pairings for the Menu de Chef
‚Äîthe service from our waiter‚Äôs assistant (I think her name was Michelle)
‚Äîmy dessert, which was an Earl Grey pot de creme with honey brittle and lavender chantilly creme. The bright, lemony Riesling was a perfect pair.

Things we didn‚Äôt care for:
‚Äîour waiter made the same spiel for the specials at every table and became a broken record.
‚Äîthe soup l‚Äôoignon was so-so, a little too sweet
‚Äîthe entrees could have used more vegetables to brighten up the plate
‚Äîmy filet was well-done when I ordered it rare, but they were quick to fix that
‚Äînoisy in our room and was difficult to maintain conversation
‚Äîwe got a bit of a pretentious air to the place

Overall, this place was nice, but didn‚Äôt knock our socks off. However, I would go there again for drinks and dessert.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a bistro.
completion: Amazing meals delicious deserts perfect lunch for my daughters birthday just what she wanted

prompt: A Google Maps review about a bistro.
completion:
Went for my birthday and it was a perfect meal. The fois gras was superior to the ones I had in France. The squab was a first and well worth every bite. The scallops with shaved truffles were seared to perfection. Plus, they had a wonderful birthday card!

Can't wait to go back in the summer and enjoy the view of the lake!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a bistro.
completion: Lovely place, service, menu, food, wine... Always a great experience to return to. Top 3 things I miss from WI after moving to Scottsdale.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a bistro.
completion: Always has been an eating experience. Love the new 4 course menu there are so many delicious options. I highly recommend it.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a bistro.
completion: It was very nice. Good service, Great food!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a bistro.
completion: Beautiful location, quaint and romantic atmosphere with outstanding staff that goes the extra mile for you to have a positive experience. Our waitress Sharon was superb, she made sure our experience was one of a kind. High quality food that was made to perfection. Thank you for the amazing dinner!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a bistro.
completion: Amazing service and outstanding food. The room was slightly upscale, but welcoming. A must for any special occasion!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a bistro.
completion: Food is amazing and views are just as great! Love going to Sunday brunch here!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a bistro.
completion: LPB has been our favorite for a long time and we we're thrilled to learn they re-opened. The service was stellar and VERY safe however we were not quite thrilled with our  food. It was almost as if the kitchen has an entirely new staff.. perhaps new suppliers/wholesalers??  My Oeuf Mollet avec Champignons des Bois was prepared differently, the mussels were definitely different. And my favorite fois gras dish has a new bland fruit or vegetable to accompany it vs the old one which was a sweet fruit that was such a great compliment to such a savory protein. Lastly,  I had a lobster entree that was prepared in a "beef stock" like base... Almost like it should have accompanied beef vs. fresh lobster. I hate to sound harsh but I am just being honest.  And FYI the menu is now a set 3 or 4 course menu. We will certainly come back however having eaten here so many times for so many special occasions.. we were a bit disappointed compared to any previous visit.  One last note.. just a thought... Why is it I cannot find a desert chef in Milwaukee who makes Panna Cotta? The last time we found it was at Chistopher's (now closed/new owner perhaps) in Sister Bay. That was approximately 10 years ago..I will finish by staring the lemon desert we had was excellent!!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a bistro.
completion: Absolutely stunning dishes & drinks, paired with amazing service. Hakim, our server, was excellent and made the birthday dinner with my girlfriend a much more special and memorable experience. The food is elegant and delicious. Everything was cooked to perfection. The cocktails were fantastic and the bartender was great! Would highly recommend going here for an intimate dinner with a beautiful lake view or to get together with old friends.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a bistro.
completion: This fantastical gem of a bistro is a must have for any Milwaukee foodie. With a creative Parisian inspired menu, a well balanced ambiance, and a talented service staff, this place exudes elegance at every corner. If that's not enough, their executive chef Adam was nominated and awarded a James Beard award!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a bistro.
completion:
I can't believe I've lived in Milwaukee for 30 years, and have never visited this restaurant.
We both had the most amazing French onion soup ever. I had hanger steak which was tasty, and my hubby had quail and skate (which is stingray) which he didn't care for.

The service was excellent and I got chocolate cake for my birthday. The decor is beautiful and the location is on Lake Michigan.

We will be back for the soup for sure.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a bistro.
completion: The Dover Sole is excellent! The Martinis are overpriced.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a bistro.
completion: Super beautiful setting. Nice and kind wait staff. Gave us special treatment on our anniversary.  Will be back!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a bistro.
completion: This place is AMAZING!! I Had the brunch special which is 3 courses. Had the cream of asparagus soup which was to die for. Then eggs Benedict with spinach and crab. Mmmm. Will finish with custard. I'll be back. Plus I didn't have to wait for anything!!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a bistro.
completion: Fantastic food, atmosphere and service!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a bistro.
completion: Had the pleasure of dining here during my trip to Milwaukee. I definitely enjoyed my experience. Everything was cooked to perfection. I started with the Moules Marini√®re. The mussels were cooked to perfection and sauce was very light and fragrant. Then I tried the Fondue de Gruy√®re Aux Asperges which was very flavorful. For my main plate, I had the Fricass√© de Homard and the lobster was cooked so delicately that it nearly melted in my mouth. And lastly for dessert I had the delicious Mousse au Chocolat "Yves Camdeborde." Wish I hadn't came so late so I could check out the view everyone spoke about but I still loved every minute of my meal.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a bistro.
completion: Always a favorite destination, Bartolottas Lake Park Bistro is nestled in lake Park with a great view of the lake.  We like to start with an old fashioned at the bar and then try to get a window view.  I enjoyed the best medium rare ribeye with brussel sprouts.  My wife went for the filet mignon and scallops.  As always, we grabbed a few desserts to share.  The chocolate mousse with praline crust was my fave!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a bistro.
completion: The food is really good and there is a nice view of lake Michigan. We were there when they had the air show so while we ate you were able to see Jets and planes fly but with a beautiful view of the lake

prompt: A Google Maps review about a bistro.
completion: Great experience - and food!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a bistro.
completion: Fantastic gastronomic dinner for a fair price!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a bistro.
completion: Fantastic! They small portion, but its very filling. The food was great and great service!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a bistro.
completion: A very special restaurant, great food, service and ambiance.  Expensive but worth it.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a bistro.
completion: A wonderful Valentine's Day celebration with Great food, Great service and Great View!  Thank you!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a bistro.
completion: Went to celebrate my fiance's 35th birthday.  I was a little late but they were just as nice.  They made him a card and gave a birthday dessert, which I didn't expect at such a nice restaurant.  Highly recommend the cheese plate! The steak he had was delicious! Im definitely returning!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a bistro.
completion: Food was amazing my ribeye was cooked beautifully.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a bistro.
completion:
Really enjoyed our visit here. We came here for the annual fall mushroom dinner and got to taste a great spread of delicacies and unique mushrooms. We enjoyed about 18 different mushrooms blended into our 6 course meals paired with wine! Everything was delicious.

This was our first time here and glad we decided to be here to enjoy the special evening. We got seated right away and the staff were so polite. We also had some food restrictions and our server attended to us right away addressing that. He just made us feel very comfortable and ensured us that the request has been taken care off.

We visited here for dinner but I would love to visit here again during the day because based on the location, it overlooks the beautiful Lake Michigan and I can only imagine how gorgeous the view would be from the hill top! It's an upscale restaurant and is great for special occasions! They offer a lot of speciality themed dinners (just like the mushroom one) so I would really recommend joining in for one of those if you get a chance! It's awesome :)

prompt: A Google Maps review about a bistro.
completion: Top, top, top notch dining experience.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a bistro.
completion:
Myself and 5 friends went tonight to celebrate our good friend's engagement and wedding coming up next month with something a little different! We had an amazing time, the food was totally different than what we normally would find but so good, we had a ton of fun picking out our meals, trying all the different things, and just enjoying the experience. The wait staff was phenomenal, I honestly think Allison was a highlight of our evening. She was very personable, made us feel entirely comfortable, and had great tips and information on the menu.

We were gifted with extras at dessert, champagne for those of us that partook in cocktails and N/A sparkling juice for those that didn't and it was SO good! Super refreshing! We also (seriously, they were so amazing) were gifted a bite of something delicious - I apologize for not remembering what it was by the pastry chef this evening - but it had almonds, was a dessert bar of some sort and it was really good - not super sweet, honestly would have gone great with coffee if any of us had room for it - which we most certainly did not.

The atmosphere was wonderful, even being in proximity to other tables it still felt intimate enough that we couldn't hear other parties' conversations, nor could they hear ours, and I feel like we were a little rambunctious at times. Also, my friends that had cocktails said nothing but high praise for them - my coke with lime was also top notch * in case anyone cared ;)

Food. That's why you're reading this, yeah?
It was good. Like, really great. It also felt like a performance at times. Lots of fun pouring, super attentive taking items away, never once had to ask for anything, be it water, napkin, silverware, etc etc. Maybe we're cheap dates but I'm fairly certain everyone went above and beyond, exceeding our expectations. Thanks for a great experience!

In case my photo captions don't save:
1. Scallops
2. Surprise Carrot & Cardamom Soup option (big fan of this, you don't know unless you KNOW)
3. Beef Medallion Filet - my favorite of the 3 savory dishes
4. The best dang dessert option there is - even though the mousse looked and sounded amazing - I will DIE on this chocolatey-citrus hill any day. Any. Day. This chocolate cake (better than the chocolate cake in your head, bet) and orange sorbet - beyond. Be.yond.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a bistro.
completion: Absolutely amazing! Great food and staff along with an amazing desert, highly recommend!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a bistro.
completion: We loved it. Great Service, Great food, Great location.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a bistro.
completion: Exquisite food and world class tastes! Very kind wait staff! Anything we needed or wanted was offered. Very friendly! The morel dinner event was fantastic!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a bistro.
completion: Best dinner out in years. Nothing snobbish about it.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a bistro.
completion: Wonderfully classic French restaurant. Price fixe 4 course menu provides plenty of options. View is gorgeous also.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a bistro.
completion: This is a fancy place for big occasions. Try this out for birthdays or anniversaries and you will like it. Lakefront view is good when there is sunlight. In the evenings in winter the sparkles of the icicles reflect through the windows. Food is varied and with guidances from the helpful staff you can find the right mix. Vegetarian options are available. Cheese plates are great too. The restaurant is spacious and very well decorated.

Steak and eggs was good also portion was filling. My wife's crab benedict was very good and eggs was perfect on top.

completion: I drove for a group from Appleton Wisconsin and they all went to Bartolotta's. They had a fantastic time with family and friends üéÑüåûüéÅ‚õÑ

prompt: A Google Maps review about a bistro.
completion: Gourmet food, great service, nice views of Lake Michigan, and classic restaurant ambiance. Menu is diverse enough to have something for everyone. Prices are high, but fair considering the quality of cuisine. Ample parking.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a bistro.
completion: Excellent food with a nice view of the lake. The servers walk around with a basket of French baguette pieces that are offered throughout the meal. I had the Coquilles Saint Jacques which includes 3 seared scallops on a bed of beech mushrooms and a flavorful puree. It was delicious.  Not very filling, but delicious. For dessert I had the Mousse Au Chocolat Yves Camdeborde which was to die for. It is a chocolate mousse piece with a praline crust and had coconut sorbet and a piece of coconut crunch. It was played beautifully and the flavors were amazing together.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a bistro.
completion:
Such a wonderful spot, Lake Park Bistro brings a medley of foods and flavors that elevate the dining scene in Milwaukee.

Each course was prepared and plated to perfection, but the best part was the incredibly extensive list of French wines offered by the bottle. Anything we‚Äôve gotten from Burgandy has been exceptional!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.

I've always had a good time and the food is always been phenomenal. Everyone here is always been very friendly from the slot associates, dealers to the security staff. Upstairs on the second floor before you go to into the sky bridge over to the silver legacy there is a large game room for the kids to spend their time in while the parents are here enjoying themselves. I wish I would have came here when my children were younger would have been an awesome place first our family entertainment as circus circus is the only casinos that I have ever encountered that are truly catering to the whole family.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Nice place.  Lots of things to do for kids and young at heart. Lots of games like being at the fair. But beware the once the taxes and resort fees are added the room charges double the price. Which is probably true for all the resorts. It was nice to have wifi and parking.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: We had a good time, it's pretty small and when its busy it is hard to move around. The circus acts are short less than 10 mins. Games are each $1 to play and the prize redemption line is long. We had a good time but I think I would rather go to a other place.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Easy check in no line and fast and friendly service WILL STAY HERE AHAIN

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion:
Always fun to visit!

Rooms are relatively new , good decoration , room was well lit and decoration on the wall behind the bed was cool! Furniture looked new and trendy , had coffee pods as complementary, had coffee üôÇ

Bathroom had a trendy and upgraded look! Liked it very much!

The short circus show were one of the main attractions! üòâ

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Nice rooms, buffet is closed, good parking.  We left a jacket in our room after check-out and it took two days for someone to go to the room to look for it.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion:
It's been a few years since we have stayed here and unfortunately will probably be the last time. I received an email inviting me to stay there which stated they had newly remodeled rooms, which made us want to go ahead and book here instead of our usual other option. Well, our visit was less than satisfying. We drove up Sunday afternoon to check in and were told there was no valet service - park across the street, and walk back to check in (was not allowed to keep my car in their driveway while checking in). Not a good start. Check in line had about 10 parties waiting to check in and only two front desk folks (after about 10 minutes one more front desk agent showed up). Once in the room, I was confused how they could state the rooms were remodeled(?). Bathroom was great (only one hook to hang towels), the room was painted, but the furniture was still old and scratched up, the chair was creaking with every move and the thermostat was very dirty (not huge, but very noticeable). The casino had no live tables, so we had to go somewhere else to play - I prefer to just stay in my hotel to gamble. As far as the 'Resort Fee', it lists 2 water bottles (helpful on a 100 degree day), but never got that - I called down to see if they could be brought over and never got them. There were a couple of coffee pods with a sign stating they will be refreshed every morning, they are not. I called the 2nd morning to get a couple, but ended up running to Starbucks instead (Why are they charging a resort fee???). If this covers the parking, maybe think about charging the people parking in your lot and not staying at your hotel.
In any case, with all the alternative hotels in Reno I will not be booking another room at Circus Circus. I'll keep the old memories of what they used to be years ago.
One plus, we enjoyed the view from our room.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Great place for kids to feel involved. They have free mini shows on stage in the circus game arcade area for kids.  A food court gambling for adults

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion:
Came on a Tuesday night. Masks only suggested for non-vaccinated guests but a surprising number of guests and staff wore one.

Check in was quick. Had a suite room. Clean, spacious, with dual temp control. Large bathroom with shower/tub. Keurig available with coffee pods. Hidden mini fridge. Extra pillows in closet.

Housekeeping came by only to ask if anything was needed, not to clean. I believe they only clean on request and upon check out, but ask the front desk if that's accurate. Asked for extra bath and hand towels; was given two of each.

Check out was 12pm w/Express Check Out option. Dropped off keys in Express Check Out box by elevators.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: We had a great time there celebrating my mother's birthday.  We stayed in the north tower which had very nice updated rooms and clean bathrooms.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Circus Circus is a Great Place For Family and Fun!! They have lots of food options as well as a midway carnival and arcade.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Amazing place. Lots of atmosphere and activities for all ages. Most of restaurants are closed due to covid19 regulations.  Although lots of other food shops and so.e restaurants are open inside.  Tons of slot machines old and new. Skme card games are open to.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: The room was spacious with a nice view of down town Reno. Check in was quicker than I expected and I love the "express check out" option. My only complaint (more like a suggestion) would be that a microwave in the room would be a very nice addition to have.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: I took my grandsons there and their ages are 3, 11, and 14.  We had a blast.  We arrived at 10 and it was not crowded.  Plenty of games to play.  Lots of teens arrived around 1 and then it was crowded.  I had fun myself.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.

Be prepared  restaurant and restroom is always a long line. ...
We had  a wonderful time. ...

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Stopped by for a few hours on our way to Cali. I have memories of being here as a child and seeing animals and circus acts. I took my kids in and found the arcade with the stage. There was a short balancing act while we were there. There are lots of shops. The kids blew $95 at the arcade in about 20 minutes and came away with a few cheap stuffed animals. I think they had fun, but it didn't live up to my memories.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Good place for kids, nice play area for games and carnival type games.  Excellent entertainment every 45 minutes in the carnival area.  This acrobat on the hoop is an amazing talent.  The place feels a little rough and not clean and polished but it‚Äôs not dirty. It just needs some polishing and a decorating consultant.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: The room was very clean and the pillows were better.  For the price it couldn't have been better. Stayed on the 28th floor so the views were breathtaking.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: It was fun gambling at Circus Circus. The sports book was small and did not have much of a selection of games on but it was okay. I ended up winning on the table games and on a few sporting events. They also had the midway with all the arcade games and carnival games. The kids enjoyed it and was a great spot to take them. I think I lost more money at the Midway than the whole weekend gambling in Reno. We did not stay at the hotel some this review is not about the hotel. Overall it was a good experience for us and I have nothing negative to say about Circus Circus.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion:
A great experience, quick free shuttle from the airport. Clean room with nice view from the 12th floor. Thermostat controls and a 50inch TV. Two very comfortable queen beds. Found extra pillows and cases in the closet.

Haven't been in a casino in a few years, prices are higher, the days of the 99 cent TBone steaks and crazy deals are gone.

$60 lunch for 2 is common unless you stick to fast food. Was a good meal and great service. We found a great deal through Trivago, but realized we could have saved more with a direct reservation.

The hotel promise is lowest price, after you find the the best deal call direct they will match the price and refund an additional 10%. Something I'll remember next time. We'll be using this Caesars affiliate again.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: My kids loved it!! The hotel rooms weren't very nice but the games for the kids were awesome!! There are different levels of floors that they can play games at and it was a blast.. went to play games two different days for my daughter's birthday..

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.

Parking space is fairly abundant in the area nearby

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Housekeeping was still cleaning my room at check in so I had to wait a bit. The bathroom was still dirty hair in the tub, toothpaste spit in the sink. The casino and amenities have been a plus. I would give Circus Circus üé™ another try.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: In town for business. Surprisingly nice rooms and a quite stay at BOTH  towers. Bargain  priced.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion:
Goods. Room was clean, working personnel nice, friendly and helpful from front desk to security and housekeeping, has a fym/fitness center, nice location, staying here pretty much gets you access to 3 casinos with a walking distance to Reno signature sign.
Bad stuff.
LINES ! If you there on the weekend when everyone else is there well let's say this place can't handle it's own capacity. To check in long line, to get to your room at certain  times there is a (no joking) 40 minutes wait line for elevator, now  it's not always but try to get back to your room when you really need something can be frustrating time in line for elevator.
Noise, I am talking hotel room, you can hear a lot from rooms nextdoor and hallway.
Bathroom!  Now that could be subjective but bathtub is very small, shower pipes makes loud noise while waiting for hot water and sink makes loud bubbly noises after use.
That's all major points. You can have great time staying there if you do it on not busy days, but if you have regular schedule and go there when most of people do, you might get frustrated standing in 40 minutes line for elevator when you just need to go to your room little quick.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Kids had a great time. They loved the games and use adults loved the shows. This visit we only stopped by to let the kids play games. We will be planning a trip to stay at Circus Circus next time. Nice to have the acarde games apart from the ticket and carnival games.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion:
I haven't been to Las  Vegas but if you have limited time and you are heading to San Francisco or  bay area and if casino is in your bucket list then you definitely need to add Reno to your list. We went on Saturday night and all the casinos were filled. We stayed in circus circus, it's one of the casino among the three giants which hosts its own casino. A perfect place to stay and enjoy in a casino.
Easy check-in and check out.Rooms were good, what else one might in need of. One drawback which I thought is number of boards were very less and casinos were all filled with digital ones which seems to be slightly bothering. All the bar and restaurant were good. Even if you want to take a walk , best time is to go after 10PM . You can have a good view of the lights .
The row is all integrated and you can move between all the 3 casinos . They too have play area like arcade games for little kids . Please note children are not allowed inside the casino .  You need to have alternate arrangements for that.
We loved this place more as this is only 50+ miles from Lake Tahoe and this was helping us to take rest after tiresome day in Lake Tahoe

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: We decided to come here to have breakfast and then hang out in the Arcade. First impression coming in the elevator we‚Äôre old and dirty. Once you get inside the Casino/Hotel it looks way better. We had pancakes and eggs which were delicious but the sausage looked like it had freezer burns on it so we didn‚Äôt eat that. The staff at the restaurant were great and not too long of a wait time. The arcade was fun. A little over priced but the convenience of having it within the hotel could be a plus. We were able to make enough points to cash out for some goodies at their Arcade store. We were able to catch 2 shows while we were there so that was fun as well.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Always a fun place to play. They have a midway with great circus acts. I was surprised to see that they took out the Buffet and put in a  food court. It might have been good, it was busy today.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Hundreds of people in line to check into a room. No end in sight, I'm standing here right now. It's anarchy.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: We stayed here five nights. The three connected casinos offer great restaurants, games, and entertainment, without ever having to leave the complex.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.

She didn't bother to remove it or anything. I'm truly disappointed on my stay!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.

Skipping having my room cleaned for a credit at The Row restaurants was worthwhile, especially as it was cold enough that I didn't want to walk around outside. The bed was comfortable, but the desk chair was not. The size of the room contributes to accessibility, and there was a grab bar next to but not inside the show/bathtub.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.

Clean rooms and nice staff.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.

There is something for everything I'm sure you would go and find something that you love since your childhood and you will definitely try to win that game.

They have a kiosk machine on which you can get a new card or load your old card. Machine accepts both card and cash which is really easy to use.

Stuff is friendly and helpful. Overall the place is really good for kids I would strongly recommend to keep this in your visit list whenever you go to Reno with your kids.

And I'm sure even if you visit it as an adult without kids also you would love this place.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.

Very disappointed. Bell desk guy was great though!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.

Gross!!! The bell hops were never at the desk and when they were they refused to help guests with their bags because they were dirty. Mind you most of these guests were people of color who did not attend Burning Man and had perfectly clean bags. I am disgusted by the service here and will never come back.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.

I really enjoyed photographing it all.
Blessings, John

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: We stayed the night on a Saturday night when there was an event in Reno. $260 for a room!!! No microwave in the room. The room was clean and comfortable but definitely not worth $260!!!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: I truly enjoyed my trip, to Circus Circus. The room was nice with a great view. The staff was amazing!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion:
One of the better hotels in the area it would seem. Rooms are very clean and modern in comparison to the competition. Plenty of food and entertainment options as this hotel spans across three different hotels that are all connected. The arcade was cool.
Fitness center was probably the hottest, most poorly ventilated fitness center I‚Äôve been in, and one of the smallest. Very difficult to do extended amounts of cardio. However, it was clean and available for use. So it was appreciated.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Look, I know this is a place that was the place to be back in the days.  But, I truly enjoyed  my stay. For the most part it was clean. Staff were friendly and knowledgeable.  It's connected to 2/3 other Casinos/hotels. It's huge. Great for walking around if you are not a gambler. Would love to visit again. Way after Covid leaves. Lol

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Great location if you want to be near the night life and other casinos. The rooms are spacious and comfy and the water pressure and temperature are perfect. It's difficult to deal with customer service when there are issues; they are very dismissive. I recommend booking from a 3rd party for the discounts (of course, always call the hotel and compare prices first) but there will always be a separate resort fee, as with most hotels and casino's. The casino smells like the rest but the kids area seems to have better odor control. Worth the stay üé™

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion:
Love this place!
Kids love too!!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Just dont expect the same level of entertainment thats found at the Vegas location.  There was only one show per day. There was only 2 roaming drink servers...which we rarely saw. Plenty of games for ppl with kids. I was surprised that indoor smoking was permitted. I was approached and asked if I wanted to buy perfume. My friend was approached and asked if she wanted to buy gold jewelry. Two ATMs were out of money. The room staff was exceptionally friendly. The concierge desk was not manned the majority of the time. We called airlines and departed a day early.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Stayed for New Years, and got to see the fireworks which were spectacular. Definitely geared for kids. We loved the arcade and the circus acts happening every hour. The arcades, I think are good value, usually around a dollar to play a game and prizes were generous. My son also loved the free train that goes to and fro the sky tower. I would almost say this hotel as kids friendly, but I cannot because of their smoking policy. Them owning, the whole ‚Äúrow‚Äù, I wish they could make the circus-circus third, smoke free, and then I would honor them 5 stars.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion:
I would never stay here again. AVOID!!!

The overall atmosphere is depressing and lackluster. The lobby, casino, elevator, and rooms are all extremely under kept and dirty. I spent close to $150 a night to stay here, and I have stayed in $50 motels nicer than this.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Upstairs is all about the kids. Lots if arcade games for points. There are some older style games and newer. Did not stay at the hotel. The place has some history for sure. Casino is cleaner then the one in Las Vegas.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Just wanna say their amazing arcade provides a great break from the slot machines and poker tables...esp if you are with your loved ones.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion:
This place was awful! The rooms were disgusting. I told them before checking in that my husband has heart failure,  that he can not be in a dirty environment. They assured me numerous times that there rooms were "very clean".
They were anything but clean. I immediately called the front desk when we arrived in the room. They wouldn't send anyone to look at the room. They made me take pictures and come back downstairs.

This is absolutely the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. No

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion:
I've stayed here twice within the last year, the first time my room in the casino tower was a lot more run down and old than I am used to and I low key had an eerie feeling from the room I stayed in the first time. Maybe something happened there before I don't know, but I felt this odd coldness/a feeling that made me uneasy. I was hesitant to stay here but I decided to book again since I was only here for a couple days.

My 2nd visit this past week was decent. The hotel itself is older of course, but it gives the basic necessities. I was in the sky tower this time and it felt more updated than the casino tower?

Heating/cooling system worked perfectly. I had a corner room which had a nice view of the city.

I would give this rating a lot lower for the incident that happened, but I will assume it was a rare occurrence where someone walks in your room without knocking. The woman Apologized, but I felt really uncomfortable because I could've been naked or in the shower. It was totally inappropriate, I messaged the concierge Ivy person thing and they apologized but never offered to do anything...

Water quality from the faucets were questionable, I ran the hot and cold and both looked heavy, see photo. But cleared up after I ran it for some time.

Shower ran well too. Water temp was well controlled. So everything else was fine with the room. Nothing extravagant, I just got a normal king size room.

Anyways, I like the convenience of the hotels location and how it's connected to the other, Silver Legacy, el Dorado, etc. We enjoy the arcade and circus shows too. Staff are friendly for the most part. They have a better food court now than they did 12 years ago, so there are improvements here and there.

I love that they still have a lot of old mixed with new. I love the history of the buildings and seeing that throughout the halls and rooms of the buildings. Please maintain the history  I think that's what really entices visitors too!

Overall I would stay again for the location for sure.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a escape room center.
completion: A FUN Night

prompt: A Google Maps review about a escape room center.
completion:
Our experience here was awesome! My boyfriend and I did 'The Lost Ship' room. It was a Wednesday 7pm booking, so just the two of us took on the challenge without anyone else booking in. And we escaped with 90 seconds to spare!! Our guide, Captain Charles, did a fantastic job introducing the room to us with this whole back story to set us up. If you pay close attention, there are clues in everything he's saying as well.

The room itself was the best part. It was actually several rooms all joined together and from the lobby you had to figure out how to even enter the main room in the first place‚Äîsuper cool! I had never seen anything like that before. The puzzles were also really well thought out and interesting, using logic and problem solving (not at all abstract or random). Of all the escape rooms I have done, I would say that this has been the best experience I have had because of the attention to detail in the room, the quality of the puzzles, and the experience of being able to solve it with just the two of us.

The room is actually designed for at least 6 people, because it would have been helpful for others to take on and simultaneously solve riddles in the room. I'm pretty amazed we were able to do it with just 2 (but it was mostly because we had a few timely hints... big ones, lol). Awesome experience, highly recommend!!!

P.S. - This location has only this room (Pirate's Booty 2 - The Lost Ship), and the other rooms are in their downtown location. So don't be confused ^_^

prompt: A Google Maps review about a zoo.
completion: Many animals. We started with the barn animals. Fed the goats, alpacas, deer, and some sheep. It took us a little over two hours to go around the grounds. I did the mistake to wear flip flops. Best to wear sneakers because there is no pavement. Take insect repellent and drinking water.  There are no drinking fountains. Plenty of picnic tables.  Overall we had a nice time.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a zoo.
completion:
We were lucky enough to get a private tour thanks to a GHA/Omni Local Experience and really enjoyed meeting its Director, Patti Clark.The Zoo has the admirable mission of 'not existing at all' since without abused, injured and abandoned animals to rescue, it wouldn't need to be here.

Patti could relay every story of each animal on our tour, and although many of its inhabitants were transfers from closed pet stores and zoos, the majority were exotic pets from owners who never considered what happens when a bear, panther or alligator grows up. This zoo is the final destination for these animals where they get to live out the rest of their days without transfer.

While there are no giraffes, polar bears or theme park rides, there's an enthusiastic and friendly staff caring for several hundred animals that otherwise most likely would have been euthanized. This non-profit is continuously building new enclosures and facilities and hosts daily programs and talks for kids and adults alike, in its effort to house animals from the 40-50 calls they get every month.

Austin Zoo is not a flashy place and doesn't have multi-million dollar enclosures and exhibits. You can see your entrance fee and donations in action, and the focus is on providing the best possible support for rescued animals. I'd strongly recommend visiting - kids will always love a trip to the zoo - but for adults the ethical mission is the real draw.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a zoo.
completion:
A nice rescue zoo a short drive from downtown ATX.

This zoo isn't extremely big or fancy, but you can tell they care about the animals. The animals are taken in from bad situations and rehabilitated and cared for.

The exhibits have educational material about the species of animals, but also about each individual animals situation and how they ended up being cared for by the zoo.

This is a much different experience than a big zoo, it's a lot quieter and less crowded if that's what you are looking for. It's also kind cheated more affordable than a big zoo. You can easily see the whole zoo in an hour, but if you take your time there's plenty to do for a couple of hours.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a zoo.
completion:
I‚Äôve been going to the Austin zoo for years, and I've always loved it. It's perfect if you have small kids- they have a petting zoo, peacocks walking around, an adorable train ride,  you can spend a couple of hours or less and that's plenty off time to see everything.
However, they have really gone downhill. The prices are ridiculous. I had no idea you had to purchase tickets online. They made my kids and I stand under a tree while everyone got to go through. I was finally waved over and able to pay. I felt like a naughty kid being punished. The bathrooms are closed down- two nasty porta potties. There is no longer much to see. I seriously don‚Äôt think you get what you pay for.

It‚Äôs a perfect venue for your child‚Äôs birthday party! You can reserve a private room and even learn about animals & pet one!

There‚Äôs no Giraffes ü¶í.
There‚Äôs more of a bird ü¶¢ selection, monkeys üêí, goats üêêAnd üêñ pig (be careful with the pig)

prompt: A Google Maps review about a zoo.
completion:
10/10 experience!!!! Well worth the money. We spent about 2 hours here and definitely could‚Äôve stayed longer.

Since there‚Äôs so many trees, it was shaded basically the entire zoo, which is a must in the Texas sun.

Love that this is a rescue zoo and their conservation mission. We loved reading about where each animal came from.

Also, since the animals are rescued, they weren‚Äôt hiding like they do in normal zoos. We went as soon as they open, and everyone was out and about in their exhibits.

Our favorite part was definitely feeding the goats and alpacas but it was also amazing seeing lions and cougars that close up!

We will definitely be back and will be bringing friends!!

This is not a flashy zoo, and it is really off the beaten path. You won't see extremely exotic critters. They have lemurs, monkeys, tortoises, snakes, parrots, bears, lions, tigers and a petting zoo section.

Why would you come here, then? Because you'll feel good patronizing a place with its mission. They rescue animals and give them a better life.

I like a zoo that not only cares for their animals, but also tries to make sure people know how hard it is to care for parrots. I like a zoo whose staff connect with the patrons. And folks, I loved the alpacas and prairie dogs as well as the other critters I listed. Recommended.
