prompt: A Google Maps review about a zoo.
completion:
DON‚ÄôT GO IF YOUR CHILD WON‚ÄôT WEAR A MASK!

My friend and I and our four children, ages 4,3,2 and 7 months visited the Austin Zoo earlier this week.
The good: It is so classic Austin. Nestled on a hillside on the outskirts of town amidst lots of cedar trees, there were no paved walkways. I loved it. You can get through it in about an hour and feel like you didn‚Äôt miss much, which is great with small children. They have a fun interactive petting zoo and peacocks roaming around all over. Love it!
The not-so-good: I confess most of this is due to my comparison experience with the zoo in my city- South Bend, IN (home of Mayor Pete Buttegieg). Our zoo is about comparable in size and number and type of animals. We also have no elephants, but we do have rhinos and will be getting giraffes soon. The surprising part of this is that South Bend is about a tenth of the size of Austin. I think maybe the Austin Zoo wants only rescue animals, and there aren‚Äôt rescue elephants...I don‚Äôt know. There are also a lot more cages at the Austin Zoo whereas South Bend has created much more natural habitats for most of their animals.
By far the biggest, most frustrating difference, however, was the mask policy. In the South Bend Zoo, and most places, you are only required to wear masks inside or if you can‚Äôt social distance. (FYI I am VERY pro-mask, but within reason). This even includes the animal feeding area in the South Bend Zoo. In Austin everyone, including small children 2 and over, are required to wear masks even outdoors (which is the entire zoo basically) unless you are eating. On a windy day from 20 feet away the chances of passing on Covid are so low even the CDC wouldn‚Äôt require this. It seems so unlikely Covid could be passed on to people or animals in that scenario. The Austin Zoo seemed possibly more concerned about their animals catching Covid than people, and I haven‚Äôt read about animals becoming seriously ill with Covid.
Wearing masks for adults I do not believe is much to ask, but for my friend‚Äôs 4 year old, she was very very upset, and refused to put one on. Children are not used to having to wear masks outdoors. Luckily they allowed us to stay as long as we promised to distance from the animals, but we were pretty worried we were going to be kicked out having seen almost none of the zoo‚Äîand tickets are NOT CHEAP. You even have to pay for 2 year olds. It goes without saying we didn‚Äôt do the petting zoo.
So bottom line-great zoo, but don‚Äôt go if you think your child will refuse to wear a mask.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a zoo.
completion: Great clean safe outing üëç

prompt: A Google Maps review about a zoo.
completion:
A rescue zoo so I will no give less than 5 stars for what they do for these neglected animals. üíñ thank you for your service.
That being said, great for kids but pretty sad as most of them were "pets" who were abandoned and major stress and mental suffering was clearly present. Left me feeling down a bit. Amazing galopagose tortoise and other animals too.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a zoo.
completion: It's not a zoo so much as a rescue and a zoo combined. It's not all concrete like so many zoos. It's like taking a hike through the woods, but with lion and tigers and bears! Oh my! They even have a little train now that they rescued from Zilker, and for just a few bucks they'll take you through the Texas Hill Country. It's gorgeous and you don't have to get all sweaty walking. And then of course there's the animals. They're well taken care of with clean enclosures. Plus there's chickens and peacocks wandering free everywhere. Which is a huge plus! It's a really great place for birthday parties. Kids love it, but then so do the adults. Go there!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a zoo.
completion:
Came here for my friends kids birthday and it was super fabulous! I enjoy going to the zoo, this is a different type of zoo than most people are used too. The zoo is smaller than most, but it's also more laid back and casual to me. It is more of a re-homing facility for animals who have a long back story. They are definitely doing good work here! All the animals seem to be enjoying their time and they are getting love. I think it is much different than a standard zoo but it's also different in a good way. It is a non-profit and to me I think they are doing very good things for the animals and educating the children in our area. I noticed it might be difficult to get around for those who have strollers and or wheel chairs, they gravel is a little tough and there are some dips and holes, but I don't mind watching where I walk. I feel like they are spending the money on the right things. I think it's a great place to take children! The birthday party pavilion was great! It was very cool in there and plenty of space. The staff was super friendly and helpful! If I had kids I'd bring them back here often, I'd probably even take guests who are animal lovers here to visit as well!

The parking lot is not paved, but we didn't have issues coming in a car. Just something to keep in mind for those who have low cars, etc.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a zoo.

We went on pretty chilly day and all the tropical birds were sharing one little heat lamp and you could tell they were so distressed. The animals looked pretty miserable to be honest. The only parts we enjoyed were the feeding of the farm animals which you can‚Äôt even do like at a petting zoo you have to feed them through the fence. The train and the conductor were the best part. He was super nice and pretty funny. He offered to take our pics which I appreciated. But if your not from Austin and thinking about making the trip out here‚Ä¶don‚Äôt. Seriously the snake farm in new branfuels was in better shape and condition than this. Drive out to San Antonio and go to a real zoo or if your looking for something more hands on drive to Johnson city to go to the exotic resort zoo, there are a lot more animals there and they look much more attended too. We left this place pretty sad.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a german restaurant.
completion:
This is truly a hidden gem!

They have a dance group anyone can join; it's been very fun! Wednesdays at 7PM, except for the 2nd Wednesday each month.  I have literally no dance background, but this is folk dancing, so that's fine üòÅ

Edelweiss is located in German Park at the end of the drive.  The park itself isn't anything major, but the scenery is very nice.
Once at the parking lot, you can go in the main entrance and down the stairs to the restaurant or follow the sidewalk north of the building where it slopes down and around the building to their outdoor seating. You can see a gnome garden along the way!
I've seen comments saying this place isn't handicap accessible, but this sidewalk is the entrance to take if you have a wheelchair or stroller.  Understandably, this will be inconvenient if it is raining.
The outdoor seating is the beer garden area and the doors lead into the restaurant.

On Wednesdays there is a buffet.  I'm writing this review after a stop at their buffet and I'm impressed.
On Fridays they have live music; simply amazing fun!

They have several events through the year and I definitely recommend checking them out! Fr√ºhlingsfest, J√§gerfest, Octoberfest and more!

Through the year, they have several German events, including an Octoberfest.  From what I hear, it's a blast!

Additionally, a local Duolingo group has started holding language events here and, separately, there is a lady who gives basic German lessons in the fall.
*Note* September 2022 - I'm not certain if these have started up again yet.

completion:

prompt: A Google Maps review about a german restaurant.
completion: The food here was absolutely terrific! Some places offer homestyle dishes like your mom used to make. This place offers homestyle dishes like someone else's mom made, and they're all delicious. My favorite was the shepherds pie, but everything they served was great. Wednesday nights are "buffeteria" style. They serve you like a cafeteria but you keep going back until you're finished. Non-members price was $16.95 which I felt was fair for the quality of food and service provided. If you want to try something a little out of the ordinary I highly recommend a Edelweiss! I'll certainly be back when I cost the area again. Call ahead reservations are recommended.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a german restaurant.
completion: Awesome food and fantastic service, try the Curry Wurst. Also had the Ruben and pretzel.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a german restaurant.
completion:
This place is amazing.  Talk about taking yourself back in time for a minute you feel like you are in Germany.  They open at 5pm for dinner only.  You drive down this  dark road, and you would never know there was a parking lot and a restaurant from the top of the road.
You go inside from the parking lot on a top level,  down a flight of  stairs is the restaurant.  They do have an elevator for handicap.
Once below it's amazing.  It's small probably about 30 tables, wooden walls, and all decorated with Germany memorabilia.
I was so excited to try this place the last time I had German food was in Germany 20 plus years ago.  I still remember what that tasted like.
There was 2 waitress serving and taking orders. Lisa was our waitress.  She is such a nice lady,  and definitely knows her menu,  and has worked their for a long time.  I ordered the German beer on tap it was very light, clear, and refreshing. My other half Bayrischer Schweinebraten it was a tender slow roasted pork shoulder.  I tasted the dish and it was amazing.  Very tender and with lots of flavor.  It was not sliced it was more like chunk pork. His side was the sliced apples.  I have never tried apples sliced fresh, in a cinnamon sauce.  I wish you could order this by the pint or quart to take home.  Amazing!
I ordered J√§gerschnitzel which was delicious with the cream white wine sauce, and mushroom.  The sauce was so good I asked for a little more sauce. The pork meat was tender, and a nice slice. My sides was potato pancakes oh my goodness hold the fork these were not greasy at all.  I put the sour cream and applesauce on the potato cakes. My other side I was wanting to try was the German potato salad.  It was good, completely traditional,  but not my favorite for my taste buds. Before dinner you have a choice of soup or salad.  I definitely tried the soup which was really good the traditional red cabbage soup.
I can't wait to come back to try more dishes.
For dessert if you have room definitely order the bread pudding with the warm whiskey sauce.  You will want to make room for this dessert.
We were getting ready to leave, they were closing, and they were so nice they make everything fresh daily, and had extra apple and cherry turnovers. I had taken home 1 of each. The next day with a cup of coffee, warmed up,  very good.
I can't wait to come back!
Thank you ladies for such a great experience.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a restaurant.

Food was interesting to say the least, we got the CALABRIAN CHILI CUCUMBERS for an app and it was more tangy like pickled cucumbers. Still very refreshing. Then we ended with dessert CHOCOLATE MOUSSE CAKE and Seasonal Truffles (3)
By far my favorite I've tried, subtle , flavor isn't overpowering (I don't have that much of a sweet tooth) would definitely get the dessert again! The truffles was alright, dark chocolate and white chocolate. Tasted really nice.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a restaurant.

My wife and I originally booked a reservation for 8pm on a Friday night but decided to come an hour early to see if we could sit at the bar for a couple of drinks first.

We ended up staying at the lower bar and eating a wonderful dinner. Mostly because of our bartender‚Äôs kindness, professionalism and the great ambiance.

Mushroom kushiyaki and charred avocado for a starter. Then, egg yolk raviolo and chicken roulade for our main course. Delicious on all counts.

It‚Äôs set up as a cafe, as well. We didn‚Äôt experience this side of it. But, highly recommend if you‚Äôre looking for a nice dinner in Bloomington.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a restaurant.
completion: This experience exceeded my expectations. Highlights included the gnocchi which was prefectly light and flavorful and the Ube cheesecake which with sorbet on top was a novel and delicious take on a classic. I highly recommend the Elm.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a restaurant.
completion: I couldn't have asked for a nicer birthday dinner. The staff were lovely (thanks, Tam), the interior has a beautiful modern, earthy vibe, and the food was great. I especially liked the matcha creme brulee, baby beet salad, harissa cauliflower, and salted pistachio latte. We're so excited something is finally in this space again.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a restaurant.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a restaurant.
completion: Elm was lovely! All the staff was so warm, friendly and helpful. The atmosphere was so unique for Bloomington. I felt transported to a metropolitan area‚Ä¶in all the best ways! It‚Äôs upscale, but yet cozy and modern. The mezzanine had a different vibe than the downstairs, but both were lovely! They also have a separate room upstairs for a small event or work meeting/lunch. There is a bar both upstairs and downstairs which is neat! Beyond the atmosphere, the food was good and the presentation was great. I had the beet salad which was small but very tasty! The homemade gnocchi with pesto sauce and toasted pine nuts was also delicious! I can‚Äôt wait for my next visit!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a restaurant.
completion: I'm sure this is something many reviews will say, but it's such a cool atmosphere, especially for Bloomington. We had the ribeye and the chicken sandwich, both were great, especially the ribeye. We also had a wonderful spicy jalape√±o/Cherry margarita and a quality Manhattan. prompt: A Google Maps review about a restaurant.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a restaurant.
completion: Tasty meals in small quantities! Good ambiance too!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a restaurant.
completion: I want to begin by saying I really love the atmosphere. The tables are spaced out enough that there is not much noise and it‚Äôs easy to talk to your table. The interior decoration is also very beautiful. There is not much parking but I live close so I walked. The food was delicious but there were just enough weird things that made me give 4 instead of 5 stars. The bread and butter (which is its own appetizer) is OK but definitely not anything to write home about, the butter pat was cold so not easily spreadable. I ordered the cauliflower main dish with sauce and golden raisins knowing it would be lighter than a meat main. However, with the price of the dish, I was expecting a bit more than 1/4 of a cauliflower head for my main meal. I know inflation and prices are high but cauliflower? Seems they could‚Äôve spared a bit more. Additionally the olive oil cake with rhubarb and strawberry ice cream was good but the ice cream stole the show! The cake itself was just ok and the rhubarb had not been sweetened enough to make it palatable, I ended up taking it off. The service was good but not great, we had a new server and she made a few missteps that ultimately would have cost our party money if we hadn‚Äôt spoken up (as opposed to slow service, etc). Overall, I definitely want to go back to the elm, i will just choose my dishes more carefully.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a restaurant.
completion:
The Elm is beautiful, gorgeous even, and the staff were friendly, attentive and good at their jobs. The menu is big enough that there are enough choices but it's not overwhelming. The cocktail menu is inventive.
I mention all of this because the bar, from the moment you walk in the door, is set very very high. And the food is great. It's just not quite as beautiful as the decor or as perfect as the menu describes.
The tostones are plentiful and the brussel sprouts are crispy. But the sauces leave something to be desired.
The steak and lamb were excellently cooked but greens and asparagus needed a little more flavor.
But hot damn the olive oil cake was good. The seasonal rhubarb, strawberry and pistachio pairing was divine. Textures and flavors, yum!
I'll be back for espresso and dessert ASAP!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a restaurant.
completion: Outstanding local restaurant.  Unusual menu that changes regularly.  Great open atmosphere.  Make a reservation as they are usually full. prompt: A Google Maps review about a casino.
completion:
Update 2/14/23

Walking up to the main entrance of the casino was worse than before.  Cigarettes are all over,  things need painted and everything could do well with a good powerwashing.  Nothing about this 1st glance gives me "destination resort" vibes.    We arrived around 8:30 in the morning so it was obvious this littered mess was not fresh.  If this place wants to pull in new customers and become a major moneymaker,  things need to change.  When your facility is much less clean than the local gas stations,  you have an issue.   Granted,  the inside is clean,  but the outside is what sets the tone.  Do better, Mardi Gras!

Original review:  We have stayed here numerous times through the years.  This last visit was already a letdown due to no pool and none of the amazing breakfast foods.  The room was not the cleanest and the gold fixtures are now chrome and gold due to someone using the incorrect cleaner.  All of the restaurants in the casino were closed and there was no room service.

My suggestions to help would be:

Breakfast:  Since the old buffet style won't work,  the easiest way to serve the delicious hot breakfast would be for each room to put an order in either online or by calling concierge.  Their items would be prepared and could be dropped off contactless outside of the room or could be picked up in the lobby.

Cleaning:  Supervisor checking rooms to make sure they are bring cleaned properly.  They should also be sure to teach proper use of cleaning agents and which products to use on each surface.

Restaurants:  If none of the on site eateries are going to be open,  either offer meals via room service again or at least put together a listing of nearby restaurants and contact information.   Maybe even see if any would be willing to give hotel guests a discount.

I know some of these items seem small but if you want to call yourself a resort and be a destination vacation spot,  you can't overlook the little things.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a golf course.
completion: Really enjoy Wildwood. The course is always in good condition and the prices always seem fair. I play courses that charge more or just as much as Wildwood, but are over crowded and not as pretty. The layout provides variety for the holes. It has a parkland feel that is cut into a hill side. There is only one house that lines the fairway. About half of the holes have an elevated gain at the green or tee box.  It might be a ride for some. If the walk from the first tee box or the walk to the 9th green look steep to you. You have a similar walk about 9 or 10 times. Even though it is right off HWY 30, it is really peaceful on the course.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a golf course.
completion:
Four of us from Honolulu, Hawaii played this course on September 26, 2016 and we absolutely enjoyed the round.  Great staff, course and surroundings. Had previously called Bob to inquire about the course due to the mixed reviews.  Wildwood GC provides exceptional value and we put this course on our play again course whenever we're up here in the Portland area. Our foursome consisted of three Waialae Country Club and one Mid-Pacific Country Club members.  Mahalo Bob for taking great care of us.

Returned to play with some other buddies on May 6, 2017 before heading back to Honolulu the next day after a  five day golfing tour in the greater Portland area.  They were impressed Wildwood is on their "will play again" list.  Thanks Tom and the rest of the staff for taking care of us and welcoming us back.  Will be back up there in early-October with the original 2016 Honolulu guys!

PS: Wildwood has great drainage so this is one of three courses we now know that is playable after heavy rains.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a golf course.
completion:
Challenging holes are carved out of the hillside along the river at this course to provide something for everyone. First and foremost there is more vertical change at this course than many I have played in the past. Some pin locations are a hundred feet above the tee box while others are the same downhill. This makes it almost a must to rent a cart if you are playing 18, unless you are in peak physical condition.

The clubhouse is big and clean with friendly staff members to help out with your needs. The range is quite short and narrow, only 200 yards max by about 20 yards wide which makes it hard to warm up for the long shots you will need to be successfull right off the first tee. The carts are older and gas powered which made it tricky to get up some if the steep hills and there is some slow play if you are behind the wrong group.

Insider tip: make sure to study the course before you go if you haven't played here. There are hidden creeks and obstacles that ruin great shots down the middle. Better yet, play a practice round so you'll be ready before taking it on!

completion:

prompt: A Google Maps review about a golf course.
completion:
Wildwood has it all in the name! It's wild and in the woods. Expect to use a cart or be sore the next day from walking- but those are both great options!

Nestled in the foothills of Forest Park (one of the nation's largest urban pakrs) the gorgeous setting allows unparalleled views. If you find yourself frustrated about your golf game, you can take a moment to see beautiful glimpses Mt. Hood, Mt. St. Helens, and countless other bounties of nature.

Oh yes of course- golf! The course itself is well-maintained, and has its own unique blend of challenges and opportunities. Navigating through a "normal" course is challenged in its own rite, but couple that with nestling into the side of a mountain and you have Wildwood!

You owe it to yourself to make the trip out there to enjoy it. You can thank me later!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a golf course.
completion: Very nice course. Prices are good, staff is friendly, greens are well maintained.  Back 9 more challenging than the front. Get a gas cart, some of the electric ones can barely climb the hills. Oh and if you are not in shape take a cart as the hills are a plenty.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a golf course.
completion: Wonderful views. Well maintained course. Great cost for value.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a golf course.
completion:
Just played here on Sunday 10/6, about three weeks post-punching. The greens are fantastic. They're rolling very smooth and true..and at a great speed. They're firm, yet they're holding shots the way they should. Also, the traps were all hand raked, and fairways were very playable.

Look for a new expanded green complex and new lower tee on the par three # 6, and new tee locations on # 7. One thing that always impresses me about Wildwood, is the attention to detail, and the constant reinvestment in the course and clubhouse.

Also, the service is always friendly and accommodating. If you've never played Wildwood, be sure to give it a try. It's a real hidden gem of a golf course, with plenty of interesting holes, lots of character and challenges, and spectacular views.

And finally, Wildwood is in such a peaceful, serene setting, that it has an amazing overall calming impact on my game, as you can see in the photo below, taken at the 15th tee.

Breakfast options included blueberry or malt mini-waffles, cheese omelets, bacon, biscuits, gravy, fruit, cereal, breads and pastries, yogurt. REALLY appreciated separate seating with one television instead of having to hear others' choices; our table was in a quiet, large, open area. Omelets ran out so staff member brought them to our table when more were ready. Good location near highway.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion:
Reserved our deluxe king room with jetted tub for Sept 19th back in mid June 2021 & requested a quiet location (if possible). They put us in room 314, which was located on 3rd of 4 floors, right outside of the elevators & across from the ice machine room (very noisy).

The bath towels were thin, rough, and worn (one had two rips on edges... see pics). Jetted tub was the best part of the room, but took forever to fill up. But, for some stupid reason there was NO vent fan in the bathroom! Horrible!

The furnishings were a bit dated & I wouldn't call the size of the king room a "deluxe". Reserved that room purely because I knew after a 12 hr drive I'd want to soak in a nice big bath tub. Mattress was comfy, but only 3 squishy pillows (not 4) on the king sized bed (no neck support at all).

I wouldn't pay $172 (after taxes) for another stay in a king sized room there (booked thru Expedia.com). A bit disappointing.

Several chain restaurants within walking distance.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: My boyfriend and I came to Tropicana Tuesday through Friday. We had a room in the Havana tower. The room was clean and spacious. At the Tropicana there are multiple towers there is so much to explore. There are restaurants and shops in the hotel. No need to leave the hotel. There are a few shops open 24/7. Tacos at 2am was perfect. We ate at PF Changs and it was absolutely delicious. The atmosphere was great too. We also ate at Casa taco, Hash house a go go, and many other places as there are so many to pick from. The boardwalk is right outside the marketplace (where most the food shops are). We walked all the way to the end which took about 40 minutes one way. There were many shops closed but also many open and ready for customers. Going on a week day is our preference as there are so many less people. By Thursday alot more  people started coming.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Tropicana is a beautiful scenery. I didn‚Äôt stay in the hotel but I went to Wet Willies, Hooters , Mrs.Field‚Äôs Bakery and Lick the candy store. My friends and I also attempted to go to the night clubs inside of Tropicana but they were to over capacity.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion:
This was my first time at Tropicana Atlantic City. I stayed in the Havana Tower with 1  King size bed.
My first impression--the place is a sprawling monster of a Hotel and Casino resort. From the hotels lobby and check-in located on the lowest level (below the main casino floor accessible by escalators) to my room was a good 10 minute walk. If you have a lot of luggage it's going to be a workout for you. If you can't walk long distances or have any issues getting around, I suggest getting a room closer to the lobby and casino floor. The walk to my room involved many long inclined hallways, a pass through the shops and restaurants in the Quarter  and finally to the Havana Tower.
My room was big and looked very inviting and clean. But upon further inspection, it had it's share of problems. Smudges and  crud and on multiple door jams, and the bathroom vent and the room In-take A/C vent were disgustingly dirty. It looked unhealthy. (See pics)  Not sure if it is mold or just thick black dust but it should be cleaned REGULARLY. Besides that, I wanted to simply relax and take a shower but there was no body wash or hand soap for the sink. I called house keeping and was told they would be sending some up to the room immediately. I waited for over an hour and nothing showed up from housekeeping. Had to call again.  Someone showed up 30 minutes after that. (My stay was on a Wednesday and it took that long to get something that they forgot to put in the room. I can't imagine how long I request, like body wash or simply extra towels, would take on a weekend.
The hotel immenities are a pool and a very impressive  entertainment, shopping and restaurant area called the Quarter. It boasts over 24 restaurants, 25 shops of various goods and 22 bars and clubs and other entertainment like an Escape room.
Overall, despite the bad cleaning and service delays   from the housekeeping department,   I would recommend this hotel.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: I love the ambiance here and the decor makes you feel like you're in Havana, but the casino is very crowded, has very old poker machines and God forbid you need an agent to assist you with an issue with the machines....you'll be there for a while. The room was nice, but my stay was ruined by 2 women fighting in the room next door and slamming their door at 1 am, and then the people in the next room had the same song on repeat for 3 hours. Thank God the room was free. I will say this much. Tropicana has the best choices for restaurants.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Rooms are nice, pretty dated though. There was no water pressure in bathroom for showers. Nice assortment of restaurants, make sure you make reservations. Two of the restaurants closed the kitchen early due to lack of help. When leaving our room at 8 pm there was a man sleeping outside our door leaning against the wall. It seemed like a lot of underage teens in the casino after 11. All and all we had a good time.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: We have been staying at the Tropicana In Atlantic City for over 20 years.  This will be our last stay at the property.  From check in to check out we have never been treated so poorly. The resort is in bad shape. It isn‚Äôt ADA compliant as handrails are missing in the elevators and everything was dirty, as seen in the photos we posted.  At check in we were assigned a room that wasn‚Äôt clean.  There were potato chips all over the floor and the sheets were stained and gross with shoe prints all over the sheets.  We were assigned a new room, but it wasn‚Äôt much better.  There were boogers and blood wiped on the walls, the curtains had holes and the paint was peeling off the walls and headboards.  We had three guests and two towels.  When we requested more towels, housekeeping said we were only allowed two per room.  Two towels for three guests?  Housekeeping never came to our room to empty the trash or make the beds or collect old towels.  The next day we had to call housekeeping to get towels. I called back two hours later, and the gentlemen told me ‚ÄúYeah, I have your slip right here‚Äù and then hung up on me.  The towels never came.  The only time housekeeping came to our room was to rush us to checkout.  By the third day the toilet stopped flushing properly and we had to use the casino restrooms. The hallway during our stay was disgusting and dirty.  The manager on duty couldn‚Äôt be reached.  Ceasar‚Äôs claims they‚Äôve invested 400 million dollars in upgrades, but you will not see any of it in the Trop.  We will be taking our business to another property.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion:
EDIT
9/6 - Responded to owners request to email hotel about experience. I have emailed and hope the hotel will rectify this horrible experience. Will update when they have responded.

9/6 Where do I begin, first do not stay here!!!!!! There is no service and it ruined a birthday weekend trip.

When we arrived in AC we were going to check-in early. Mind you getting to the lobby hotel is a maze in itself with no signage anywhere to tell you where to go. We get to the lobby and there's 20 people and two receptionists along with self check-in machines on the side. I decided to wait. We waited to find out that there was a $25 fee to do so. We thought okay whatever let's do it and we asked if the room we reserved was ready and she said no housekeeping didn't get to it and you'll have to wait until 3pm. So we decided to wait for our room and came back at 3pm. We got our room  and it was not ready. Stains on the pillow cases and sheets and the bathroom with visible hairs everywhere. We called housekeeping 4x and each time they emphasized that requests take up to an hour to be completed. I said weird huh because I've been calling since 3pm and it's 7pm and nothing has been done. So I decided to call expedia for a refund. Expedia gets a manager called Jamal to help us and he says there is the same room ready and clean. So we trusts him and make the change just to find out the room is in the back of the hotel and even dirtier than the first. I had to go back downstairs and request our original room with the view and I would go to the store and buy cleaning supplies myself. The front desk manager was extremely helpful and so nice and helped fixed the situation. I have the emphasized SHE WAS THE ONLY ONE HELPFUL!. And when we moved back to the room it was finally being serviced and cleaned. However, it did take them until 8:30pm to have this completed. They did service the room the next day but at this point the trip was ruined and we checked out.

Save yourself the hassle and go elsewhere.  There's no entertainment, the casino here was dead, and the atmosphere just scummy. We ended up spending most of the following day at the ocean hotel and wished we would have just booked there.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Always a pleasure at the Tropicana. It's so big, it's the only casino I ever got lost in! Security is everywhere, and will point you in the right direction. I played roulette and won around $1,300 in 4 hours, went to Hooters downstairs and enjoyed a salad with chicken strips, met some beautiful waitresses, left a nice tip, then headed out with plans of returning soon. They have a convenience store right near the slots and one of the restrooms. The atmosphere was a happy one all night. I'm definitely going back next time I'm in Atlantic City.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion:
First off I've stayed at the Tropicana before but in the Chelsea tower. I had a great experience the last time I was here. This time I stayed in the west tower and I felt like I was sleeping in a motel. First off,it took three tries to get into the room. Then I noticed the security lock on the door was the old fashioned slide lock. Then there was mold and rust on the ceiling and wall of the bathroom. The room needed a serious facelift. There was torn wallpaper, holes in the dresser where the previous tv was and the climate control was ancient.
Granted I could have asked for a new room but I was tired and didn't want to move. I did complain and they gave me a $50 food voucher and extended checkout.
Next time I stay in the Tropicana, I'll make sure my room isn't in the west tower.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: I just want to make sure, that my review will be about the hotel, not casino. Casino is actually nice and big, so you will have a lot of fun there. Let me start with the reason why we stood in Trop. It was our anniversary and we wanted to go to see our favorite DJ in Harrah‚Äôs. We are reward members, so we get comp rooms in both of these hotels plus Caesars, unfortunate all the rooms were sold out a months before our stay, so we decided to stay in Tropicana for our first time. We didn‚Äôt know, that the tower, that we picked was not renovated. We paid almost $400 for one night stay and we got old room with dirty chairs, broken safe and alarm clock, broken light in the bathroom and dirt all over. You can see it on the pictures. We called to the reward center and lady just forgot about us on the phone, so we went downstairs to see what was our options. We were ready to pay extra just to move to the nicer room. Lady in the reception helped us, she moved us to a suite in the same tower with no additional charge, but despite everything a new room wasn‚Äôt better than the previous one. Suite also was old, couches with stains, broken things all over, but we were happy about working safe and comfy beds. So my biggest advice, check the towers before stay, if you are not sure, call them and ask. Or better stay in Harrahs or Caesars for chipper and with renovated rooms.  2 stars for trying to resolve our issue and a good custom service.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion:
Our trip was booked several weeks prior to our arrival. The self check in booths were declining many booked hotel guests, stating our rooms weren‚Äôt ready and they‚Äôd emhoyelus when it was. It was alr 6pm, and the kiosks weren‚Äôt accurate! The lines after the mass confusion and frustration began and lasted beyond an hour and some for others, with less than minimal staff at the desk to accommodate the error. This is unacceptable.
Mind you, we are here with my step daughter for a cheer competition, so there are many parents and elementary aged and younger children filling this lobby waiting for resolution.
After we‚Äôre able to get checked in, we come up to our room in the west wing‚Ä¶ seriously the most ghetto room I‚Äôve ever stayed in. I would never have anticipated a casino hotel room to be in such dated/dirty/and sloppy conditions. Bathroom is filthy, tub/shower walls stained and smells like cigarette. Cigarette burn hole in bed linen, and the paint job looks like it was done by my grandchildren. The coffee maker is broken and filthy with thick calcium buildup. There isn‚Äôt a dresser to put our clothes away. Mold in the shower molding.
The pictures on your website do NOT portray an image of the trash hole we walked into last night! We‚Äôre beyond disappointed, and have never had an experience as poor as this at any casino we‚Äôve gone to before. I plan on calling the front desk this morning for some kind of resolution.
Addendum‚Ä¶ step daughter just showed us a used band aid in her bed üò£
Spoke with management yesterday, they returned our phone call after 9 hours, offered us a different room today, however, it‚Äôs after 2pm and the room just now is ready. The replacement coffee maker and clean linen by the folded lump sum came up after several phone calls after 10:30 pm last night.
Manager stated this casino sleeps whatever sum of people and it‚Äôs difficult to keep up and please everyone. Change of room without a guaranteed time and a $50 food and beverage voucher for one of their places within the casino doesn‚Äôt make this stay worth the money I‚Äôve spent at this casino!
I plan on calling management again tonight or tomorrow, I will update. Hopefully it‚Äôs better than the less than interested game they‚Äôve shown so far.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: I get that Covid slowed things down for businesses. But that should not be why the rooms aren‚Äôt clean and in many aspects unacceptable. I did not complain to hotel staff but I would never expect to walk into a room with spills on the walls and broken faucets. If this was not for a celebration weekend, I would have left. Staff was nice, location is fine. Elevators for the west tower are awful on weekends. 4 elevators to get all guests to their rooms for that tower - there was always a line and wait. prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion:
The Tropicana has its decent high points, but there are issues as well:

Issues:

For blackjack fans: dealer hits on soft 17s.

Service is less than good. Front desk was manned by one person for a 40 person queue. It looked like a line at an airport. Employees can be pretty bossy too.

Listed amenities are more like "services you can purchase" or "sometimes available". To the extent that you have to pay $35 or buy a $200 massage to get access to the hot tub for a day. So don't think you can go relax at it with $$$. And it's only available on certain days. I also think you have to rent a chair at the outdoor pool if you want to sit at it? The indoor pool is only available on certain days, and is by reservation.

Some games have seriously reduced payouts. Example, a side bet at blackjack has payouts nearly cut in half compared to what other casinos run the same bet at.

As others have mentioned, the hotel and casino are dated and show it. It gives the impression that things are just being kept as is. No serious upkeep since what seems like a long time ago.

Strengths:
The resturaunt selections are pretty nice, but on the pricey side. I'd recommend the Petitie Creperie in the quarter for an affordable, pleasant meal. They have a wide selection of interesting crepes and other breakfast foods.

My room in the south tower was pretty nicely kept and seemed modernish. The shower was modern and high quality.

Will continue to update this as things progress.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Used to love staying at Tropicana. The new food options are good but everything else is sub par. Stayed this time in the Chelsea tower and despite how nice the walkway is to get there, the rooms are gross. Smelled like mildew and the blankets, light shades and table were all stained. The curtains looked like they had blood stains all over them.  The windows were wet and the wallpaper peeling off. The carpet was not clean in the room or hallways. It‚Äôs dark n dingy in the hallways. Plus you can always add an additional hour and half to check-in and get out of the parking garage.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion:
My policy is to only post positive reviews. So Atlantic City is a tough one for me. I decided to post because even though the streets around the Casino area are rough around the edges it's a place you should probably visit at least once and decide for yourself. The city has a "once was glamorous" feel, but now seems neglected and in need of a Facelift (see pics).
The Tropicana itself seems well managed and trying to bounce back from the pandemic.  The building is older, but my room was fine. Only a few of the restaurants are open and one inside pool.
The ventilation system allowed a hint of cigarette smell you find at casinos.  It seems if you stayed inside the building you could forget the neglected vibe outside.  Come see for yourself!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion:
The Tropicana resort is huge.  It took some time to get our bearings straight with the facility.

There was a good mix of table games with decent limits ($15 was common) and slots.

Great selection of restaurants and easy access to the boardwalk.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: The Trop is usually my go to in AC because there are tons of food options and multiple bars with happy hour deals. After this visit I may be looking for a new destination. Service was absolutely terrible throughout the entire casino. Every drink ordered AR a slot machine came out wrong, then the waitresses argued with me that they brought what I ordered. Some weren't even close. I ordered a rum and coke and they brought me a beer instead. Food was delicious every place we ate, but again terrible service and only had 2 meals in 4 days that came out correct the first time.  Housekeeping was another nightmare. We called at 9am Sunday to request service. We were out all day and no one came to clean, bring fresh towels etc. We called again and the desk told us someone would be there in an hour. We came back after dinner and the garbage was not taken, towels not taken, bed not made, and a pile of new towels and soap left on the bed. The next morning Housekeeping walked in without knocking. We told her it has ok and she could clean the room but she left and never came back. Had to call the desk for toiletries and again no one came. Day three we put the do not disturb sign on and Housekeeping knocked on the door for 10 minutes until I got up and answered. They asked if we wanted service. We had also asked for extra pillows when we checked in...I just checked out on day five and still no pillows. This was my only vacation this year, and stupid little things like this add up and make it hard to enjoy. While Caesars and Harrahs have less options for food and are smaller, my experiences there have been much better.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion:
Rooms were very basic. No carpet.  The bathroom had leaks in the sink faucet,  the bathtub and toilet.

My phone wrong 2 days in a row at 6:30 a.m. even though I didn't have a wake up call.
If it's windy the 41st floor has something banging all night outside the building.

Finding the self parking lot was a major challenge.

The signs for the lobby are not very good. I had to use a self check in kiosk.

The casino area was good.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: The Tropicana shares a reputation for being the ultimate affordable getaway. Instead what it provided was a terrible first experience. It was not what I expected at all. It took us almost an hour and a half to figure out where my room was, then when I finally got there it was outdated and sub-par.There was no one to offer anyone a guide to navigating the huge property. The kiosks are supposed to provide a map emailed at Check in and one was never received. When we finally got a hold of someone, they did change the room and for that I am thankful. However what was supposed to be a relaxing mid week getaway was a poor experience.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.

The casino and hotel offer a lot, there‚Äôs even a little Havana theme with palm trees in the hallways and cobblestone streets. The rooms were very noisy (I could hear everyone around me) cheap small tv old curtains one thin blanket and two sheets on the bed only. No air or temp control and the shower took over 30 minutes to get hot.
I‚Äôm addition the room was a bit worn; peeling wallpaper paint stains, no metal fittings on sprinklers, dirty shower curtain. We made it work, but I wouldn‚Äôt go back.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: The hotel staff is terribly bad, bad tempered and bad service.  The facilities are nice and comfortable.  The beach is very good to visit with children.  The businesses that are outside the hotel and in the market are very professional and provide good service.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Tropicana is terrible. First lets start with check in. The line was soooo long. No where to sit . I was very dizzy and was told i had to stand in line. My room was full of mold. I was coughing and sneezing alot. My eyes were itching. So as i started to investigate the room my sheets were dirty. The walls had black drippings rolling down the entire room walls. Maybe water stains but it was yucky! I had a double bed room . The water burned my skin and is difficult to get it to the right temperture. My phone fell and upon pulling the beds  out i saw so much yuck which explains why my allergies were all over the place. The tv was dusty. Towels had burn marks and more. Not to mention I had a groupon that states the promotional value never expires. But everyone acted like they had no idea what i was presenting in front of them so I never got to use it. One supervisor said "hang tight we are starting another groupon soon". Just sad! Im very annoyed with the service. I stayed two nights tuesday and thursday and both rooms were distguisting!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.

I stayed for an overnight stay, and woke up in the morning & went to the beach. It's really good. My only problem was that, I forgot my charger in the room. I asked the cleaning lady to open the door or go in & get it for me nicely & she tried to tell me that wasn't my room even though I had been standing there. She was the only flaw. *P.s. my room pics were taken right before checkout*

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion:
I paid 400 dollars for a room in the west tower on a Friday night.  The room was clean but in need of fixing and updating.  My room, the floor, the elevators all smelled like pot in a nonsmoking room and floor.
I had to change my room at 1 am because the noise from the room next door was so loud and they were blasting music.
We spent the day at the cabana five pool deck bar.  It was beautiful. Food was good and service was ok.  Too many guests, not enough waitresses.  I bought reserved loungers for 25 each which was worth it. The cabana was not worth it based on what I could see.  I would stay again just because of the pool bar but I would stay in the cabana towers. It's new and removed from the other areas of the hotel.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion:
Stayed at the north tower with my boyfriend back in September. There was a horrible storm those two days so couldn‚Äôt venture around AC much but we still had a lot of fun as there is plenty of things to do in the resort.

Room/cleanliness: I‚Äôm a smoker (horrible- I know) so I appreciated there being smoking rooms and smoking areas in the casino so I didn‚Äôt need to go out in the wind & rain just to have a smoke.
The room was in a convenient location. Right above the casino and near the elevators. Our window view was overlooking the casino which was pretty cool. The furniture was a little dated and the cleaning was ehh but that‚Äôs pretty much the case with all smoking rooms in any hotel/resort.

Casino: clean. I saw several employees doing detailed cleaning while playing the slots.

Parking: If staying in the North tower, I recommend using the valet. It was very convenient and the charge for it wasn‚Äôt much.

Staff: no complaints about the Tropicana staff. All very friendly and helpful.

Location: perfect location to the boardwalk and beach. I definitely recommend The Rain Forest Cafe located on the boardwalk.

My only 2 complaints (one was my fault).
1.  was our experience at Hooters there. From the moment we walked in the door, the waitress was very rude. Maybe she was having a bad day but it seemed like she took one look at us and assumed we wouldn‚Äôt tip well (we tip a standard 20-30% (depending on service which I think is very fair). We were nothing but kind to her but she was still extremely rude. The other waitress walking around seemed delightful, I wish she was our waitress instead.
Complaint 2: we went during the week days in the fall so the pools weren‚Äôt open. That‚Äôs my bad for not seeing that in their website. So if you want to use a pool, double check the pools are open.
I think all the bad reviews were from people expecting it to be a five star hotel. Most said there wasn‚Äôt much signage for locations but if you look up, there are signs with arrows pointing where to go.

Over all, we had a great time and definitely plan to be back soon! Thank you for helping making our vacay a good one!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: We stayed on the north side, the pictures and the actual room where different. Then they had to move us to another room because there was mold around the vent. They moved us to a bigger room, somewhat but this was our first time staying. Overall it's was busy through out the whole casino, I'm guessing because people are getting back out. All an all not outside of the mold, we couldn't complain too much, we only paid $65 for the whole weekend. 5/7/2022 We stayed in the Havana Tower, rooms are decent, closer to all the action. The buffet is still closed but the food selections are on point, again for $74 for the weekend can't complain. 10/24/22 Did another weekend stay new restaurants are on point, something different BBQ, sushi, remodel PF Changs and breakfast brunch spot. The buffet is completely gone.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion:
I feel the biggest pro for Trop is that it is one of the best casinos for food options. Lots of different types of places like Chickie & Pete's, Palm, Carmine's, etc. The casino is decent and clean although my wife was disappointed with no Monopoly or goldfish slots (that we saw).

The room we had was pretty outdated but spacious. You can hear people next door, at least from the room we had.

We waited probably 25 mins in line Friday early evening (6:30pm) to check in. The self check-in didn't work for us so we then had to wait for a person which was another line. Expect to wait, especially on the weekend. The only major con was leaving Sunday. The parking garage was backed up all the way to the top. It was crazy. Probably close to an hour to get out.

All said, I still feel it is one of the best options in Atlantic City. It's an option for us now that it is Caesar's Rewards. We will probably stay again in the future but I know the wife will probably prefer Caesars if it's available and reasonably priced.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.

We found 2 stubs of cigarettes on the ground, it's like they sweeped and put it behind the drawer between the beds, there was someone elses hair in the shower (cause it was red and no one in my family has red hair) it reeks of cigarettes, probably because of the stubs. I've been here before in the north tower and it wasnt like this. The west tower needs more care. prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion:
So far, not so good. Self check-in kiosk put us in a double when we reserved a king. Currently waiting in line in the South Tower Lobby, a long walk from the Havana Tower where we were, for assistance in rectifying the situation.  We have already had to change our dinner reservation at Ossu. I will update once we are settled. Not getting better: only 1 person working the counter. People behind us have been waiting for an email that their room is ready for an hour. Wow.
8:30 and Gary is now helping us. "The Kiosk wouldn't make a mistake. Whatever room you booked is the one you got."
Except it's not the one we booked and, oh look, we have the confirmation.
"Well, if a king bed is important to you,I can put you in the North Tower. "
Yes, since it is what we booked, we'd like the king.
So, we're in the king on the 17th of the North Tower. It's fine. Smells vaguely of cigarettes and marijuana, but it's  AC so... We may make our new reservation at 9.
I'll update tomorrow,  but at this point, my advice is avoid this property.

Good morning. Final update: The bed is pretty soft, but would be fine if there was any substance to the pillows, or if there were more pillows (4 small "feather" pillows on a king bed with no extras in the closet).
The temperature was impossible to regulate to any satisfaction. See the picture of the 70's technology thermostat.
The shower looked beautiful, however the design is awkward and it functions poorly.

We come to AC plenty and took a chance on the "New" Tropicana on this visit. This was a mistake.  Stay somewhere else. Hard Rock was fine, Ocean was lovely, Golden Nugget was really good, and Borgata and The Water Club are wonderful.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: So after a bad experience at another Atlantic City Casino we decided to go to the one that doesn't disappoint...well this time it was just ok.  All Restaurants open and food great, Palm, Broadway Burger and Casa Taco and Tequilla Bar, A++ Room was ok for a Junior Suite.  Regular Staff friendly. prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion:
Made our annual trip to AC and had a good time at the Tropicana. Plenty to do inside the casino, centrally located to everything we wanted to do outside the casino. Attached parking garage.

Decent selection of restaurants, bars, lounges stores and eateries in the casino and mall. No complaints, good customer service.

Stayed in the West Tower, rooms were nice enough, but the elevators and bathroom could use an update. Honestly, how much time do you spend in a hotel room on vacation?

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: We had such a fantastic time. The staff was so helpful, and security was spot on. Even stop me from eating at the slots, but I respect their wishes and covid protocols. Also, we appreciate security for their fast response to a 4 AM noise complaint. My mom and I stayed in the north tower and loved every minute of it. The shower was hot ü•µ in all the right ways. No dust was found, and the mirror and air ducts were spotless. The beds were extremely comfortable and spacious. You may need to call for a blanket if you enjoy your room below 65. The north tower was closest to the marketplace. My mom and I loved it, as it took us 1 minute to get to the breakfast and food section. The quarter isn‚Äôt too far, but we loved our stay and flight. We have already booked another trip. I wish we did have the north tower again, but I didn‚Äôt mind exploring the other tower's benefits. Please visit, and wear your walking shoes or chunky heels. This hotel is lovely, full of great people, and has too much fun for a short stay. In addition to that, visit the Hash House of Go-Go and get Yvette. She‚Äôs a genuinely unique waitress. I promise you won‚Äôt regret the meals or air drinks.

If I were a betting man, I would say AC will be down to rubbish in the next 10 -20 years unless these crooked AC politicians get serious about investing in AC. prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Enjoyed being back at the Tropicana (I spent time there in the 90's) It was good to see that some of the former Ballys Casino staff, had migrated down beach. . . My room proximity to the Casino was great. Very pleased with the North Tower. Once I figured out, how to get to the 5üåüGilchrist for breakfast. It was during that walk, in the early mornings. I had the chance to observe the Cleaning Crews, and their attention to detail. Hand rails, escalators, elevators, corners of window sills, spotless. . . And the pool I passed at the Chelsea Tower looked so inviting and clean. . . I was Loving once again, my "New" Favorite AC Casino. . . Since merging with Caesars Rewards & Loyalty Program. . . *Update*. . . I want to Thank the Casino Staff for all they do. . . Fran the Floor Manager, is such a gentleman and professional. Big Ed V. Floor Supervisor also a gentlemen and professional, has the ability to make everyone feel welcome and appreciated. . . Sharp dresser and great sense of humor. . . It takes a special talent, to deal with some of these players, when they have been drinking all night. . . I want to recognize some of my favorite Table Games Dealers. Michael, who has been at the Tropicana since it was built. Paul also has been here almost as long. And George another long time employee who is fun, helpful, and hilarious. . . I'm looking forward to seeing them all, on my next trip. . .

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion:
For entertainment and dining this place is great, but do NOT stay in the West tower unless you're trying to save a few bucks.

Entertainment: Casino is vast, table games are plenty (enough) and the sportsbook is big.

Check in: they have many electronic kiosks, but they seemed clunky. Many people were having issues that required help, including us. They'll help did come quickly.

Rooms: We suggest not staying in West. Beds were okay. Bathroom is big. But the walls were scuffed/marked like a children's playroom. There is no carpeting, just vinyl floor which makes it a bit cold, (and more importantly louder above you.) If you do get a West tower room, request as far from the elevators as possible (you want the last two digits of your room number to be as high as possible, definitely above 25).

If you love 80s bathroom fixtures, and showers that whistle like tea kettles, then you'll love West. Haha.

Do not even think of trying to get an elevator near checkout time. After waiting five minutes, we took the stairs from the 45th floor and there were so many taking the stairs you'd think it was an evacuation.

Not a horrible room, and it was a few bucks cheaper, but had we'd known, we definitely would've paid more to be anywhere except West.

Parking: Extremely reasonable at only $10 for Saturday and Sunday night, and our check-in gave us a $5 voucher. So $5 total for 2 days of parking? Fabulous. There is no need to pay for valet.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Didn‚Äôt stay at the hotel, but visited the casino to gamble. Feels very outdated, but service was still great. Loved the fireworks at 10pm that they have every Saturday! ‚ú®

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion:
Be aware that unless you book directly through the Tropicana hotel (website), you're more likely working with a booking agency (not directly affiliated with the Tropicana Hotel) and you won't  know the total cost of the room until you check in at the hotel.

Your room is subject to taxes and fees (TOURISM FEE/TAX 2; CASINO FEE/TAX 2; A.C. OCC SURCHARGE/TAX 2; RESORT FEE/TAX 2) that booking agents don't disclose when you make and pay for your reservation (a least ours didn't).

These additional fees and taxes increased the cost of the 2-night stay from $92.70 to $184.01.

While the final cost may not be outrageous, it is certainly (at twice the listed nightly rate) more than you expected when you booked the room.

In addition to that, our booking agent charged only $50 (of the total cost of our stay) to my credit card at the time of booking, leaving the remaining balance to be paid at check-in. And the reservation was not confirmed for the section of the hotel whee we prefer to stay.

Our room was cold both nights but after a 'jump start', it started to warm up a bit (recycling regularly on it's own for the 1st time since we arrived). Annoying, yes. But not worth relocating or having to wait for someone from maintenance to show up and address the problem. The room was clean, good sized, uncarpeted, poorly lit (and heated) with just a desk, one lonely desk chair, a safe and mini fridge (that whined) and no microwave.

Spacious bathroom with pull bars in the tub/shower but only one hook to hang things on (towels, PJ's, wash cloths or anything else).

Parking is NOT FREE, but it's reasonable.

As long as you know what to expect when you book, you can relax and enjoy the place. It would be nice, I think, if Jersey lawmakers would require these booking agencies to disclose their status and all of the additional costs when they take your call.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: I love walking around inside of here. Such beautiful design and love the area which is like a food court. Casino had fun games. (Not a gambler) I am walking with a cane, so it ended up being wrong Casino to stay at, since it a distance from most places on boardwalk. Plus we had a long way to walk for our room. I'd only give credit to a couple bellhop & valet, but don't know their names. Room was gorgeous.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.

The floor was sticky, the bedding was stained, the walls were stained with some kind of ‚Äúdrips‚Äù. I‚Äôve stayed here in the past and it wasn‚Äôt bad but this trip was just bad. Super upset with the cleanliness.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: I would love to give this place 5 stars except check out and getting out of the parking lot took almost 2 hours. It's ridiculous, they need to take a better look at ways to resolve these issues. The only way to catch an elevator to get you downstairs was to ride up to the top floor and come back down to get to the lobby. Long lines to get out and was very discouraging. The rooms were beautiful spacious and clean. However, if I state there will be 4 people checking in there should be a minimum of 4 towels in the room.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion:
So, if I paid specifically to have an ocean view room, should my rate be adjusted to be proportional to the ocean view I have?

Getting to the front desk is rather difficult. There is no clear direction from parking to the front desk. I wandered for about 20 minutes with many employees pointing me in different directions (no signs). Finally an employee from an adjoining hotel walked me to the desk.

I booked the room online and chose the 'pay now' option so as to not get hidden fees and make check-in quick. Be advised, your card will end up with two holds for both the first night and the entire amount.

The room was spacious and clean and housekeeping was prompt and courteous.

The comedy show is a must!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Loving coming here! They installed these Roulette tables that are my favorite. I enjoy playing roulette but don‚Äôt like how rowdy the table can get sometimes. Sitting here you‚Äôre in your own little space and it‚Äôs great. The only downside is the comps are not the same as when you‚Äôre out an actual table.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Took a 1 night stay here. The rooms were very clean despite the fact that it was a smoking room it smelled really fresh and clean. They are also very spacious and the beds are very comfortable. 24 hour casino is a plus for the gamblers. There are plenty of stores and places to eat around the hotel. It is a huge hotel so if it's your first time prepare to get a bit lost to find the check in desk.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: We had a great time at Tropicana!  The casino was very clean.  I booked the Havana room in the Havana Tower.  Views from the room were incredible! Great price just after Christmas.   Check in was easy and fast.  Just make sure you have your driver's license ready for the check in kiosk.  We had drinks at the Saloon and the tequila bar downstairs.  The nachos at the tequila bar were incredible!  Get it with the chicken.  You won't be disappointed!  We went here for my birthday and ate at Carmines.  Ordered the meatballs, chicken wings and a slice of lasagna.  Delicious!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: They say location is everything.But the homeless population on the boardwalk in that area  is insane . The casinos make so much money but does nothing to clean it up .

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion:
Pros: The hotel itself is great. Kiosk‚Äôs located throughout the hotel allow the guests to check out really easily. Great food and entertainment options. Valet is $35 and you get your car back in under 10 minutes. Fireworks at night. Great casino.

Cons: Check in desk had 2 staff members for a line of 15+ groups needing to check in. Kiosks would redirect you to the check in desk. From waiting in line to finally getting my room keys was about 45 minutes. Not all the rooms have a nice view but it‚Äôs give in take: view of a parking garage but located next to a lot of dining/shopping options. The room was fairly dirty. During COVID it would be nice to have a little extra cleaning. Especially with the $35 a night ‚Äúresort fee‚Äù that is charged. Trash left from the prior guest, stains on the sheets, hair in the drain, oily hair dryer, stains on the wall, and dusty room should not be an acceptable condition. Water or drain from bathroom sink had a funny smell. Umbrella rental is $20 for the beach-you can buy an umbrella for that much at one of the souvenir stands off the boardwalk.

Overall, hotel is great. Rooms could use more work. Staff is friendly.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion:
HOTEL: Stayed here recently Saturday night in the Havana Tower‚Äîroom was fairly spacious and clean.  Decor was a bit outdated but the bathroom was nice.  Even got a partial ocean view!  The walls are thin, so you can hear the traffic outside at night and the guests in the hallway if they are loud.  Check-out was Sunday and it was a nightmare getting back to the parking garage‚Äîthere was a line of 40+ people just waiting for the elevator to get to their cars.

CASINO: The casino area looks remodeled and I really like the ambiance here‚Äîhas an energetic vibe.  But it‚Äôs crowded so I had trouble finding a blackjack table with open seats.  There‚Äôs a lot of food and bar options in Tropicana which is great!  And on Saturday nights, they have fireworks outside in the boardwalk around 10pm that‚Äôs worth checking out!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Went to Tropicana to do the Escape Room with friends and showed up fifteen minutes early only to find it closed.  Made some calls and got a recording.  Five minutes before show time, we got a call telling us the employee was sick and if we‚Äôll stick around for and hour and a half for someone else to come in.  We declined and was told we‚Äôd get our $299 refunded.  The casino itself was nice, clean and not as noisy as the Hard Rock Casino (playing loud music 24/7).  I got buttered popcorn at the IMAX theatre without seeing a movie (a bonus for me).

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.

While I was trying to rest people above me must have been moving furniture then someone next to me kept knocking on the wall. They really need to get that hotel together as much as it valet park and stay there I would expect it to look and be way better. prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.

We called the concerige and went to the front desk for assistance. We were told that they can send someone to spray the room and we can probably move to another room the next day.  The manager did not come out of the office to address our concern, so we checked out and went to the Sheraton Hotel.  We were trying to check out the view, but the windows were filthy.  First time and last time at the Tropicana Hotel. We would love to speak to the owner regarding our concerns.

We finished off the decade with three nights in the RV portion of the Waterfront offering, and enjoyed it immensely.  We parked less than 10 yards from the water with a great view.  The water here is so clear you can see the bottom like looking through glass. Even when wind whipped up some small waves you could see through the waves to the rocky bottom.

The facilities have very nice and clean showers, and a commons room you can gather in for a game. The road is close and busy through the day, but traffic dies off through the evening and it is very peaceful.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a resort hotel.

We were able to back into #14 with a 20' trailer, I cannot imagine doing it with anything larger. It seemed that several of the concrete pads were not level, we noticed an RV with both of its front tires off the ground after being leveled. We enjoyed kayaking but found strong and irregular currents in front of the PUD building. We didn't notice any real beach, but maybe the tides were off while we were there. We were able to launch kayaks from the bottom of some rock steps. It's a great spot, really well kept and we will be back!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a american restaurant.
completion: The husband and I have decided to set off and try a new place where we have never ate before every Friday for date night, with that being said we found ourselves here. My first impression wasn't bad at first. It was very beautiful when we walked in. A little confusing because you choose if you'd like to eat in the Diner or Pub and each menu was a tad different (as they did show us) but I was still confused so I just said Diner so we could get to eating. After about a 20 minute wait we was finally placed into a corner but at this point I didn't care, I was just ready to eat. We ordered our drinks and appetizers, those took about 15 minutes to receive. I immediately noticed that the glass was dirty, still at this point I'm trying to stay positive. I calmly wait as we wait for our waiter to come back so I can express my concerns to him unfortunately he took about 20 minutes before he came back in that 20 minutes we watched others get drinks numerous times and their food as we still set there waiting to just get one more drink, at this point I'm getting annoyed. Right about then a manager walk by and I expressed my concerns to her and she immediately address the issue. We finally receive our food from our original waiter and to be honest the burger was okay it didn't have much flavor at all but at this point I'm still trying to stay positive and look at the positive like at least the fries are good right? Just overall not a good experience I don't think I would ever go back there again the manager however did come up to us and offer us a free dessert to take home and we kindly took it home with us to enjoy later. Not the best experience for me the food was very pricey and definitely not worth the money.

This review is for Winston‚Äôs pub.

Writing a review is a pain in the toto. I avoid it as much as possible. But this place deserves it.

There is a reason why this place is still #1:

- The bar section is nice a quiet.
- Their alcohol selections are thoughtful. There are 2 non-alcoholic beers. There is a local Michigan vodka, etc.

This place is something else. You must come visit.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a zoo.
completion:
Visited from out of town and spent family time at the Dakota Zoo.

I'm used to bigger zoos that are very crowded and the animals are 20 feet away.  I was expecting to see animals I see at my home zoo; I was wrong.  The variety and habitats of the animals is fun and interesting.

The zoo was not crowded.  My family could wander around at their own pace.  The zoo is very well covered by trees which provide shade in many places.  The paths are a bit run down, but fine for wheelchairs and strollers.  We did not have a map of the zoo which made it confusing to me.  My daughter knew her way around and there are info signs periodically to show the exhibit locations.

I did not see many food stands that I'm used to in bigger zoos.  I think everything is near the entrance.  There is a petting zoo at the entrance as well.

Well-maintained, lots of exhibits, plenty of variety, many high-interest animals, all in a spacious, easy-to-navigate setting. Having visited once w/ our six young children/teens, we'd definitely have interest in going again. The African penguin exhibit is brand new and very nice. You need to check it out!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion:
For a view of Mount Shasta, this place was one of the best in town. It was centrally located, within walking distance to most of the restaurants in town. The rooms itself could use some freshening up, not really outdated, just looked a little tired. Couldn't tell if the refrigerator in the room was working, didn't seem to get particularly cold and there was no adjustment. The restaurant was good but do yourself a favor and DO NOT PURCHASE THE PRE PAID BREAKFAST PACKAGE. They charge you $20 per person for breakfast. You get your choice of one entree and one drink. My wife ordered the Granola and coffee and wanted a bagel. She was told that she would have to pay extra for the bagel even though the total with the bagel wasn't over $20. You're better off paying as you go because you don't get the difference if your total is under $20. Staff was friendly and helpful. Overall, our stay was ok, I'd stay here again if I were in town but I wouldn't pre pay for breakfast again.

Just got a response from Best Western. They state that their breakfast package are $10 for adults and $5 for children. Going through Bookings.com we were charged $20 per person. Our total for breakfast for the 5 days we were there was $200. I will say breakfast was good but not $200 good. And at no time were our meals over $20 but we didn't get the difference back

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion:
Fantastic location for a short trip around Mt. Shasta.

Our first ever stay here. There are cheaper lodges too in the area but our risk appetite was limited, hence went for this one with higher security and better arrangement in terms of breakfast and room quality.

I just wish they could have provided housekeeping service too since we spent more than just one night. I remember how during pre-covid times the hotel rooms in any place used to be cleaned and well arranged each day by the time you were back. Miss that luxury!

Breakfast isn't a buffet. That also surprised me. They have a standard list of 6-7 entres and you have to choose your breakfast from it. Us being vegetarians had limited options and repeated the same thing the next day. It was, however, delicious. Lovvvedd the hot chocolate with whipped cream.

If there had been fruits, bread, juices, muffins and things like that as a buffet I could have adjusted the quantity and variety.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.

The indoor pool is huge and our son loved it. We couldn't have been happier with our experience.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion:
Nice grounds an a clean room and bathroom but that's about it.  The shower in the morning was only like warm... very disappointing. The bed was old and brokendown or just incredibly soft and very uncomfortable with small very LUMPY pillows. Worst night of sleep on the trip.
The restaurant is a bit old and the furniture is pretty broken down. I sunk into my seat about 3 inches! The food was pretty disappointing too...medium steak (at over $30!) Came out cold and raw. Could not send it back because the ONE server was completely overwhelmed with tables. That said...her service and attitude considering the situation was incredible! She really tried very hard to get to everyone.
It's probably a great place to being kids...nice outdoor courtyards between the buildings and little waterfalls.  There is an indoor pool that looked pretty decent.
With all the disappointment aside, the staff at this hotel is just...WOW!  From the front desk to the maintenance and housekeeping folks...every one of them was super friendly, kind and professional!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Not a luxury 5 star hotel, however i am not aware of any accommodations in the area that are. If your looking for a mountain lodge feeling, this is the place! Conveniently located with only about a 20 minute drive to Mt Shasta Ski Park. They DO NOT have the traditional free breakfast, however they do have a restaurant onsite. Also have a bar and grill. Food is a little spend but good, as expected for hotel restaurants. They were short staffed but the waitresses did their best and were very polite and accommodating. We decided to stay an extra night on a holiday weekend and while booked, the manager Joe pulled through for us and got us an extension. All of the staff work hard and are very polite. Hopefully some hotel upgrades/remodels are planned for the near future. If you plan to stay, suggest you book early, this is the go to for skiers and hikers and it fills up fast!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.

They also have a separate bar and inside heated pool and spa. I would highly recommend this if you get up here to vacation. Across the street there is Ray's market so you can stock your kitchen. We are moving on today but the kids love this place.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
