Nice place to stay for a drive from California to Portland.
The parking for moving trucks is awesomely abundant and easy access.
The rooms are small but clean, some rooms have two doors with access to the grass area as well as the hallway to the lobby.
The entrance area is beautiful for a Best Western, the dining area is huge.
There are stores, a gas station and Chase bank right across the street.
There a a few restaurants around as well and plenty of places to walk your dog.

We stayed her twice and will probably always stay here when making that drive.
I highly recommend this place.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a sushi restaurant.
completion:
This is arguably the best sushi in Easton (maybe even the shore)! I've tried all the others and I keep coming back. The staff is friendly and always asks about my family when I come in alone. The wait for food is never long, even if the place is full. You can dine in at lunch and get back to work quick. The menu items consistently taste amazing and are prepared the same way everytime... there are no surprises, if you order an Olympic roll it's going to be amazing Every Single Time, and that surely can not be said for the other places in town. Some of my favorites are "Amazing Tuna" "Jingle Bell" "Olympic" "Incredible" and "spicey crab" but all of them are good. If you go between 12 and 4 the special is "get 1 special roll and get a second at half off". Oh, and their unsweetened tea is the best in town, I know that's a small thing but it matters to me since I've given up soda.

If you're looking for a great place to have Sushi in Easton look no farther than usushi!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: If you are looking to stay at a top-notch hotel. The Best Western Premier Bridgewood (Neenah) is an excellent choice. Our family of 4 stayed here recently while on our family vacation and stayed in a 2 bedroom suite which is a must for us with two teenagers. Each of the kids had their own bed in their own room, we had a separate room with a king bed and there was also a spacious family room. Three 65 inch tvs in each space kept everyone entertained during our downtime. The room was clean, nice and spacious. The hotel itself was very clean and nice in all areas. The pool is nicer than average hotel pools featuring a shallow wading pool for small children and main pool with basketball hoop and a larger slide for older kids. Two hot tubs one indoors and one outside were nice and relaxing. On site restaurant was very good and convenient to get to within the hotel. After our stay we received an emailed survey and personal response letter from the hotel manager thanking us. We would definitely stay here again.

They suggested we carry the stroller upstairs. Not possible due to weight of stroller & 19-month old ‚Äî but also not safe for child. The folks at Dino Safari said they‚Äôve ‚Äúbeen asking‚Äù them to fix the elevator for some time.
Just keep accessibility in mind if you have a wheelchair, stroller, or if climbing multiple stairs is difficult.
The exhibit was nice, tho overpriced, imo. Our little dinosaur-loving grandson was done in under 20 mins, incl the 5 min movie at start.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a exhibit.
completion:
Main takeaways: not worth the price, but the kids did have fun. The exhibit was small, very warm (no ac even in Summer), and the main thing is that the dinosaurs appear to be inflatable? And in very poor condition (missing teeth, hair and feathers missing in large patches, sections of the inflatable not working etc.) the lighting is also very low and odd. It seems designed to be scary and colorful maybe, instead of actually being able to see any detailing on the creatures. I paid $25 per person (including the kids) and you can see the exhibit in 15-20 minutes (reading all of the educational material). It just isn‚Äôt worth it.

The only reason this isn‚Äôt a 1 star or a complaint to the organization for a refund, is that the kids did have fun. The dinosaurs are touchable (probably why they are in such terrible condition). And there is an interactive coloring program at the end that is pretty good (but even that was glitchy.)

prompt: A Google Maps review about a tropical fish store.
completion:
Very nice selection with a few issues: Many of the tanks are mislabeled; the fish are a different species or don't have a label at all. The short woman with the bangs is very rushed and careless when handling fish. She seems to be annoyed with questions and customers overall. All of the other employees, however, are friendly and care about where/how your fish will be living.

Aisles are a bit narrow, and I doubt they're ADA compliant. Salt water tanks are on the second floor, which is only accessible via stairs. Pond area is nice. The parking can be tricky, but it's mostly shaded.

All in all Aqua-Dome is a decent local spot for fish and aquarium accessories.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a tropical fish store.
completion:
At best, I'm a novice at the aquarium hobby. I've been setting up an aquarium and navigating all the intricacies that comes with setting up a new aquarium. In doing so, a social media aquarium hobby group recommended the Austin Aqua Dome as a solid, local hub for hobbyists. During my visit, I was greeted and invited to ask any questions I might have.

The building calls back to the "Keep Austin Weird" idea in both supporting a local business *and* being a wonderfully unique shopping experience in offering an infinite collection of aquarium related materiel to purchase- from fresh water to salt/marine, from ponds, to desktop bowls and extravagant custom aquariums. My overall experience was akin to me being a kid going on a great field trip like a previous visitor mentioned in their review.

Though I am still waiting to introduce fish to my aquarium, I was able to have questions answered about different live plants suitable to my experience and want for the type of fish community I'll eventually be keeping. I was introduced to a myriad of different plant varieties and they had a wonderfully diverse set of options to choose from. I ended up purchasing 5 plants of two different kinds and a wonderful piece of prepared driftwood for my setup. I also bought a plant solution to introduce and maintain for my water that promotes growth. Finally, because I look to continue my business relationship with Austin Aqua Dome, I purchased a one year membership that will likely pay for itself as my odyssey into this passtime grows. High fives all around and I can't wait to go back again and, if my S.O. doesn't kill me, maybe start a 2nd aquarium in the near future!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a tropical fish store.

MELISSA was an angel!! A true gem and the best addition to this Austin staple. I can't give her my highest regards. She helped me find tank mates for my big black Moor named Ronnie. She truly cared and gave me the best tips and fun facts about the creatures I was adopting. She made the shopping experience so much fun. It made my week and I love my new aquatic pets!!! I can't reccomend aquadome enough. Their selection is beautiful and store set up is otherworldly.

Would recommend going on a weekday instead of a weekend to avoid crowds.

I cannot speak enough about the staff! Most of the staff have been there for 15+ years and are enthusiasts themselves. They never rush you and are always there to help you. They also love sharing info and care tips. Hunter was very friendly and helpful; we got to understand more of his specialty: saltwater fishes!

We were blown away by the chefs choices, we ended up trying almost everything on the menu during our 4 night stay. We honestly could not pick a favorite. We LOVED staying here. The rooms are comfortable with large beds and beautiful sights. I don't think you could be disappointed if you stay here. Also, their hot tub is large and a wonderful addition to our stay.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a inn.
completion:
So,  we decided to wing it and drive to Stanley for an overnight adventure without making reservations at the more popular place to stay in Stanley.  We were pleasantly surprised with the price ,location, quality, friendliness, and scenic view  that we were able to obtain at the redfish riverside inn.  The office was closed when we arrived but called Dianna and she came over within five min.
The room came with two queen beds with what I believed to be 1000 thread count sheets.  Refrigerator, two stovetop burners, microwave and beautiful view of the Salmon river.  We saw a wolf, fox and herd of elk the next morning while having coffee on our deck.   This place was awesome and I can't say enough good thing about it. The pic shows elk upstream from the room.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a aquarium.
completion:
Not sure why people complain about this place. We were inside for a little over an hour. We had enough time to see everything and it wasn't too crowded. The staff are extremely friendly and good with kids and happy to answer any questions.

We got a Groupon and it was about $26 for an adult and 1 kid, total. They also have various coupons online and you can combine prices with Legoland for a larger discount. We went the cheap route and just went to Sea Life.

We bought the $5 Mission Pack and my nephew (7 yo) was super excited to find all of the stamps and get his little badge of completion. They even have a little play area (think McDonald's play area size) at the end of the tour, in addition to various simple games throughout the whole place.

Nephew's Review: "Uh I like Sea Life. It's one of my favorite uhh fishing museums I've ever went to. Fart. Don't add that fart there. Don't add it."

prompt: A Google Maps review about a aquarium.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a aquarium.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a aquarium.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a aquarium.
completion:
SEA LIFE Michigan Aquarium is a great place to go.  The entry fee is a little high but in line with other aquariums around the country.  If they brought it down a little I believe they would see even more traffic and serve a greater part of the community.

The exhibits are kept neat and clean on the outside.  There were just two tanks they seemed to be having problems with but it was obvious they were working on it.  The staff was welcoming and engaged.  We had a slight difficulty at exit getting our ‚Äòfree photo‚Äô when we were directed to go back into the line to get it.  That was worked out satisfactorily.

They have apparently been actively engaged in breeding and helping wounded wildlife but I did not see anything specific about that in the exhibits other than some numbers posted at entry.

They have a wide variety of sea life on display and they all appeared in good health.  Most of the displays had plastic plants in them.  It would be nice to see more natural environments for the creatures and to examine them.

The viewing tunnel was very crowded.  There was no docent there and several patrons took the opportunity to rest and enjoy the tunnel while a single line file of other patrons had to navigate through along with carriages and mall baggage they might have with them.

Overall this is an excellent location to visit.  The children enjoyed it.  I would recommend by passing the play area.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a aquarium.
completion: Super cool!!! We did feel rushed because there wasn't time to really stop and read signs as people were hurded thru. We will come again tho and just walk slow even if people get mad. Great learning environment for the kids and 90% of the stuff in the gift shop at the end happens to be recycled!!!!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a aquarium.
completion: I was skeptical when we arrived at the mall, but what a pleasant surprise finding this aquarium. You must buy your tickets online, they were no line coming in. Love how all the rooms are educational and tell you on the iPad located on the wall about all the fish you see in the tanks. There was an opportunity for the kids to touch starfish and anemones. We were impressed with the see-through tunnel toward the end with sharks, turtles, colorful fishes, and stingrays.  The kids had a blast, we will be back!

Terrific place to visit located inside Great Lakes Crossing, medium size aquarium, tank displays were Fantastic  with so many different species of aquatic life.  The touching pool was Great w/a variety of species to touch.  Wonderful how exhibits are spaced out and totally wheelchair accessible.  The entire Aquarium is so kid friendly, will definitely be going back w/the G'children.  We spent about 45 mins inside the venue then went and had a late lunch in the food court.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a aquarium.
completion:
My family and I enjoyed the aquarium. There are a lot of great sea life to enjoy and some games to play. Older children would probably not enjoy this as much as the younger ones. Still a great experience and place to educate on all things water life.
As a person who has enjoyed many aquariums throughout the states, this one is very small when doing price comparison. If you use the coupons and discounts available (AAA, buy legoland get aquarium, or child free coupons) it is worth it. However the price without such is not worth it.
Example: (walk up pricing)
TN adults are $35 & child (3-12) $22
MI adults are $24 & child (3-12) $19
TN -We spent 4 hours exploring 2 HUGE buildings Sea & Fresh water life(could have explored longer too). Played several free games. Touched turtles.
MI- 1 hour exploring played 2 free games, and touched turtles.
Is it worth visiting? Yes
Is it fun? Yes
Just plan ahead and get those discounts. Do not think it is like other big ones. It will not take long to get through so add in that legoland funüòÅ

prompt: A Google Maps review about a italian restaurant.
completion: Excellent food and service highlight this wonderful restaurant on the north side of Columbus!  I was recently visiting family and we decided to go to Nicola for a nice quiet dinner. I went with the lasagna, as I also do, on my first visit to an Italian restaurant and it did not disappoint.  We had also ordered a beef carpaccio appetizer for the table that was quite excellent.  We capped off the meal with an exquisite rendition of tiramisu, that proved to be a delicious finale to our dining experience.  I highly recommend this restaurant and am definitely looking forward to my next visit!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a italian restaurant.
completion:
Came here originally on my birthday last year . The food is just amazing. The chef / owner is from Italy and knows how to cook. The homemade pastas were amazing , the staff knew what kind of wine my wife needed , as their wine menu was very overwhelming. Huge wine menu lol .

My wife wanted come back on Valentine‚Äôs Day weekend on a Saturday , and it was such a lovey experience ..... we started with the fried calamari. It was crunchy and tender. Got a nice $30 of Cabernet and it was smooth. I don‚Äôt really drink wine but I was able to drink a whole bottle with wifey . Next we got a shrimp / crab dish and 4 cheese ravioli. We did come at 8pm so the crowd died down so our service was pretty spot on .

Love love love this place !

***updates*** 12/21/2020

Just came here on a Monday for my bday and it was perfect ! When we got there at 6pm there was only us and another table. We practically had the restaurant for a good 30 minutes to ourselves . Usually this place is packed but probably due to covid it has slowed down. They closed their larger dining area. We had a bottle of wine , few appetizers , and two main courses ! Our food was awesome ! And service was great ! Wish it was busier so the restaurant stays in business.

Apps
Caprese
Carpaccio

prompt: A Google Maps review about a italian restaurant.
completion: This was our anniversary and we wanted to celebrate with fine tasting Italian food. This was it! Outside on their patio, sipping a tasty, tart cocktail and a nice Barbera red. We love caprese and adding basil pesto is a keeper. The Tuscan Nido was perfect-handmade and hands down the largest ravioli-the added surprise of an egg yolk hidden inside was genius! The Filetto Di Maiale(pork tenderloin) was perfectly cooked and the flavor was mouth watering, even as I ate it! We wrapped it up with their lemon cake. Oh, man, so light and lemony. We took smaller and smaller bites so it would last longer. Give them a go, we‚Äôll certainly be back!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a italian restaurant.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a italian restaurant.
completion: Excellent service, friendly staff, huge wine list and tasty food. We had a great bottle of Chianti. Then we split the calamari and caprese. The calamari was perfectly cooked, not chewy at all. I saw the guy in the kitchen breading it. The caprese was honestly one of the best I've had. Being winter, the tomato wasn't the best but the mozzarella was perfect. It was topped with a delicious pesto. And the plate was drizzled with the thickest balsamic glaze I've ever had. It was almost like caramel. The balsamic glaze was extremely flavorful. For our main courses, we had the Tuscan Nido and the wild mushroom Tagliatelle. The Tuscan Nido was basically a giant ravioli. The filling had great flavor. I loved the pops of whole peppercorn and the fried sage leaves. The pasta was clearly homemade and perfect. The wild mushroom Tagliatelle was even better. The mushroom flavor was amazing and the smell was just divine. Normally, I would have liked to see the addition of truffle to a dish like this but honestly, I think it was near perfect without. The mushrooms just had such good flavor. To top off our meal, the lady who seated us came around to see how our meal was. Based on our conversation, I assume she was the owner. She was incredibly sweet. We will be back.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a buffet restaurant.
completion:
Today my family and I arrived at Golden Corral in Sterling Heights Michigan and were extremely disgusted with what we saw.

After paying (over $60) we finally found a table that was clean. When we went to the bar, we saw nothing but food thrown all over the floor, the bar was disgustingly dirty, and completely empty. Servers and the manager were just walking through the food all over the floor, never cleaning anything at all. It was so bad, I decided to take photos as well for you.

After sitting down, it took us 15 minutes to get silverware, and over 25 min to get drinks. Our server never cleared the plates from our table when needed either.

As for at the bar; the woman doing the steaks was more interested in flirting and trying to get a date with a customer than actually helping customers, cleaning anything, or even putting steaks on the grill. The salad bar was basically full of rotting fruit and slimy lettuce.

At the desert bar, there was chicken on the floor, food everywhere. My biggest concern was the fact that there were peanuts all over the bar, mixed into other toppings, on the cookies, on the brownies, etc. As someone with an extreme nut allergy, this type of cross contamination is deadly, let alone disgusting.

For $60 my family and I ate one plate of food that was cold by the time we got our silverware because the bar was empty and never refilled. I understand that places may be short staffed but that is not an excuse for any of this. If the health department would have walked in, the place would have been closed immediately‚Ä¶.and honestly should have. When the manager, the staff, the servers, and guests are having to walk through food on the floor and nothing is being cleaned or refilled, that‚Äôs awful. We have been here several times and this is the most disgusting restaurant I have ever seen.

The photos shown below are just some of the photos I took. The entire restaurant was like this.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a buffet restaurant.
completion: If you spend a dollar at this place, you're drunk, high, or both. Absolutely disgusting restaurant in every way imaginable. Odd aroma throughout the entire restaurant... all the food tastes like said aroma. If you don't get sick from the food, you may just die by getting stabbed by the knives that are stuck in the ceiling tiles. Heath department needs to shut this place down like yesterday! 4.0 rating at the time of this review has got to be a joke. Save yourself, your loved ones, and your pocket book. Gotta run... Emergency bathroom break!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a miniature golf course.
completion:
This place is amazing! 18 holes of glow in the dark golf to beat the heat in phoenix. Staff is super awesome. The 18 hole golf course is fairly big and everything is easy to knock out in about 30-45 minutes. Bathrooms and party rooms available. I wish we lived closer because we would definitely have had some birthday parties here.

The balls glow in the dark and can be ‚Äúreactivated‚Äù every 3 golf courses. The Black lights brighten everything up and I would recommend wearing clothes with colors that will glow.

Glow putt did get busy towards the end of our time there but we never felt in the way of that we were holding anyone up.

I‚Äôd recommend for all ages (1-99+) and for all types of activities (dates, birthdays)

10/10 would recommend taking a selfies or group photos on the 17th hole tunnel.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a miniature golf course.
completion:
This was a fantastic adventure. I would recommend going as a group of 2 or more. As this would be a very bland one person experience. The other people make it a blast.

Its relatively cheap, only about 10$ a person, for an hour or longer depending on the size of your group.

If I had to describe my least favorite experience, it would be the lack of variety of some hole layouts. Few are rather creative, and have some cool glow in the dark features. Most are fairly straight forward and require very little creativity to sink the putt. I would have liked to have seen holes that allowed two or three different ways to complete them. Even this was not enough to deter me from having a great time at low cost.

They do offer different types of discounts and party plans. This was an excellent way to have fun out of the sun. The staff was friendly and courteous.

Also they have really respected the social distancing brought on by COVID19. Each putter and ball is wiped and sanitized before each new user. They require masks which can be fun if you get one that looks cool in the black light.

Everyone we came into contact with was friendly and helpful. The only downside I might mention is that there is only of toilet and one shower for the whole park. We came in the off season, so this was no big deal. Not sure what it would be like in the busy season.
Overall a great place and we loved our stay! Will be returning for sure! Location is key and this place is perfectly situated between, Rialto Beach, La Push, Forks, & the Hoh. Didn‚Äôt hurt that they fully embrace the Twilight mania that has over taken this area either. I was here for the National Park, but am also a Twilight fan, so I really enjoyed all the little Twilight touches they had. ‚ò∫Ô∏è

prompt: A Google Maps review about a resort hotel.
completion:

The shower was small but had plenty of hot water and good pressure. It came stocked with pots and pans and other things you'd likely need, including a gas stove.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: You will miss your bed at home real quick! The only thing keeping me from giving a two star or worse rating was the fantastic customer service: front desk, housekeeping, and the breakfast attendant. Otherwise this Hilton-brand Hampton Inn and Suites is not worth the higher price point than many of the other options in Aberdeen and is way overdue for a refresh (maybe we can blame Covid-19). The colors and finishes in the lobby, halls and rooms are dinged, scuffed and just plain ugly. The king-sized bed in our non-suite room was caving in and needing replacement. When booking, be aware not all the rooms are like the pictures on the site, some are very plain with no kitchenette, just an awkward mini fridge and microwave by the desk in the room. No real dresser if you like to unpack just a small hutch with sticking drawers that the TV sits on. Pull out style love seat sofa seemed like a great option for the kids, but the window was very drafty and our son about froze the first night. The blankets were very thin waffle weave style. We asked for a second for the next night and he put on extra clothes and was okay. Not comfortable enough for an adult, he slept on it backwards, because even he could feel the metal. The bathroom was a good size which was nice for a family traveling with younger kids, but the bathroom fixtures were loose and the shower almost didn't work. The toilet took several flushes. The pillows in our room weren't the usual mixture of firm and soft (feather and polyfill as it turned out for here), but housekeeping brought us new ones when we inquired at the front desk during breakfast. The breakfast was quite good. Many choices, including an oatmeal area with fixings, plus other hot options, waffles, fresh fruit, yogurt, biscuits and gravy one morning and the next eggs and sausage patties. Coffee options were hot. Pool and hot tub area was small, but we had fun anyways. Pool towels were restocked regularly. Elevator floor became sticky one evening, but as we were in and out, right away they had it mopped I noticed. Again, great customer service that way. We also did laundry which was weirdly on the second floor off in the corner, kinda creepy, but washing and each dry cycle was just a dollar in quarters. Front desk had change.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: MOLD AND TERRIBLE HOUSEKEEPING!!! Front desk has great customer service. Kayla was very attentive and has great customer service. I stayed ten nights and housekeeping would show up every other day. I had to do my own bed, and take out my trash on the days that no one would show up. On the days that they showed up it was around 4 PM and in a bad mood. I talked to a manager by the name of Kyle three times and he did nothing about it. My shower was never cleaned even though I mentioned to the housekeeping lady that I had mold in the shower. I stay at Hampton Inn‚Äôs all the time and this is definitely the worst house keeping in the country. They should win a Golden Globe Broom for the worst housekeeping service.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a theme park.
completion: This place is epic.  When you first step into the park you're welcomed Disney-style by cast members hoping to share their story and complain about the mystery that has "befallen the land".  As you move from area to area interacting with characters (usually about 30-40+ each night) you find out more about this mystery.  Eventually, you realize that everything might not be as it seems and there are actually multiple mysteries and many different storylines to enjoy.  There are multiple levels of story that can be enjoyed by the first-timer, the introvert, extrovert, or the seasoned park-goer.  Come to socialize, to observe, enjoy the pretty lights and music, or to practice archery and axe throwing.  This place is truly loved by my 10-year-old boy, my teenage girls, and their grandparents.  My wife and I have taken some date nights here and didn't even tell the kids we went (or we'd be in trouble).  I am not into D&D and I hate dressing up for Halloween (sad, but true).  I'm a shorts and T-shirt kind of guy.  I still enjoy coming here again and again and playing along with the story and meeting new characters. Many people do dress up so if you're into that, you won't feel out of place.  While we don't dress up we still feel like we belong. Think of this as a "live theater" performance where you step onto the stage and the acting takes place close around you.   In the past, we've had season passes for Disneyland and have spent time in Disney World.  We also have had season passes for our local theater and love to attend.  I have to admit, the acting here is superb and a 10 out of 10!  I have been in situations where the tension could be "cut with a knife" and other situations where I've cried with the characters.  If you plan a trip, I'd recommend attending more than one evening.  You won't regret it.  The entrance fee is very reasonable (less per hour than a movie ticket) and the food there is well-priced and amazing (changes each season).  Make sure you arrive 15 minutes before they open and plan to stay until closing time.  Wear comfortable shoes. You don't have to walk a ton if you don't want to and I've seen people in wheelchairs and electric scooters....  but if you do enjoy walking and you get into the story, expect to get your steps in for the day!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a theme park.
completion:
This is a very unique place. It has a lot of potential. I can see it growing to be really popular. I write my experience with the hopes that improvements can be made to really enhance the place.

The park vibe:
Very cool idea. It did feel like we were in a whole different world. Sadly I could still see some things under construction which I wish was covered up like Disney does it. But I also understand the new business budget can‚Äôt afford that much. So not a big deal. I loved the characters walking around and being interactive. They were a lot of fun. At night the lightning is eery and fun. It would be kinda scary for young kids though. And it would be easy to loose a child in that lighting.

The costumes:
Very high quality costumes the employees wear. But also, many guests of the park wear costumes too. Which is fun but kinda difficult to tell who is an employee and who isn‚Äôt. I wished the employees had glowing name tags so I could know who to ask for directions and stuff from. It would be awkward to ask another guest for help.

The food:
I LOVED the sandwhich I ordered. Very yummy! The monte Cristo at the dessert shop was very oily though and I wished it had been cooked in an air fryer instead. I also wish the menu had pictures. It‚Äôs a lot easier for me to order things that I can see.

The magic show:
The beginning was really boring. Your typical magic tricks that you see. Was not a fan of the ‚Äúword‚Äù trick because there was no magic to it. He never even said what the word was. Maybe that was a distraction for his next trick but I didn‚Äôt like it. The last trick was awesome! One of my all time favorite tricks to watch. Very impressed with that. Giving his act more of a WOW the entire time would really make this place have more credibility. Go all out!

The train:
We loved the train. Super fun to see the whole town and go around the train. Fun for kids and fun for us. Just a short little ride.

The map:
I like the graphics of the map. That is user friendly. But the magician tent and stuff isn‚Äôt on it. And all the locations seem to be in the mythical words and make it not user friendly at all. I had no idea what there was to do and where it was. Many people around me were confused too. I wish we were given a map when we entered and I wish there were big maps around the park. I just need it to say the different places and what there is to do and explore at each one.

Getting Lost:
Aside from what I already talked about with the map, I wished each location had a solid sign of what it was right on the building or tent. I wasn‚Äôt sure what buildings we could and couldn‚Äôt go in. I need more than a chalkboard in front of the magician tent that says...
‚Äúmagic show‚Äù and then a sign at eye level with the times of the shows. I arrived at 6:00 and the sign said magic show every half hour. But they didn‚Äôt open till 7:00 so at 6:30 I was confused why nobody was there.

Haunted House:
Sadly I had to work and leave early so we were not able to experience the highlight of the park. Next time I‚Äôll give you some info on that.

Website:
The website for sure needs help. It needs to be more simple in layout and show what‚Äôs in the packages and what there is to do better. I needed everything disclosed. I kept reading about some sort of circus and when I asked some of the employees about it they said they were the circus.. I expected a circus show with animals and tricks. Not just characters walking around. Maybe it was a misunderstanding on my end but yeah really confusing. There is also a bird show that looks pretty cool from online but I wasn‚Äôt able to go to that either because I had to leave early for an important work zoom call.

I wish there was a restroom on the north side of the park too.

I also think it would be AWESOME to have a costume shop! Also little kiosks around selling hot coacoa, hand warmers, and fun merch.

Don‚Äôt let the 2 starts fool you. This place has the potential to be incredible. Just a few tweaks will make a big difference.

Wouldn‚Äôt recommend this for kids under age 8.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a theme park.
completion:
I was underwhelmed by my first visit, but I plan on giving them another shot.
I went oct 9th 2020.
The good:
The battle arena was lots of fun. It's the best thing there.
Archery was really cool. I wish the range was bigger so more people could shoot.  The wait to try archery is long. Like 30-45 minutes long.
My wife loved the hats and stuffed dragons.
Axe throwing looked neat but only two people could try at a time so the line was even longer than the line for archery.
We entered a large circus tent and saw a really fun show. Fire eaters, magic tricks, and gymnastics were all great to see.
There was a dragon skeleton.
The bad:
Long waits for most activities.
Some buildings were under construction and landscaping was a mess in some areas.
Questing for the various guilds could use a lot of improvement. Most of the entry level quests just don't sound fun. They will tell you some vague thing like "learn a secret", "gain someone's trust", or "learn three people's names". I wish the tasks were more fun. Why not find a monster? Fight somebody? Climb something? None of the quests sounded fun except for archery, and after I waited a long time in line to do that they closed down the range for a tournament right before it was my turn to go. Super disappointing.
Half the park was taken up by their haunted maze. It looked fun, but it was sold out for the night.
I'll probably go again in the winter or summer and just spend the whole day in the arena.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a theme park.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a theme park.
completion: Enjoyed the entire experience. Beautifully themed. Characters ready for the guests and quests. Highly recommend for families, couples, or anyone who enjoys a different kind of experience.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a theme park.
completion: Judging by the quality of construction and materials used to make the place look authentically from some fantasy world (is that an oxymoron?), this place is going to be stunning when they are finished.  But what really matters most are the many characters that roam the village and stay true to their being.  We will definitely be back to take it all in when they finish building it.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a theme park.
completion: Evermore was so fun. We took our daughter for her birthday and it could not have been more perfect or magical for her. The characters were all so devoted and made the whole experience immersive and unforgettable. I cannot wait to come back!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a theme park.
completion: Evermore park is a great theme park based on performance and costumes. As well as a park with a unique, ominous, fantasy atmosphere. Though it was not quite complete when I attended (opening night celebration) as several buildings were fenced off or still under construction, it has immense promise. The main appeal to me wasn't the gorgeous hand chiseled decorations, imported 400 year old statues, live instrument music, fantasy taverns filled with druids and fawns, or the dark gothic feel. But rather the inadvertant way the park enables everyone to show up as themselves. Free of judgment, and equally included. Regardless of their appearence or uniqueness. It's a much needed feeling in today's world. And that's how the park will likely be, for evermore.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a theme park.
completion: What an amazing place!!! I had no idea that this place existed until today. We ate at Vanders keep and the. Decide to visit the park. I was not ready for the wonder inside. Make sure you interact with the characters in the park to go on the special quests.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a theme park.
completion: I was highly impressed by this place. The actors were great, the activities were fun, and the environment was pretty believable. It feels like they've got a a ways to go till their park is fully built and their vision realized but for $15 a ticket with few activities costing extra, this place is a steal! I would expect to pay more than I did for a fire dance and aerial silk show alone but that was only one of the many things they offered. Come in costume and come ready to be a dork immersed in a fantasy world. I highly recommend this to anyone into costumes, fantasy, role-playing, and especially D&D.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a theme park.
completion:
OVERVIEW - 4.8
Came here as a work activity.  We were enticed by how elusive the place is on details, let alone online.  We actually ended up looking at Evermore's social media to get a better understanding.

LOCATION - 5
Ever more is located in Pleasant Grove not too far the freeway and other surrounding businesses such as Essential Oils.  I had to use a GPS to find the location and then parking was a little confusing (I parked in the back thinking it was the front.)

PRICE - 4
Pricing was a little steep for my liking, but it was worth the experience.  My daughter had just turned 6 and so I had to pay for her, whereas if she was 5 or under she would have been free....  If I had to name the prices, I would set $15 at the perfect price for adults.

PRODUCT/SERVICES - 5
This is where this place excels!  The attention to detail was remarkable!  I was impressed by the Evermore cast.  They played their roles rather well.  I enjoyed the various roles they had as well such as the Druids, which were both serious and kind, the executioner was rather intimidating, the fairies were enlightening, the dragon trainer was so kind to my daughter.  If you have a chance to meet her do it!  She was awesome with my daughter.  I was even convinced that dragons were real after talking to her.

POINTERS/PERKS - 5
The objective of Evermore other than walking around and enjoying the detail is to interact with the cast.  Talk to them, go on quests.  They will give you tiny missions if you ask what you can do for them.  Keep in mind as the night progresses (especially near Halloween), that details and new quests can change.  Another trick I learned is sometimes you can listen in on someone else completing a quest, and then you come by a few minutes with the same details...  I would also recommend that if you have a poor memory like me, you may want to have something to jot down details such as a small notebook or your phone.  That's another detail, you may want to have a phone in case you get separated from your party as it is very likely.

If you complete a certain amount of quests you can become honor positions.  Such as a co-worker and his girlfriend both became honorary knights.

EMPLOYEES - 5
This is where they excel!  They stay in character the whole time.  Their details to their lives is amazing.  I also love it when characters interact with one another.  I saw a fairy talk to a soldier like they were the best of friends.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a theme park.
completion:
Fun immersive experience. We went with a group and it was a lot of fun to talk about and speculate about things together. It also allowed us to break up and gather info from various characters and then come together and share knowledge. All of the characters were wonderful and some were absolutely delightful to talk to. I also enjoyed trying out the archery and seeing all the elaborate decorations. The animals were also a lot of fun. We had a group of adults and a toddler and we all had a blast.

One tip: bring a fully charged phone. Some of the quests required you to take pictures. Also, they give you a booklet when you enter the park, but they ran out of pencils. So I used my phone to take notes (it was helpful for remembering character names and things we were looking for on our quests).

prompt: A Google Maps review about a theme park.
completion:
We LOVE Evermore! Our son refers to it as "The Cool Place". This is a one-of-a-kind attraction and we're lucky to have it so close.

We went to each of their previous seasons (Lore and Aurora) several times because there's so much to experience. Not only do you see characters here, but you interact with them, asking them questions and weaving your own way into the story as a participant. There's laughter, intrigue, puzzles, and LOADS of fun to be had.

We're just waiting for them to offer a Season Pass (wink, wink, nudge, nudge Evermore).

prompt: A Google Maps review about a theme park.
completion: My friends and I came out for the Lore event and this was an amazing experience. We enjoyed the Haunt quests, the characters were amazing, and I couldn't have asked for a better overall experience.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a theme park.
completion: Very interesting place, with lots of activities going on and very affordable for the whole family

prompt: A Google Maps review about a theme park.
completion: The concept of the park is unique and entertaining and the execution though still in progress is fantastic. Artists dedicated to their craft bring unique characters to life, the tastes are a delight, and if willing one could spend hours getting lost in the mystical world of Evermore.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a theme park.
completion: Unique experience. Beautiful"town" with LARP characters. Love the lights. Would be amazing for Halloween.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a theme park.
completion: Great experience. Will return. Quests are fun to get into but some get super crowded. It would be nice to have a place to have a sit down meal instead of finger food. Very impressed with the staff. They are all in character and very nice to talk to. Heaters and fire pits throughout the park is a nice touch as it was extremely cold. Can't wait for the park to expand as some buildings are still under construction. This is a great family park.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a theme park.
completion: My wife surprised me for my birthday in August and we loved it so much, we returned in September, for our anniversary but this time we dressed in medieval apparel and so thoroughly enjoyed ourselves.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a theme park.
completion:
Valentine's Day dinner experience was like being stuck at point of the mountain during rush hour. You're just stuck in the miserable experience with everyone around you because they already took your money.

We made reservations and thought it would be a good experience since it was their 3rd day of the Valentine's Day dinner and also because they had a set menu, in theory making it more efficient.

This was not the case. First they had two entrances to the check in desk meaning people that had been waiting in an established line for 15-20 minutes, just to check in, were getting cut off by people just arriving. The staff was not able to check people in, take them to their seats and manage the flow of traffic because there were just two of them running the desk.

Once we were seated, we had no cups, no silverware and it took a solid 15 minutes to get our preordered soup and salad. It was another 10ish minutes after the soup and salad came that we finally got silverware and cups. Between finishing soups and salad and receiving our main course, it was nearly 1.5 hours and the grilled veggies were incredibly cold. The Mahi Mahi was ok, but the steak may as well have been jerky, no exaggeration, it was difficult to cut with a knife. We had seen the wait times and sent our desert ticket in with our main course so thankfully that came out promptly but others around us were waiting at least 15 minutes to get their desert.

All of this would have been more understandable if it had been a full menu and if it was busier but it was a very limited, preselected menu and honestly, not very busy considering it was valentines day. I counted 26 tables plus bar seating and some of the tables were even empty. When wait staff would come out to the dining area, everyone's attention would shift to them in hopes of catching their attention.

I would not attend or recommend attending any sort of dining event here to anyone. There are some very clear organization issues that the customers as well as the waiters/waitresses are paying the price for. It was incredibly frustrating to experience for a special occasion. The only silver lining was our waitress had some funny jokes even though she was clearly frustrated herself.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a theme park.
completion: Such an awesome experience! There was so much to do. The actors were all amazing and made us feel totally immersed. Would absolutely go again.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a theme park.

We couldn't find krampus which makes me wonder if we missed some areas. Sword fighting, archery, and knife throwing lines could be better defined, they were all over the place and sometimes you get bumped off when the employees tell you you're not in the invisible line. We'll come back for sure

prompt: A Google Maps review about a theme park.

We went on a Saturday night and the later and busier it got the lines to talk to people were annoying. Same with the axe & bow tables the lines took forever. So I'd suggest going during the week.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a theme park.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a theme park.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a theme park.

There was more to do than I could even have possibly had time to do and the costumes were all really quite amazing!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a theme park.

It's true that some parts of it are still under construction but I wouldn't let that stop you from going!  If anything it makes you more excited to go again and see what's new! The architecture is absolutely incredible and the actors know their story well!  I'm 30 plus years old and I was extremely impressed by the Evermore Park!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a theme park.
completion:
I think it's definitely worthwhile and would have been a lot of fun if we weren't in a rush. Our experience was about a 3-star, but I think it definitely can be a 5-star experience if you give yourself enough time. I give it 4-stars overall because I want to see improvement in their customer care and outdoor lighting.

Evermore is an immersive experience akin to the Wizarding World of Harry Potter (Universal Studios), Fantasyland (Disney), and Ghost Town (Knott's Berry Farm). There are a lot of characters to interact with, but no thrill rides. (There was a train ride, but it broke own the day we went, possibly due to weather.) It's definitely something you'll want hours to explore. I recommend getting the park map when you get there and seeing what is going on.

It was a lot of fun once we got settled in. But they do a pretty bad job of preparing new guests for the experience, so the first 10-15 minutes we're really stressful for us. Make sure you have plenty of time before any scheduled events.

We checked in at the front gate and had to work out what to do to get refunded on our train tickets. We had bought the additional Christmas Carol experience and they hadn't given us any information at the gate on how to redeem it. Luckily, we found someone else doing the Christmas Carol experience who told us where and how to redeem our tickets. Unfortunately, we ended up missing the beginning of the performance because of how long it took us to figure out what was going on.

We had about 30 people attend our Christmas Carol performance, which was probably the most it could handle. It was definitely hard for everyone to get the full experience. Additionally, someone had a double wide stroller, which slowed the group down a couple of times because of really narrow doorways and the uneven/poorly-lit pathways. It would have been fine, but the actors weren't trained on how to help someone with a stroller/wheelchair. It seemed pretty ADA and handicap accessible.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a theme park.
completion:
Go. Just go. This place is awesome and suitable for all ages! The staff are awesome and really the food and beverages aren't too expensive. We had a bread bowl with soup and hot Apple cider. My wife and kids enjoyed it a lot.

Side note: If you're getting there when it opens up. People like to go left. However, if you go right and around to the archery and axe throwing you'll be alone for awhile! Which is nice.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a theme park.
completion: So much fun cute props lots of cool vendors food lines were really long and the haunted house isn't included with the general admission and train rides sold out the day before the event but overall we loved it.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a theme park.
completion: Although it was bitter cold we spent 4 hours interacting with characters and completing quests. Anyone that enjoys Role Playing Games or Improv would really enjoy this. The more involved you are the more involed the characters become.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a theme park.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a theme park.
completion: Food lines long, and could be more to the meal plan. Closed some attractions as the kids got up to event so they didn‚Äôt get to do them. Overall a great experience no line for Santa that was really nice, Halloween all though it was crowded seemed to have more to it.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a theme park.
completion: I attended the pre opening party for Evermore park and was overall very impressed.  The front of the park which was mostly finished looked fantastic.  There were plenty of actors, animal handlers, musicians and performers to keep you entertained all evening. I was entertained for the 4 hours that I stayed at the park.  The only downside was how much of the park was still unfinished, and sometimes I felt unsure of what I should be doing. Overall it was a great experience and I am very glad that I went.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a theme park.
completion:
I want to love it BUT the park still has a lot of room to improve. The line to get in was unnecessarily long for having bought tickets and signed the waiver online. We waited 55 minutes before even getting inside. They needed more people at the entrance.
And no one let you know what to do once you were inside. I had watched some YouTube videos before hand and thought we were given character cards and an intro quest but after the long wait all we got was a map. So we started just by walking around aimlessly and exploring. It wasnt til 30 minutes later we realized the intro quest was on the back of the map! Would have been nice if the employee who gave us the map had told us that! And no one told us how to distinguish park employees from guests. (Because some guests had really elaborate costumes...) We figured out over time it was the people with green pendants.
But the BIG disappointment was after completing the first quest we went to the kettle cafe and turned in our gold to level up! The next quest we assumed would be something different but they simply handed us the same quest again and said they would have different ones in the future. They did say that there were quests to join each guild but it just felt like there was no reward or sense of accomplishment for that first quest. And the guild we wanted to join (the dragon trainers) we were told were "sick" or infected and were currently hold up in a building that was boarded up. So not sure if that meant we were supposed to find a way in side as part of the game or that the employees were just not working that night. We didnt stay to find out. We soon left after that after about 2 hrs.
But as I said I want to love it. The park did have a few things going for it:
The decorations and details were really awesome.
The actors characters seemed really cool and the ones we interacted with were nice and did a good job.
I would have loved if there was more to do. Bottom line all the quests (at least the ones available) seemed to be go somewhere talk to someone. And alot of the time the actors were surrounded by other guests so you had to wait to talk to them. The main areas to interact were crowded.
For the cost price I dont think it is worth it... Yet. I think they need some more actual attractions. It felt kinda empty. If you absolutely love DnD you could probably go spend 5 hours there and enjoy it completely. But if you prefer solo RPG videogames I'd say spend the money on those instead. For me and my wife it cost $64 bucks and now I kinda wish I had just bought a new videogame lol. But if you are considering going give it a shot and hope you enjoy!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a theme park.
completion: As always, a gorgeous and memorable experience! Lines and wait times were much longer than I've seen, which was a bummer... but we will be back!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a theme park.
completion: It was fun and entertaining.  They ran out of food at the end of the night, but we did wait until after 9 pm to request food.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a theme park.
completion: We visited for the first time during the 2020 Christmas season.  Highly recommend paying extra for the Christmas Carol experience, it was amazing! The acting - especially the parts of Scrooge and Charles Dickens - was excellent, better than we expected. The way you follow the characters through the park to different locations as the story unfolds was unique and so much fun! There were indoor and outdoor settings - some of which are only accessible for Christmas Carol attendees. The Christmas Carol experience was slightly interactive also, which made it even better.  Our young adult children all loved it, as did we. We would go back again for that alone! The Christmas Carol takes about an hour (we wouldn't have wanted it any shorter, we enjoyed it so much), so we didn't have as much time as we had hoped to see the rest of the park before it closed. So, if you are doing the Christmas Carol, be sure to leave extra time before or after to enjoy the rest of the park. The archery and ax throwing ends at 9:30, and the lines were a little long before that, so we didn't do either. Most of the actor characters we came into contact with were easy to talk to, and we really enjoyed our interactions with them! But some were too preoccupied with their interactions with other actors/characters to talk to us, so that was a little disappointing. The costuming is excellent, and the overall feeling within the park is magical.  Sometimes it was hard to tell between the paid actors and visiting patrons who dressed up, but the glowing necklaces helped. We enjoyed the fire dancers and the puppet show, and the hot chocolate was delicious! If you dress warm, the cold isn't so bad, and there are plenty of fire pits throughout the park to warm up by. We will definitely be going back!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a theme park.
completion:
I want to be super clear: I love Evermore. I've gone 3 times now and had a great time every time, except for this last one during Lore 2021.

The Haunt was a fun idea, except the time we reserved to go through it didn't matter at all. We spent an hour waiting in line to go in, far and away after our reserved time. Well, we thought, at least we get to go to the second haunt, maybe that one won't be as busy! Nope. We spent more time in line, then the second haunt that we paid for was the EXACT SAME haunt again, with a slightly different "quest". The quest was different by about 2 or 3 different lines in the script from the actors (who were wonderful, as always, but still). We were very disappointed with the haunt experience.

We also got combo tickets which included food vouchers. Guess what we did? Waited in line another 45 minutes for sub-par food. I think I saw about 2 people in the back making the food for hundreds of patrons. (Absolutely not the workers' fault!) Evermore is simply not equipped to handle this many people.

Perhaps if they limited the number of patrons in the park, so there are less people in general, it would help? I would happily pay more to enter if I knew I wouldn't spend literally 1/2 the time I spent there in lines. It's either that or bump up staffing to accommodate all of the people there.

I love love love Evermore with all my heart, and I so badly want them to succeed, but I wish some of the energy they put into their spectacular sets and costumes and actors also went towards straight up logistics. Even the bathroom situation is lacking. Only three stalls in the women's bathroom? No wonder there is always a line going around the building.

They tried something new, which is commendable! But in practice, it clearly wasn't the experience that was marketed to us.

I'm hoping that for the Winter theme they'll have learned a few things from the what they tried with Lore. I have every confidence that they'll try to improve the experience for their guests who love them and want them to succeed! And I'm looking forward to hopefully coming back to edit this review after we visit in the winter. I love Evermore!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a theme park.

More food options and a liquor license would work wonders for them, and bring more revenue. Not holding out hope for beers in Utah county.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a theme park.
completion:
Tonight was way more fun than I expected! My daughter and I really got into the quests and finished the three main ones and lots of little ones, joined a guild (the adventure guild of course), watched a magic show and the fire dancers, and ended the evening with a decent cup of hot chocolate.
We bought the combo deal, with entry into the park, the two main quests which really gets you three, the train ride, and a meal with a drink. It was a bit spendy, but it was cheaper to buy the combo than buying everything separately, and in the end it was so much fun. Totally worth the price.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a theme park.
completion:
Enjoyed my time here from a visual perspective. very well thought out as far as their displays and attractions. We went during the winter time during the Christmas festivities and got their activity pass.

Wasn‚Äôt particularly impressed with their staff. They seemed to hire highschool kids who do cosplay as a hobby. Many didn‚Äôt seem to treat it like a job. Although they were supposed to be in character I saw a lot of them on their phones and not really taking pride in their work. As the face of evermore I really expected a bit more in that capacity.

Additionally the ‚Äúice skating‚Äù was a complete waste of money. You walk onto a cold sheet of plastic with zero ice on it. They advertise it‚Äôs not true ice skating but this isn‚Äôt skating at all. It‚Äôs walking on plastic and that‚Äôs the experience. period. I am proficient at ice skating so it‚Äôs not like I didn‚Äôt know how to skate. If I went again I‚Äôd pay for general admission and that‚Äôs it.

The food was also insanely long lines (45 minutes, and this was after being told they ran out of food and we needed to come back in an hour) for great value freezer food that was reheated. It was worse quality than food I make for myself and I have pretty low standards. (Truly watched them rip open great value frozen fries and put them in the fryer, certainly tasted like it too)

Beyond walking through the place and admiring the architecture don‚Äôt expect much from anything else that‚Äôs offered. Still cool though!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a theme park.
completion:
Evermore is an MMORPG video game brought to life. Within Evermore, you meet its citizens, learn about their history and struggles and complete tasks for them while exploring their world. For the muggles out there, think of it as an elaborate scavenger hunt.

The actors are what make this park happen. Throughout Evermore you'll find citizens who are either quest givers or general NPCs with helpful info. Most of them are great at what they do and play off of anything you say quite well. There are four guilds you can join and each have tasks for you to complete as initiation. We joined the Dragon Trainers after finding the elf rangers to be too snooty (and also not the best actors). I loved the actor who led the Dragon Trainers. He had a huge history of dragons in his repertoire and was just cheerful and believable. I honestly felt honored when he initiated us. It truly felt like I was playing WoW. We had quests that led to other quests that led to other quests. Some were for the overarching story and others were simple tasks like selling a magic item for a merchant. Some NPCs sat around telling ghost stories, acting out tales or singing songs.

There were a few cons, but all are things that are easy to improve and will hopefully be fixed soon. Firstly, the park itself is not complete and they do nothing to hide this. During the night this is fine because the darkness and choice lighting hide all the under construction parts. During the day, you can clearly see metal conduit, wood piles, orange safety cones, rebar, etc. piled in certain areas of the park. They do nothing to hide this and it kills the immersion. There's also little things they could easily hide like in the mausoleum there was a speaker you could clearly see that was generating monster sounds, in the aviary there was a giant A/C unit and in the middle of the field is an electrical box.

We attended on a Monday night early in the Lore season and it feels like they aren't at 100% yet. It was open 6-10 pm. We arrived just after 6 and clearly they weren't ready. We didn't receive a map when we entered or any instruction. We wandered around and saw employees/actors not yet on their game or ready to interact. This is where we were able to focus on all the poor immersion areas because we basically wandered aimlessly the first hour. However, even after dark when everyone was in place and quests began rolling, there were still huge areas with no NPCs or quest givers.

When we finally did track down a map, we saw on the back a huge task list of things to do and next to it it said, "your first quest!" We spent a lot of time completing these tasks only to turn it in in the end and learn the "first quest" was a smaller thing hidden in the image on the page and all the tasks we completed were "just a scavenger hunt" with apparently no reward. I think there was just a miscommunication somewhere with this but it was a bummer.

Another improvement that could be made is better marking for who is an NPC/citizen of Evermore versus players. They encourage guests to come in costume and many of us who attended were but that made it difficult for me to know "is that elf over there someone I can talk to or another player like me?" The quest givers wear a glowing light necklace which is great but the tavern dwellers and fairies and monsters do not.

Overall, I had a blast and LOVE this concept. I think they are working towards an app or some system to track your progress as a player and that would be really awesome!

I would recommend Evermore but not going out of your way for it. I don't think you should buy a plane ticket to SLC drive the hour to Pleasant Grove and get a hotel to attend, but it's worth a day drive or is definitely something to do if you're visiting Utah anyway.

I'm very curious to see how far the park will come in two years. I think there's something great here but kinks are still being worked out.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a theme park.
completion:
We went here the day after Christmas 2020 and took our four little kids with us. The kids say their favorite thing was the fire dancers that went on every hour. They also enjoyed the bird and reptile show and the knife throwing. I really like the architecture of the buildings and the lights were beautiful. We also rode the train around the park and had fun looking at all the lights and buildings.  If there was one point of criticism, it had to be the radio station being played on the train ride, it wasn't really consistent with the theme of the park and broke the immersion in the park's atmosphere.
The characters we talked to were all interesting with their own stories to tell. Definitely going to spend more time talking to characters and doing quests when we go without little kids. The other visitors were also very friendly and sometimes it was hard to tell them from the Evermore characters if it weren't for the glowing pendants that the actors wore.
The food we had there was very good and service was great.
Overall, a top-notch experience which I believe will only get better over time and the more we go back.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a theme park.
completion: Wow! What a great place! Went here for my cousins birthday and once we really got into the role playing we had a blast! Food was pricey but good and the whole setup was very cool!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a theme park.
completion: Literally my favorite place in Utah. It's simply magical. And in the fall, it transforms into a Halloween Village that's incredibly decorated. The best ‚ú®spooky vibes‚ú® I keep coming back - can't stay away!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a theme park.
completion: This place is so much fun, for literally the whole family! Dont waste your money on haunted houses this place is the whole package for basically the same price you'd spend at a haunted house, except you actually get to get involved and find clues to solve a mystery!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a theme park.
completion: There is no shortage of entertainment to find here! Each season brings new excitement; whether it is the scares and haunting of Lore, the lights and cheer of Aurora, or any other event, you are sure to find fun at Evermore!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a theme park.
completion: It was a lot of fun wandering through what  feels like a fantasy land and they have little quests to keep you busy. I think evermore has a lot of potential for becoming really awesome. A few things I felt they could work on is putting quests together that actually gets you somewhere with an end point instead of running it back and forth between characters for the sake of keeping you busy. Overall it's worth experiencing.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a theme park.
completion: What a beautiful winter adventure! Evermore is such a fun place with a choose-your-own-adventure vibe. My hubby and I spoke to Tundra Maximus the miner and explored the village and even a castle while we picked up side quests along the way. We warmed up with a little hot cider on our way to find Winter Weavers (elegant winter elves!). There were local vendors features handmade costume pieces, sculptures, etc. We wanted to free the ice giant but our dinner reservation came first, so we hustled to Vander's Keep. Oh my was the food delicious! Samantha Fox, our server, let us know the beef stew was inspired by a 19th century recipe and braised for hours. My husband loved his pork chops and I devoured my venison with chili-citrus ginger glaze, which was served a perfect medium rare. The classic cocktails were on point too. We wrapped up the night with a little archery and  headed home wanting to come back to enjoy more of everything.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a theme park.
completion: Evermore was amazing! We had a lot of fun interacting with the actors. The quests kept us entertained for the whole night.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a theme park.

This was such a great experience. We came during the summer mythos event. We spent two nights here and had a blast. There is still so much more to explore and interact with that I wish I could spend at least two more evenings here.
There were a lot of fun actors, but the pirates and bards are especially wonderful.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a theme park.
completion: This is one of the greatest places I have been too, immersive, great story lines, amazing detail and spectacular value. I will be returning and cant wait for their next expansions

prompt: A Google Maps review about a theme park.
completion: We had a blast coming with 4 children. They had fire dancers, exotic birds and fun interactive sculptures. Definitely worth checking out as a family or on a fun date!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a theme park.
completion:
Pros:
-talented staff - a lot of them are really funny and really fun to interact with
-great decorations - lots of real old wood and brick and leather
-a few pretty cool animatronics

Cons:
-quests are both difficult to find to begin and pretty railroaded
-park was crowded, making it hard to talk to the NPCs
-food and drink is wildly expensive, for example: $3 for a 12 oz bottle of rootbeer

prompt: A Google Maps review about a theme park.
completion:
We had so much fun exploring the park and doing a couple quests! We were only there for about two hours. We brought our 4 year old daughter and she absolutely LOVED all the characters and how so many people were dressed up! She made me promise she could dress up as a fairy or pirate next time we go.

We did find starting out to be a bit difficult with the acorn quest from the fairy, but after asking for a hint we were finally able to find our first one and know what we were looking for! Finding the rest was MUCH easier after finding the first one! Everyone was so nice and it was so cool! I loved seeing all the other visitors fully enjoying themselves in full cosplay! Luckily there were enough people not in cosplay that we didn't feel awkward or stick out. I'm not talented enough to put together such wonderful costumes.

If you happen to be in a wheelchair or a knee scooter (I was on a knee scooter) there are a lot of cobblestone areas and one area that is a little bit of looser gravel, so be prepared for some bumpy areas! Totally manageable, but obviously is a bit harder than just walking. Definitely looking forward to a trip without the knee scooter! Hahah

Also the tiny bottle of fairy dust you get from taking a picture of all the acorns is one of the cutest things ever!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a theme park.
completion: This was such a unique experience. The more you are willing to get into it and play along the more you will get out of it. Amazing buildings and scenery. The actors and accents were believable and their makeup and costumes were even better. You truly feel your you've been transported to a different world when you walk through the entrance!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a theme park.
completion:
We ended up going to Evermore Park tonight and although it was not completely finished it was a great experience! The details are extraordinary and talking to the characters provides insight into the story of Evermore without giving too much away.

My kids had a blast running in between characters sending messages going on quests and collecting items. It was amazing to see them in an immersive environment and being part of a theatrical experience.

The character spent time with my kids and showed interest in learning about them and the characters that they had created for their cosplay. Further they helped them to feel as if they were part of the experience. Where else can you spend time with characters and have them remember who you are at the end of the night? This doesn't happen but at Evermore it did. It was so cool to have 5 6 7 or even 8 characters talking to my kids and myself at one time! It was extraordinary!

Justin the manager was an amazing man and went out of his way to make the night special for my son who is celebrating his birthday! When this park is completed, it is my opinion that it will rival Disney and be destination for people all over North America not just Utah.

This park is not just for dress up and taking part in a cool Theatre experience but is also an educational opportunity for students and adults. Learning about the animals, the gardens, the mythology and various historical aspects of the park is fascinating. The characters use dialogue that is rich with vocabulary and the actors take the time to teach the meaning of the words to the young people that are there. My kids walked away having learned new words and their meanings. This is a fun and educational place and I cannot wait to see how the educational Outreach programs develop! As an educator myself, I would love to partner with Evermore and help them develop these programs!

I was astounded by the details of this park and cannot wait for it to be complete! It is hard to understand what is going on at first but if you are open and talk to the characters and listen to what they're saying and ask questions- you will have a delightful time. I highly recommend that everyone give this Park a shot.

If you are a perfectionist you may want to wait until the park is officially open before you attend. I hope that many people come and experience Evermore.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a theme park.
completion: Excellent venue. It was cold but it was so worth it. There are pits set up all over the property so you can get warm at every stop. It was amazing and must be seen

prompt: A Google Maps review about a theme park.
completion: I took my kids aged 10, 8, and 5. They were a little unsure and shy at first, but then they warmed up and didn't want to leave at the end of the night. They said they had a blast! It was a little confusing how to get started but once we all got the hang of it we were having a lot of fun.  I think it would be a little more fun for adults without kids because you wouldn't have them holding you up at all and could really get into the intricacies of the tasks. I'm looking forward to coming back another time without kids! The actors were great and the scenery is amazing! The is still some construction happening but it doesn't detract too much and there is still plenty to see.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a theme park.
completion:
Do you love role playing, and/or role playing games? Do you like acting as a character, or watching people perform? Do you want to go on a quest to join one of several guilds and have fun knowing everyone around you is in the same fantasy world you are in? Go here!

Everyone was warm and friendly (unless their characters weren't). They presented quests, and help pull you into the world. You learned about these people and these stories, and could interact with the characters, and they held solid and true. I would take over conversations (As Finnius Feyweather.. Irish accent lol) and I would ask for stories, or ask for information, or ask for a song, and they never let me down, or broke character.

The musical dwarves, and wondering minstrel are must sees! They turned everything up to 11! The animal show was fun, and I even learned a few things! The park changes a few times a year, and I'm from Oregon and definitely plan on making a weekend trip down to see each one!

Great time for all ages! HUZZAH!

One thing I think could be improved is information about the events, shows, quests, and guilds should be more accessible and easier to understand. I asked an actor what a quest was she said to ‚Äújust find one.‚Äù I was pretty confused because at that point I didn‚Äôt even know what a quest was until I read other reviews. However, I still had a super fun time and I would definitely go again.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a theme park.
completion:
So FUN!! There were a ton of people there and both parking lots were pretty full but it was a big enough place and outdoors so we felt safe and comfortable with covid (although our whole party is also vaccinated). Still lots of lines to talk to different towns people, but you can potentially listen to the conversations of those ahead of you and save time.

It took our, not shy but not super outgoing, group a second to get going, but once we figured out some of the things that we could ask for, (or interact with characters at the park to do- like join a guild, do a good deed/help someone on a quest, earn gold-all the townspeople pretty much have it and will give you tasks to earn it, trade items (we brought a bag of rocks and gems and traded with a witch and a pirate for different coins and other things) we were quickly on our way to having a great time!!!)

Aside from the adventures there are craft stands to buy from, food to purchase (both in the resturaunt and in stands in the park,  arial silk/fire stick throwing/animal shows to watch, archery/hatchet throwing/battle arena foam battles to participate in, walking the grounds to see all the cool buildings and effects they have and continue to add, and there is some fun people watching to do too!

We saw all ages (from itty bitty to getting up there in years) dressed up and participating with great amounts of enjoyment!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a theme park.

Welcome to the magical realm of Evermore!
A space between our world and the magical, where something peculiar is happening..
We went in with no idea what was in store for us, and there really is no way to describe such a place of wonder!
This is only a fragment of what you'll encounter there.
There's so much to see and do we see having to go back for a second time!
It was an amazing experience being part of the story and figuring out what was happening in the realm!
I loved dressing up and playing my own role, and next time I'll actually be prepared.
If you're into the magical and mysticism, or not, I highly recommend you go check out @evermorepark and experience it for yourself!

We went on the X cave, which was a little disappointing for an experienced cave tour lover, but a nice introduction to caving. Kids will especially love it since you're IN  A CAVE! haha. There are only a couple of highlights and not really anything kiddos will hurt if they touch (although touching is discouraged) Quite chilly inside. You might want a jacket. There are lots of above ground trails and the ones we wandered down were quite easy. The lodge is more upscale, with a nice stone fireplace in the lobby. We didn't stay there, so not sure of that experience. The road leading in is slow and winding. So take your time.
