prompt: A Google Maps review about a resort hotel.
completion: We had a neighbor tell us about Carter Caves so we decided to do a day trip here. During our visit we toured X Cave, Horn Hollow, and Cascade Cave. The park was very clean and well organized. We didn‚Äôt know what to do and where to go at first but were quickly and easily able to find staff that showed us the ropes. Our first tour was with Tristan at the X Caves. Tristan was informative and the Cave was interesting overall we enjoyed it. The only thing we wish he would have done differently is slow down . We moved so quickly through the cave that it felt like at times we were trying to keep up with the group instead of getting to enjoy the experience. Our next tour was a self guided tour to Horn Hollow. We were informed that we needed to bring flashlights with us so we purchased some at the gift shop. The permit process was easy however finding the cave not so much. They literally circled it on the map and said ‚Äúit‚Äôs somewhere around here‚Äù and to stay on the green trail. We kept walking and walking at one point we saw a couple walking down what appeared to be a creek bed and wondered to ourselves is that the cave entrance? We pulled out our phones to Google it, it was. Then once we got to the mouth of the cave we saw that it was flooded. We were not aware that the mouth of the cave was going to be in a creek bed and the water at the mouth was already at shin level. Not wanting to spend the rest of that day in wet shoes and socks we decided to not venture inside. Our last tour of the day was to Cascade Cave. Our tour guide was Skylar. Skylar has a family history when it comes to this cave and it is clear that he is both knowledgeable and passionate about it. He has a great personality and really took his time sharing the cave with us. He also told us about some of the other caves and tours we would not have known about otherwise and would love to check out in the future. We were so thankful that our tour was with him as he really made the experience. Overall it was our favorite cave of the day.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a resort hotel.
completion:
Carter Caves Campgrounds State Park Adventure. We stayed at the campground this December in our Toy Hauler TT for five days.
They have 33 miles of hiking trails. 5 caves for exploring a 3 Natural Bridges that are spectacular. The campgrounds have full to primitive hookups. No water in the off season they do have electric. 20-30-50 amp. Two large bathhouses which one is open souring off season. Play grounds and a put put mini golf. Ice machines store is open during the offseason.

Welcome lodge is very nice it‚Äôs also where you will need to get permits for cave exploring.

Dogs are allowed on trails but not the caves. 2 people minimum to explore.

2000 acres of exploring with a small lake for fishing.
Must definitely a beautiful place anytime of the season.

#camping  #cartercaves   #stateparks   #kentuckycaves

prompt: A Google Maps review about a resort hotel.
completion:
Awesome park. The guided caves are cool, the unguided caves are cool, the trails are cool, the land bridges are cool, and just the overall place is just fun to be around. I stayed in the cottages, and they are nice for one big or two small families. Well kept. Definitely recommend.

If you come, make sure to check out Horn Hollow cave. There‚Äôs a short little crevice near the main entrance of the cave, and if you follow that, it narrows and narrows. Prepare to be crawling on your stomach in an underground creek. You‚Äôll need to be pretty narrow and pretty flexible (I‚Äôm 6‚Äô and 180 lbs. and I made it though with some difficulty). It goes back a good 200 feet, until it opens up on this huge underground waterfall fueling the creek. It‚Äôs almost as big as the one in Cascade. I‚Äôm not sure if this water fall is well-known, but it‚Äôs well worth the difficulty of reaching it. If you‚Äôre up for an adventure, I highly recommend it.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a resort hotel.
completion:
So it's very confusing but we stayed at the Carter Caves Campground not the resort or cabins.
We arrived one day early figured we would try our luck. We were met on the office by a disinterested kid. Once we got through that, we discovered that our sight #8, had the electric pedestal aprox 75' from the site.
We returned to the office and were moved to sight #3. Once we backed in, we discovered that the electric pedestal had 20 or 50 Amp. No 30.
Back again and moved into #6. It worked but I had to back all the way to the end of the pad and my power cord just made it.
Water took two hoses to reach and had to wrap to the opposite side of the camper.
We had a nice view but the picnic table was not usable due the the slope.
The showers were ok but the curtain bottom was covered with mold.
Overall a busy Campground, dogs and some guy in a tow truck that liked to let everyone know he had an air horn.
The park overall was beautiful and the hiking was great!
Just be warned to really look over the registration as it's not your typical campgroud.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a resort hotel.
completion:
Carter Caves State park is a gem in Eastern Kentucky,  located near Olive Hill Kentucky and just a short pleasant drive off of Interstate 64 it offers cabin rentals, rv camping, primitive camping and a very nice lodge with a excellent restaurant.
They offer miniature golf, horseback riding, kayak and canoe rentals, fishing, a swimming pool, axe throwing, tennis,  basket ball courts, bicycle trails but Carter Caves signature is its amazing caves and hiking trails.
Cave tours are typically guided but they do have some that aren't but do require a permit.
Prices are very modest and affordable.

completion:
Why Eagle Harbor is the place you want to stay when in Door County?
Eagle Harbor is located right accross the bay and walking distance to Penninsula State Park. When we entered the property it was beautifully places homes giving you a royal feel of a town. The homes B&Bs are well kept and looks eye pleasing. Upon checking in the host was very friendly and informative about door county. They made us feel home. He check us in and off we went to our room Tilla. Tilla was the 1st room up the stairs on your left. Room was rather small but well designed and very cozy. The antique looks gave it a very stylish english look. The washroom was large enough and had a sky light to it. B&B main building was well decorated (pics attached) and well kept. This beautiful B&B was one of the best we have visited so far. Their breakfast was really good with some freshly baked chocolate Croissant, Cherry Yogurt, Juices Cereals and much more. Their toiletery items were good as well. Very good smelling and nice in quality. This was the best experince for us we felt right at home. Coziest B&B ever. Don't wait make your bookings right now.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a vegetarian restaurant.
completion:
Enjoyed a nice breakfast today at Gaia. Our waitress was friendly and helpful. Our party of six was seated immediate on a Saturday morning.

Unpretentious, casual, warm interior. Small menu, but nice to have so many vegetarian and vegan options. Good to have the opportunity to try something different, outside the normal brunch fare.

I stuck with what I normally like - eggs & potatoes plus tried a fruit cup. It was a filling portion and cooked well. The potatoes were well seasoned and crispy. I also enjoyed the sourdough bread that came with my meal. The fruit was fresh and seasonal. Coffee was self-service and offered three options, with creamer available at request. I tried the Swiss chocolate brew and liked it a lot. My friend‚Äôs specialty French toasted looked amazing. It has tender sweet saut√©ed apples, cherry sauce, and almonds. Everyone had to try an apple slice - they were really good!

Worth your time and taste buds! Thanks for a good experience!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a vegetarian restaurant.
completion:
Gaia House Cafe was very nice. The decor is slightly bohemian and very cozy with mismatched chairs and tables.We went on a Tuesday at lunch and got the Gaia Tempeh Ruben and the Banh Mi sandwiches.The coffee was excellent. The staff was very pleasant and the food arrived in good time. The price seemed a little steep for sandwiches but when you get homemade pickles and kraut it makes up for it. I couldn't tell where a good place to park would be, so we parked in the Irish pub reserved area with a risk of towing.

Some things to consider: add a bit more spread on the Banh Mi as it was a little dry; add a few completely vegan options to the menu as many of the entrees are so close but then have cheese; swap out those potato chips for a cup of soup. We'll be back! Keep those homemade fermentations coming!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a vegetarian restaurant.

Thank you for coming back, I love the changes and the maintenance of staple favorites like B.Y.O.B. and Mean Green Burrito. I personally chose the Veggie Stash as recommended by my wonderful hostess (I selected the vegan options for cream cheese and cheese toppings as in recent years I have had to cut dairy out of my diet more fully). I had a lovely experience with the self service water and coffee, enjoying the flow of the community coming in and out of the Cafe as I spent a few hours there working on a few personal and professional goals and trying a new, but also nostalgic, meal. Thank you for being back in the Grand Rapids area!!! üôè

Although the interior doesn't have the same vibe as the old Gaia it has it's own charm and coolness.  Just like any diverse hip cafe people talk to each other, exchange ideas and genuinely are happy to do so while eating exceptionally good food, and for me drinking good coffee.  We had this experience on our first time there. It will be our go to breakfast place.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a vegetarian restaurant.
completion:
Unfortunately I don‚Äôt have anything good to say about Gaia house . When we were sat down there was paint bubbling near us, probably due to moisture trapped behind the paint. And then a leak above. It‚Äôs not really an appetizing sight.

We were told that we wouldn‚Äôt be able to have espresso or lattes because the espresso machine was down. That‚Äôs fine. What I did take issue with was the self serve coffee station. For one, the way the glasses were stored was gross. The shelves were not clean. The cups were freshly washed. I could tell because they were wet, placed rim down. So that the dust and debris on the shelving was collected on the wet rims of the cups. And whenever you picked up a cup you could see the wet rim marked it left. These cups should be dry if you‚Äôre going to store them rim down. Drying them rim down traps the moisture inside (causing an unpleasant odor and taste), and damages the shelves, and is altogether unsanitary if the shelves aren‚Äôt even clean. Storing them rim side up would be a better option in this case . They are used often enough for collecting dust to be an argument for storing them rim side down. Sanitary conditions aside, for a vegan/vegetarian place for the only milk option to be whole milk was disappointing. Consider offering milk alternatives.

The food was even more disappointing . My guest ate his omelet , but I good not stomach my food. The cornbread French toast was incredibly dry, even soaking it in the butter and syrup didn‚Äôt revive it. The potatoes tasted fine but they were stale. Since it was the only semi edible thing available to me I picked at that instead of what I ordered. I only managed to eat half of one slice of French toast and didn‚Äôt want to take it home. We came out of our way to go here after seeing it on Instagram. So it was that much more disappointing.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a aquarium.

They do have a pretty decent gift shop.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a aquarium.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a aquarium.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a aquarium.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a aquarium.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a aquarium.
completion: The New England Aquarium was a decent experience, but it didn't quite live up to my expectations. The tanks and exhibits were well maintained, and although it has a decent selection of sea creatures the crowds can make the experience overwhelming. The exhibits can become congested and it can be difficult to get a good look at the animals. Overall, the Aquarium is a decent option if you're looking for a quick and easy attraction to check out, but there are better options out there for those who are looking for a more memorable afternoon.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a aquarium.
completion: My girlfriend and I had gone to Boston for the weekend and this was what we were actually most excited for. Right away you can see a ton of penguins and learn about how overfishing is affecting marine life. There's seals, sharks, turtles, eels, jellyfish, manta rays, piranhas, tropical fish, shrimp, anenome, beautiful coral, seahorses and so much more. There's a space to touch some of the aquatic life - like starfish - with staff supervision. Perfect for the kids. There's a bundle package you can buy where you can get an imax ticket with your admission to the aquarium. The theater is right next store and offers documentaries about different aquatic life... and Pandas? Hah- at least when I went. Luckily, the popcorn, candy and soft drinks are a lot cheaper than those sold in regular movie theaters. The gift shop is a delight too. They sell clothing, jewelery, toys and other souvenirs. I would definitely go back. I was there for hours and I had a great time.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a aquarium.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a aquarium.

Fun experience for kids and adults! Would recommend finding alternative parking aside from at the aquarium unless you want to lay $35. They offer whale watches and other experiences too. Will be going back!

I think they cap off the amount of people in at a time but I still think there was way too many especially since everyone moves in the same path up the atrium. prompt: A Google Maps review about a aquarium.
completion: Absolutely beautiful and incredible experience!!! ü§Øüòç I love how it is all handicap accessible, although I am not handicapped, my mother in law has a boot on her foot, so it was a great experience because of the accessibility. The penguin exhibit is absolutely amazing and just wonderful to sit and listen to the noise and when they would fight. I'm someone that is incredibly against any kind of zoo, or SeaWorld type of places but I did read up on this place and found that they do some sanctuary work and conservation as well so I agreed to go here and let me tell you ... When you walk up through the levels ... Such beauty such amazing fantastic views, the fish, the life that lives within this water was absolutely amazing and so very beautiful. Some things, fishes and other aquatic life that I have never seen and I loved it but my daughter just absolutely loved it and wanted a penguin. Also, the larger sea turtle in the giant cylinder aquarium, is 95 years old and when my mother in law was a child, that very same turtle was just a young little baby and than when my husband was a young child, this same turtle was mid aged and so big and beautiful. They have pictures from their times with this same turtle. Just a wonderful place, very informative, sea lions to watch them swim and play around outside as you waited was wonderful. Also, while we waited we got to walk around the giant walkway that surrounds the aquarium and also has the boats for people that want to go whale watching or just a boat ride. There's also the duck tour boats where they go from moving vehicle to a boat. It was fun to see the very old and antique ship too and to take pictures with my family on the ocean. Just beautiful and wonderful experience altogether. The gift shop has some pretty amazing items to buy! And although it can be a bit pricey, for the most part it's actually less pricey than others we've been to on this trip. Overall, a very enjoyable activity to do with family and kids.

(10+) Dave had the Temple Chicken, which was superb! (5) Jennifer, went with Beef Pho, which she loved! (2 = whimp!) Life is sooooo much better now! Update on 08/14/19

I had Tina's Gai Boun - Chicken, Curry and Coconut at a "10!" Dave had Tina's General Chicken at a "3!" For our "warm up," we had "3" beef egg rolls and a bowl of Tina's Egg Drop Soup at a "10!" Everything was ABSOLUTELY EXQUISITE!!!!! It was sooooooo good to see Tina and her crew! It's been waaaaay tooooo long! However, with the endorphins released tonight, I believe that I will be able to go on!!! Thank you, Tina!!!!! You came into my life when I needed you most! You do my heart good!!!!!!! Pasong's "atmosphere" is good for your heart and soul! I would recommend it to anyone looking for everything you need to just feel good!!!!!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion:
We were driving from Portland home to Canada and it was getting quite late so we found the little town of Shelton and it seemed like a convenient place to stop, being only an hour and a half from the Port Angeles Ferry. We googled a place to stay in Shelton and there was a very limited selection so we pulled into a couple and looked for reviews. Let‚Äôs just say they sounded like rat motels from what we read from other travellers. Once we saw there was a Super 8 in Shelton it seemed like the natural place to say as they are typically a decent place to stay being a franchise and all.

We checked in around 8pm and the front desk person was friendly although seemingly bored with his job. The lobby was clean and nice. We had a truck full of purchases that we didn‚Äôt want to leave outside overnight so it was nice that there was an emergency door close to where we parked for bringing all our stuff in. The front desk person did state that the hotel was located in a decent part of town and our stuff would probably be fine.

We paid $70 for the night which was high considering it was a fairly old hotel. It appeared to have been renovated at one point but the work was amateur at best. There were simple things like repairs to the towel bar which were just never painted over. Little touches like that go unnoticed when done but become BIG eyesores when left not finished. The temperature in the room was hard to keep consistent. I had to keep turning on and off the heat because the room likely is not well insulated. The bath towels were small and the caulking around the tub was gross. There was a mini fridge and coffee area, which was a nice touch. We could hear the voices from the other rooms and the aroma of the Mary J was thick in the hallways. We did not stay for the breakfast unfortunately as we were up and out to head for the ferry.

We didn‚Äôt use any of the amenities, we literally just used this hotel to sleep as a crash pad and it did its job. We felt it was pretty clean and mostly quiet and if we had to stay in Shelton again this would definitely be our first stop.

3 solid stars from Doug and Shannon - It wasn't horrible but it was likely the best option in Shelton.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a zoo.
completion: Wow.  What can be said about this incredible attraction?  Much!  This is one of the best family activities I have seen in a long time. There is also a little train ride just outside the Zoo that takes people on a little tour of that local area.  Like many other attractions, things like admission and food are a little spendy. This is an attraction that a person can not get tired of and will want to return to!  Thanks for an amazing day!

The exhibits are spaced rather close together and allow anyone to see at least 2-3 animals, at one time, within the same 10 meter radius.

During the holidays, however, this place lights up in color and events, I recommend stopping by for the animals, but staying around during the holidays for the fun and festivities.

The zoo food is also good. It is a step above normal. I've been to many zoos and I would have to say this zoo's food ranks at number 4 out of 30. I recommend the burger in the "BEAST"tro as they call it.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a zoo.
completion:
They have 2 hippos, what else does one need to see?‚Ä¶.
On a real note, this place was great. It‚Äôs not a large zoo (don‚Äôt even try to compare to San Diego zoo) but it had so much to offer. Hippos, elephants, rhino, lions, reptiles, snakes, birds, and lots more. We bought the fun day passes which included day passes to the park, train tickets, feeding a lory tickets, and the carousel tickets. The train is a miniature version the takes a stroll through the nearby nature park. Feeding the lorys is pretty cool, they give you a cup with nectar and the birds land on your arms, shoulders, head, pretty much everywhere. Then once the nectar runs out they start licking you. The carousel is a carousel with animals you ride, it‚Äôs is made for kids but that didn‚Äôt stop me.

Overall this park was small enough to see just about everything in about 1/2 of a day. It does have inclines and declines but a nice easy hike around the park. The drinks and food is expensive so I would save up if you plan on eating in the park, but I imagine most of that cost goes back into operating the park.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a zoo.
completion: Africa Live was really great, amazing variety of animals. Great way to spend the afternoon with the kids but watch out for the bees!!!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a zoo.
completion: A really beautiful Zoo! They have taken advantage of San Antonio's rocky terrain to create some very well landscaped animal enclosures for all of the animals as well as having trees, flowers, cactuses, and ponds laid out throughout the zoo. It was kind of a cold and rainy day the day we went and a lot of the animals were not having any part of it electing to sleep out of the weather in their enclosures, but we still enjoyed it very much! They have a nice reptile house with lots of snakes, lizards, and turtles. They also have a sea life house that has both fresh water and salt water fish and turtles! There are plenty of refreshment stands spaced out around the grounds as well as restrooms and hand wash stations. There are areas under construction and we went in through the Blue entrance, I believe the regular entrance might be the orange entrance, but it was closed. They also have a train station that has a scaled down train to take you on a nice ride around the zoo and Breckenridge Park!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a zoo.
completion: Family trip to the zoo is always a good time.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a zoo.
completion: Loads of fun! We went to the zoo lights for the first time and it was very cool! I recommend bringing extra cash for all the special activities.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a zoo.
completion:
Although a couple major attractions are no longer options there is still much to gain from a trip to The San Antonio Zoo!!

Must see attractions include the Giraffe feeding experience, the up close and personal bird and butterfly exhibits, the wondrous train ride and please don't forget to get a wax figurine made right in front of you to keep as a token of your memorable trip!!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a zoo.
completion: The San Antonio zoo was so much fun I havent been since my children where little and before that when I was a child. My my how things have changed.  We enjoyed the kiddie park my favorite is the Carolsel always has been one or my favorite rides.  I remember the train eveything else seemed so different and new.  We had an amazing time I have been wanting to go I finally made it.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a zoo.
completion:
Great fun for the family. Went during the afternoon and waited for the Zoo Lights Christmas display. It was good, but a little crowded which can be tense during this pandemic. Masks are required in any indoor setting, but when outside they are not required.

The Zoo has spent some time clearing out sight lines and making it better for the children which is important to me with a child with serious vision impairment.

The downside was buying a food package in combination with our tickets for hotdogs or burgers and they ran out of burgers when we got to the restaurant and the zoo was still open another 2 hours.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a zoo.
completion:
This is the most robust collection of cats I've seen at a zoo.  Jaguar, fishing cat, clouded leopard, tiger, lion and more including the Caracal pictured here.

I thought the staff was friendly, the zoo was clean, and the gift shops were well priced.  The zoo is divided up by geographic theme - Australia, Africa etc.  I liked this.  There was lots of information about how native populations viewed particular animals.

The zoo was medium sized, so it's possible to walk its entirety in 2-4 miles.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a zoo.
completion: We loved the train ride. The staff was friendly and helpful. Our kids loved the ride and never wanted it to end. Its a good 20 minutes ride and the views are beautiful. Definetely worth doing when you are in San Antonio.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a zoo.
completion:
It‚Äôs been about 10 years since I have visited the zoo and although the admission price is more than I recall, they have definitely made a LOT of improvements. I didn‚Äôt even recognize the place!

The giraffe exhibit is really cool because you can now walk onto a deck that is as tall as the giraffes and you can actually feed them.  Even if you don‚Äôt pay extra to feed them, you are able to walk on the deck and see them face to face ‚Äì it was AWESOME!

The Lory exhibit is also pretty cool.  You walk into this aviary and if you pay a couple of bucks, you can feed the birds ‚Äì they will actually land on your shoulders and arms to eat.  One in our group didn‚Äôt have any food but 3 or 4 of the birds landed on him as soon as he walked in the gate for some reason.

Parking is the same as it always has been ‚Äì kind of tough to park in the lot in Brack Park, but don‚Äôt forget there is parking under the highway on the opposite side of the zoo.

Signage could be improved ‚Äì it‚Äôs hard to find your way to the exit when you are leaving.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a zoo.
completion: Avoid hot summer days -- because the animals are all smart enough to hide under the shades and often not active when it is hot.  We were very impressed with the diverse species well kept here.  If we were local, we would definitely sign up for the membership.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a zoo.
completion: I had not been to the Zoo in 50.years I really enjoyed myself.i was like a kid in the candy store

prompt: A Google Maps review about a zoo.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a zoo.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a zoo.
completion:
In the past the Zoo was not the best (see my review from years past) the San Antonio Zoo has put a great effort into making the zoo the best that it can be and is doing a great job in the past few years. I highly recommend this zoo at this time.

I visited many zoos in my past. I grew up in N. E. Ohio and went to the Cleveland Zoo many times every year from birth till 18yrs and then I visited every couple of years, I've visited the Pittsburgh Zoo multiple times in my life, I've visited the Asheboro NC Zoo multiple times, I've visited the Virginia zoo, I've visited the Washington D. C. zoo, I've visited Disney Animal Kingdom and I've been to many super small side of the road places that call themselves zoos or Aligator /Reptile farms. I've seen a lot and have much to compare. The San Antonio Zoo needs some help. The animal habitats for many of the larger animals are not large enough and many of the outdoor habitats are somewhat overgrown and look like the animal couldn't be living in there but they are. The small animals are living pretty well and the zoo is clean and you can tell that it's a fight for the zoo staff to stay up on the upkeep. It's time to update or down size and give a few animals the space and care they deserve. Look to the Virginia Zoo. The Virginia Zoo is about this size but has put a lot of effort into the beauty of the park and great habitats for the small amount of animals that they have. Please do better San Antonio Zoo

prompt: A Google Maps review about a zoo.
completion: Lovely experience! Beautiful weather and the animals never disappoint..

prompt: A Google Maps review about a zoo.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a zoo.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a zoo.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a zoo.
completion: The Zoo is located inside Breckenridge park. It is a great size to explore. It has Komodo dragons, the big cats, a hippo enclosure, a feed the giraffe experience that is an extra fee. We find our season passes well worth having as we drop by whenever we want to get out and enjoy the animals. They are very handicapped friendly and accessible and my daughter with mobility issues navigates the zoo easily. The only help she needs is the stairs into and out of the reptile house. Otherwise it is a great adventure.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a zoo.
completion: This is a nice zoo. It's a bit small and is surprisingly not very stroller friendly. We got there right when they opened on a Sunday. We found an excellent parking space and the zoo wasn't crowded at all. Best part is, all the animals were out! Price was good and they offer a military discount. No map when we came in and I didn't see where you could get one, so we didn't know where we were going or anything. When we walked in we were bombarded with people asking to take our photo (the ones you buy at the gift shop at the end) and we were asked multiple times within the park... it was a little much. The zoo has an AMAZING children's area. Very fun for the kiddos. By the time we left, about 3 hours later, it was starting to get busy, we didn't see many animals on the way out, and the parking was full.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a zoo.
completion: It is a good place for a couple of hours. A lot of animals to see, although some of them are hiding; maybe because of the heavy sun.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a zoo.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a zoo.

We always bring our family to the zoo boo and zoo lights, which are fantastic! We finally got to ride the train this on this most recent visit which my son loved! The staff is always extremely friendly, approachable, and informative! We will continue to bring our family to the San Antonio Zoo for years to come! Its tradition!

Parking is free.

They also have camel rides, feeding the giraffes, train rides and a carousel. They are currently completing construction for the rhinos, but I was so excited about the tortoises that I didn't care. It's definitely a must see.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a zoo.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a zoo.

Their displays are too dark to see anything and of course they‚Äôre not keeping them awake with bright spotlights. It‚Äôs a good thing but most of the displays were completely dark. Couldn‚Äôt see anything at all. Feel like I wasted my money just to see Christmas lights and no animals. Daytime only for sure. Forget the nighttime thing. It would of been a cool date idea tho! prompt: A Google Maps review about a zoo.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a zoo.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a zoo.
completion: I took the day off to visit the zoo to check out the rhino exhibit I keep hearing about. I was completely disappointed. The zoo is overrun by vultures in every single corner. Poor animals are sharing their tiny little space with these animals by the dozens and waiting to grab their food. I only took a few pics because I didn't think I'd be writing a review but once I left, 24hours later it still bothered me. I will never return to the San Antonio zoo or any other zoo because when I was little, I didn't know any better as to how confined and stressed these animals look. Many zoo animals experience continuous strange behaviors because they have been kept in captivity for so long or live their entire lives alone. Many parents will continue to bring their families and keep this pattern going. There are animal shelters that provide ample space for wild animals but the zoo captivity isn't one of them. I love my city but I however do not support what I witnessed.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a zoo.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a zoo.

It was hard to navigate through especially not knowing some areas are basically only one way. The biggest problem I had was the ticket prices being extremely different than on the website, 21.95 for adult vs 35$ at the zoo and 17$ for kids vs 25$ at zoo, maybe I missed something on the website about the prices being different but that is so much different I don‚Äôt think that‚Äôs right at all.  We were extremely disappointed that we spent $120 to have trouble navigating and even seeing the animals and most animals are in very small enclosures. There are more snack stands and lounging areas than there is space to actually see animals and they are kept up nicer than the animal‚Äôs enclosures, seems more like a money making set up than a place to be educated on the amazing animals of the world.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a zoo.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a zoo.

I was told it is one of finest Zoos in USA. Well I will debate on that.

Firstly the animal collection is decent but not great. They cover almost all sections of animals like birds, cats, pachyderms, apes etc.,

I believe the areas provided for animals are smaller with respect to their sizes. Apes have the smallest cages I have seen. They have impressive bird collection. They serve food at certain points of the zoo.

Staff are courteous and professional. Visit this place in the early hours where sun is not high point to see some animal activity.

Beware if you are visiting on weekend there gonna be a tussle for parking.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a fine dining restaurant.
completion: I‚Äôll get right to it, order a bottle of wine when you go to Westchester, most wines by the glass starts at 20.00. My husband had the Wagyu steak and I ordered the salmon my whole dish was too salty, the wagyu was tough, 79.00 tough. Vegetable overcooked. The server checked on us 11 times, she was such a sweet and pretty young lady, however,  needs to learn the art of being a server. #dissapointed Oh! The ice cream from Clementines was a delight! For those prices you should offer a Sommelier and better wine selection. The whole production of fine dining is to educate the diner and their experience should make them feel welcomed at your establishment. The hostess was not friendly at all. The decor dark and dreary. prompt: A Google Maps review about a fine dining restaurant.
completion: We had a wonderful experience at Westchester for lunch! The decor is beautiful and the ‚Äúvibe‚Äù inside is welcoming and cozy but also hip. I ordered the grilled chicken mezze salad and it was beautiful, but also delicious. The duck fat truffle fries were also phenomenal. We brought our kids (7 and 4) so Chef Matt made them a grilled cheese (he also added delicious crispy fries) and amazing buttered noodles. He even sent our server, Olivia, out to double check that multi grain bread was ok for the grilled cheese. Olivia was a wonderful server as well and knew everything about the menu, and the owner was there at the host stand greeting people as they came in. There was a big table of women having a fun lunch and the bar was full of groups of men hanging out as well. I am born and raised in Chesterfield and it‚Äôs totally unique and awesome for the area. I highly recommend it and we will be back very soon! Probably for dinner‚Ä¶without the kids üòÇ ‚ù§Ô∏è

prompt: A Google Maps review about a fine dining restaurant.
completion:
Everything from start to finish was fantastic! The onion soup was flavorful and did not need the Gruy√®re cheese, but the cheese made it better. Perfect for a cold winter night! The steak tartare was also flavored well with peppers and the perfect ratio to the sauce. The chips made it even better. The duck breast matched well with the parsnip pur√©e and was cooked to a perfect medium rare. The flavor profile had a gamier edge. The portion sizes were generous, and there were extra duck pieces mixed in with the vegetables. The cocktails were a delight: my old fashioned had a clear, custom cut ice cube that added to the aesthetic charm. The drink tasted better over time as the ice melted.

One of the owners, John, was so friendly; he came to check on our table to see how we were doing. I had a wonderful experience and will definitely come back!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion:
Pros:
Service staff other than the front desk was amazing
Food was awesome
Beds were comfortable
Gym setup was spot on

Cons:
Too musky and humid feeling inside the whole building
Vending machines malfunctioning
Front staff was very short with people
Too pricey for accommodations
Pool wasn't worth it
No microwaves in rooms
Elevators were sketchy and not working with ZERO ventilation

I think the bell staff was AMAZING and gave great suggestions for hot spots and restaurants. I felt they went above and beyond.¬† Along with the restaurant staff they had during the breakfast.¬† The gym facility was also a plus as you don't find many hotels that dedicate that much money to health amenities. Not to mention the cooling towels,¬† that was a nice touch! Beds were very comfortable too and clean.

As far as the stay goes I believe it was lacking significantly especially for over¬†$200¬†a night for a room with no view and for what was advertised online.¬† The air quality in the building all together was humid and sticky feeling the whole stay.¬† The elevator air was MISERABLE! The bathrooms in the rooms have no ventilation to move air when showering.

Numerous elevators were broken and unusable on a consistant basis to where I felt the need to take the stairs as a safety precaution not to mention with the fire alarms going off (I understand they might not have the ability to control fire alarms).¬† The mini fridges could only hold a few items and there was no microwave except for one we found 2 floors below us.¬† The vending machines also seemed to be malfunctioning as we had family choose water and it gave them a soda.

The breakfast served was AMAZING! The peach pound cake was out of this world!  Again the staff's hospitality... they were 100% Johnny on the spot. But with such pricey rooms I don't understand why there isn't a complimentary breakfast or to charge a lower amount.

The pool downstairs was also another area that was overly elaborated on the website and in person, was a complete let down...it was murky looking with high chlorination and not much to work with when more people got in (10 people was pushing space).

Upon our departure we called the front desk to have a cart brought up to take out our luggage,¬† we were told it would just be a minute and they would take care of it (this was really the only staff I don't feel weren't so welcoming). After 30 minutes of waiting we looked out into the lobby to see if it was busy because it was around check in time and there were NO lines.¬† My mother went downstairs and spoke to a bellboy about getting a cart and he had no idea someone was waiting for one to be brought up.¬† Again bellboy hospitality was spot on! He even clarified the quickest directions to get us home.

I also want to mention the cleaning staff... although we did not encounter them taking care of our room, everytime I passed someone in the hallway they were smiling and saying hello. This was our first time to Savannah and while being leery in new places I must say we felt like we were welcomed there as though we were family stopping in for a visit.¬† I just wish the hotel amenities were more up to the standards they present online. This was our first time staying in a Hyatt hotel as Hilton has been my #1 go to for years and venturing out has shown why I have been loyal to their hotel...

It's unlikely that I would stay here again, but if I did it would only be due to how awesome their service staff treated usüòä!!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Bathroom was full of mold and rotten wood. Restaurant staff was not attentive, took over 15 minutes for the server to greet us after we were seated. After 30 minutes of not taking our order the manager took over and served us.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Great place to stay your in the middle of everything straight out the hotel to the river walk

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: My husband and I vacationed in Savannah for July 4th.  We stayed at the Hyatt from June 30 to July 5. From the time we arrived til we left the customer service was excellent. The valets, restaurants servers and the front desk were all great. They also help you purchase tickets for the trolley tours. The hotel is very nice and we had a riverview room and watched the cargo ships pass by and the fireworks on the 4th. They have an elevator that takes you down to River St. The only con was breakfast wasn't included in the price. The buffet was $19.95, but it is very delicious.  Also you pay an extra $30 per day for parking and its not optional. Overall staying here made our vacation so much more awesome. I would definitely stay here again and hopefully soon.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: The hotel is definitely at a great location but the service really made us mad. We changed room twice at midnight due to the malfunctioning heater (we had engineers check it but they cannot fix it). The front desk was super cold, never said sorry, didn't want to talk to you. Really no professionalism. Not recommended.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion:
I've stayed at numerous Hyatt Regencys throughout the world. I've never stayed at such a filthy Hyatt. Far from the one in Bangkok.
Throughout the room you see long-term grime, dried unknown fluids on the floors, doors, doorknobs, cabinets, and counters!!
It's so obvious that nobody has deeply cleaned this room for months if not longer. The room smelled exactly like the damp scent I've experienced while staying on offshore fishing boats.
The soap dish is broken and sharp.
My colleague has empty beer bottles on the top shelf in her closet. Toothpaste on the bathroom walls near the mirror. The mirror is filthy as are the grimy glass shower doors.
There's pink mildew growing all over the shower tiles. The towels are the worst. Super thin and non-absorbent. The pillows are terrible and the mattress is too firm. The blanket was so thin it didn't feel luxurious in any way. Lastly, there was some brown liquid dried on the toilet lid.
Here for a conference and the bathrooms in the hall downstairs were equally dirty.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion:
Very nice hotel right on Riverstreet. We had a corner room wIth great views. But corner rooms only have a stand up shower, no tub which I didn't like.
Very beautiful lobby & atmosphere. I think the bar could be updated to measure up to the rest of the hotel. But great rooms & friendly staff & excellent location!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: I have came here with my friends and there Christmas  Spirit is through the roof I love it so much it‚Äôs so pretty and don‚Äôt even get me started with the  balcony view most definitely recommend

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion:
Great location.  Inadequate housekeeping for a hotel of that standard and price.  A big pile of hair, yes indeed a pile, had been left in the shower drain.  Made me wonder if they had cleaned the bathroom at all.  Additionally, the main widow was completely smudged as if someone had applied a greasy face onto it.  We mentioned both issues to the front desk and the drain was cleaned up but not the window.  I ended up cleaning the window with a towel.  Another disappointment was the food options... Overpriced 7-inch pizzas for $16 per person, which fortunately tasted good, but $50 for 2 small pizzas and 2 beers... That's ridiculous.
Follow-up from management: received a reply that seemed like a "cookie cutter" apology.  I am attaching a picture of the note from housekeeping that was left in our room, I am assuming in hope of tips. My advice: focus on cleaning and skip the ridiculous notes.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Older facility, but clean and nice. Lobby is reminiscent of a cruise ship with the glass elevators. Had tv issues, but staff tried to fix it. Must have been provider issues. Our suite had a wonderful, big, L-shaped sofa that was super comfy. Wish there was a microwave in the suite, instead of down the hall and around the corner. Another phone would be nice, too. Only phone was in bedroom on far wall. Just a couple of suggestions. Very convenient location for downtown shopping and strolling. Would stay there again!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Very nice hotel. Centrally located to everything by the river in Savannah. Only giving it 4 stars because if you don't pay the 40 dollar valet parking, then you have to park in a public parking garage that charges and its about 2 blocks away. A minor inconvenience.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Wonderful Experience! Friendly, attentive, & helpful staff! Very clean rooms, wonderful view of the Savannah River! Every staff member is very quick to address any concerns or needs. Hyatt Recency Savannah's goal is clearly 110% Customer  Satisfaction! My family had a SUPERB 4 day/3 night stay. You truly get what you pay for! Will definitely stay here again! :)

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: dated but very well maintained

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Hotel and rooms are very nice. Large lobby area with views of the waterfront. Rooms are nice with lots of special touches. Staff were pleasant. Only parking available was valet. The area the hotel is in was very lively. It was fun to walk around and check out.  Getting a good night's sleep was challenging due to the hearing everything from neighboring rooms, the passerbys outside when the bars closed, and the cargo ships going down the waterway.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: This hotel has 6 story lobby courtyard in the center of the hotel. Be advised the rooms facing the lobby do not have views to the outside. Right on River St so it's very convenient. Overall the hotel is very good condition. The view from room 605 was amazing!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: The hotel is very nice. The gym and pool are really clean. The staff is helpful and friendly. But above all the views of the river are just breathtaking

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: I‚Äôve stayed at several Hyatts, this is one of my favorite just because of the view. Definitely splurge if you can. I totally enjoyed my stay. My room was clean, with a refrigerator, coffee machine, no extra shampoos and conditioners üòèit was a wonderful view of overlooking the river. Nice to see the windows were clean also, to enjoy it. Hotel and customer service was great, to the valet, even though it‚Äôs steep $40 extra a day. üò¨ü§∑üèª‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è I personally would not have stayed there if I was placed in one of the middle rooms, which overlooks the reception/lobby/bar etc. but some people don‚Äôt mind that as It‚Äôs located in a great spot, an easy walk to everything, restaurants, bars and of course historical sites, monuments. I did have dinner and drinks one night at the hotel and they were OK, actually waiter & waitress was excellent. I‚Äôll definitely stay here next time and refer my friends. The one star missing is due to the fact, breakfast was extra, really‚Ä¶

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: The bed was firm and the bathroom was dirty. Not worth it. I‚Äôve stayed at motels that were cleaner. The hotel was so loud.  The stairwell doors slam shut and vibrate the floor. Stay at the quality inn or  anywhere else near by and you‚Äôll have a better experience for cheaper.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Beautiful hotel and rooms. We had the river view with balcony. And it's such a gorgeous location. Def recommend!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Very nice hotel along the river. It would have been nice to have a river view but the best part of our visit came at breakfast. A bit of river traffic. A first for me (see photos). All in all a nice, quiet hotel with very nice accommodations.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: The rooms are a bit stuffy and dark and it's weird that "during Covid we can't have glasses brought to your room" but they use glasses in the bar. The view from our room was beautiful, though!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: We stayed here for 4 full days (12/18/21-12/21/21 and everything was so clean and beautiful in our room 322! During the evening we had a very nice view of the river and lights! In the morning across the river is not beautiful but not bad either. I actually loved the mornings drinking my coffee and watching the cargo ships come and go and other various boats.  The pool was nice, my son loved it. There was a problem with our refrigerator as it wouldn't stay colder than 40 degrees so we had to throw out our sandwiches.  The hotel comped one breakfast for us each so that was very nice.  Later I figured out that if you put ice in the ice bag and tie it, then place it into a laundry bag and place that inside the refrigerator- plus keep the cabinet door open to let heat escape- it kept the refrigerator at 35. We would put our leftovers ontop of the ice and it worked. Maybe if they take the cabinet door off that should allow the refrigerator sensor to adequately adjust ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è. But other than the refrigerator everything else was excellent.  Service, very friendly! I will stay here again.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: We lived two nights here. The experience are extremely bad. We got the room at the third floor. Facing the lobby side. There are very noisy in the lobby until 12:00pm in the night. And I fell asleep around 12:30am. Wake up because of the fire alarm around 2:00am in these two nights. Don't live here if you want to have a good sleep.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion:
Spent 3 nights here. It was a decent stay but due to the Covid restrictions we really couldn't take advantage of what the hotel offered. No room service which was disappointing.

Rooms were good sized, beds were comfortable although the pillows left a lot to be desired. Good water pressure in the shower but the bathroom products were a little boring. Good WiFi strength in the room.

The real value in this hotel is the location. It's right in the middle of all the action and walking distance to everything a person would need in Savannah.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: It's ok. Newly renovated. Not many perks offered aside from being in the heart of the historic (drinking) district of Savannah. Once you valet your car, you are within walking distance of just about everything.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: My son took me on a trip to Savannah for my birthday. I can't begin to even explain how impressed I was with Hyatt Regency Savannah. When you pull up...valet and busboy. Check-in was seamless. The Christmas decor was gorgeous! Not tacky...very tasteful. The gym is the best gym I've seen in a hotel. The indoor heated pool was huge, and very clean. We had it to ourselves for nearly two hours. The room was immaculate! I e worked in the hotel industry...the housekeepers there don't skip any steps. I appreciate that. Within walking distance (some right across the street) were souvenir shops, breweries, pubs, restaurants... everything you need! Our view was a gorgeous clock tower on city hall. Sounds odd...but it was really beautiful. When we go back, we will be staying at Hyatt again. Well worth the price!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Wonderful place to stay but the pool is in an area with no open areas so the chlorine is very over powering.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion:
Great Hotel, the only issue is that when you book and you expressly request a "River view" they will agree, confirm, and process your payment. Once you arrive, nobody will know anything about the room, the  request, or anything else. The reservation will be there, but no specifics, or notes. And there will be no refund.
Oh and they also don't have breakfast.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Property is gorgeous! The lobby - Wow factor. On-site restaurant is good and has an outdoor patio with a stunning view of the river. We stayed on the 4th floor because the rooms have a private access to the "garden terrace" (also with a stunning view facing the other view of the river). We had an issue on the 1st night of our stay. There was damage to the room (spring break). Manager Chloe went above and beyond to take care of the issue. When in Savannah, we will stay here again for sure!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Great service my wife and i arrived early  and they were super cooled avout it we got acommodate to an early check in whitout problem great hotel nice room very clean best view

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion:
Thin Walls - We paid a decent price for our room on the top floor with Riverview. Not only did we hear the couple from next door enjoying themselves, but we felt the all the "rocking" in our bed as their movements transferred to us through the wall. The shared door probably didn't help the noise, but I've never felt bed movements through a wall before.

It was pretty disgusting. I called to request a transfer and was put on hold for ~10 minutes until the call dropped. I called again and was told that every room was taken. They offered for security to come and knock on their door but I declined. All things considered, our neighbors weren't being terribly loud or obnoxious. We just heard (and felt) all the "commotion". I don't necessarily blame our neighbors for cheap walls. Plus, a visit from security might encourage more noise/motion as retaliation.

I've stayed in several hotels and never made a google review. Wish I hadn't stayed in this one. I attached a photo to corroborate that I actually stayed on the top floor.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Rooms were nice and so we're the convention facilities.  Almost all the hotel staff were very friendly and helpful.  Had a small problem at check in when I was given the wrong type of room and had to drag my luggage up and down several times, after a long day of travel across the country.  Also, on my first day it appeared as though housecleaning had not cleaned my shower at all.  Ever ything else was terrific!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion:
This was an absolutely perfect hotel! The Hyatt is very classy, and located right on the river. The room we stayed in had a balcony, and river view, and they were perfect. The room was clean and spacious and very classy; it was just what one would expect from the name Hyatt.
I have provided a photo form the balcony view and the room we were staying in, on the 7th floor.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Beautiful hotel, very well located, comfortable accommodation, just too expensive.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: By far one of nicest places we've stayed perfectly located in historic district.  Just wish parking wasn't $ 38 a day :(

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Great view of the river walk.  Room and furniture were comfortable.  I don't understand why but the standard room service did not happen. Granted, the front desk did tell me about it at check in. But I don't feel like it should be necessary for me to call down for fresh towels

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion:
Reasonable price!
They have romantic lobby, clean room condition and it located close to river

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: We attended an event the Savannah Ballroom Classic at the Hyatt. Even though the facility was renovated a few years ago, it is incredibly well maintained. Light, bright and spacious in the Commons areas; grab-n-go was well stocked with healthy snacks, mini-meals and the standard convenience foods. Surprisingly, there was a thoughtful emphasis on Savannah foodie specialties and GeorgiaGrown treats, condiments and drygoods. The ballroom set up was tastefully prepared and catering staff were on top of the meals that were part of the competition specialty package. The entrees served were creative and beautifully presented. The restrooms were clean and well stocked. Every interaction with hospitality staff was terrific, a vast improvement on years past.  Although we did not stay overnight, our experience as a day guest was terrific. I would have rated the review a five-star, however the internet, even as a guest, was slow and glitchy; same as last year.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Friendly staff. Very comfy bed. Valet parking. Easy access to River and Bay streets. Great view.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion:
Traveling during a pandemic can be stressful, but the Hyatt Made me feel so comfortable!! They have a mask mandate and even Valet has to wear a mask.
The check-in was friendly and fast!
The lobby and general common areas were PRISTINE!
On to the room...AMAZING! The room was so clean and the view is to die for!! Its right on the river and I had two walls of windows! (1 of the river and 1 of River st.)
The bar...A+ !! I forgot the bartenders name but she was great! We went and sought her out for night two as well.
The entire hotel is relaxing. You now have to reserve The indoor pool so that only 1 group or family is in there at a time. You get 1hr. which was fine with me.
I will definitely be back!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: No room service due to Covid.  Staff are great.  Breakfast staff are super!  You don't know until you check in that they have to valet your car.  $39 plus tips a day.  Location close to everything.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion:
Beautiful hotel, great location.

Everything costs something and parking is an additional $30.00.

It‚Äôs a $200.00 per night hotel. I didn‚Äôt appreciate the petty charges - breakfast not included.

Rooftop view of the city.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Our window opened to an elevator so no window for us. Small, but clean bathroom. Pretty comfortable bed but no blanket or bedspread. Just sheets so felt a little...uncovered. Great location for walking about and carriage ride we booked picked us up right in front.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Great hotel. Right on River St. Definitely would recommend. The staff were there to accommodate every step of the way. Only issue being they were doing a lot of remodeling but that is to be expected to improve.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Stars for location, view, service, cleanliness, and... location again. We were literally dropped into the happenings of the Riverfront area in Savannah, GA. Our room and the hotel had amazing views! The hotel made the trip so enjoyable. Watching the river as we relaxed and popped in and out of the hotel when we wanted to was perfect.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion:
Nice hotel, horrible house keeping.
On our second night of our stay I pulled back the sheets to discover a dip / spit stain. And by staying I don't even really mean stain I just mean a nasty marking that could have most likely been laundered away .on the mattress pad that was not from me or my husband so it had been there when we started our stay. I had unfortunately noticed that the room wasn't very clean upon checking in and just chalked it up to bad housekeeping but this was beyond acceptable.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Absolutely amazing hotel! The people here are so friendly and helpful. It is right on the river and the views are Beautiful. Definitely worth the price for a river view. It was nice to see how safe they are here during COVID. There are plenty of restaurants near by, Including one in the hotel. Everything is within walking distance.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: The view and location are amazing. The bar and valet staff were great. The room was dirty, the elevators were broken or slow and the front desk staff was rude at checkout. I have never had to carry my luggage down 4 flights of stairs in my life. We enjoyed watching the container ships go by, though.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Rooms were nice, bathroom a little small and elevators took forever was the only down side. Overall great experience though

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Stayed here for the 4th of July week. Not a bad drive from here to Tybee island, about 30 minutes one way. Everyone seemed to enjoy their job or acted well. You can always tell the one or two ppl who don't want to be at work, but they still were helpful. The gym and pool are below the lobby are seem nice. Plenty of workout equipment and never crowded. Too many restaurants to choose from and the food was awesome! My wife and I did the breakfast at the hotel every morning with our daughter for the convenience. It cost around 20ish per person. There's a horse carriage ride pick up right outside the front entrance. So everything seemed really close to this hotel and if you stay on July fourth book a hotel room facing the westin hotel. We had a perfect view of the fireworks with perfect 72 degree ac weather. All in all a great experience and we will definitely be back next year!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: So disappointed with my stay here and very disappointed with how our issues were handled. Came here with friends and booked 2 rooms next to each other. Both our rooms were filthy. Mine had a few dead roaches by the bed/tv, some random dirty boxers, and a giant layer of dirt all through the carpet. When we complained they did not take any action for a whole day. They offered us either a cleaning or two (much worse) rooms that weren't even together. The manager didn't even reach out to me until after we checked out. Given the price point, absolutely NOT worth the stay. 24 hr gym is nice though

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: I've stayed in a motel 6 that was better than this place. The hotel was nice, but the room was not worth $500 a night. Then $38 for "valet parking," but I had to go to the garage to pick my car up. I could have just parked in a public lot for all of that. The AC didn't work well. I turned it all the way down just to get the room to a comfortable temp. There was a chicken ball under the bed, as well as a random pill. Lastly, they put me in the handicap room where the door automatically stays open for about 1 min. Giving the hallway a full view of my room. This is the worst hyatt I have even seen. I'm truly disappointed in this!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: So I love Hyatts and are even Hyatt members (but am not necessarily brand loyalist) and thought how can we go wrong with staying here especially with the location. Well other than the location, I have to say for a Hyatt we were disappointed. To begin with we upgraded our room to get a water view with a bacolony. Being a member and having the app it allows you to upgrade the day or two before your reservation. Well, our room was ready early but it wasn't the right room we paid extra for. üòí it was a water view from the side of the building (oh I see what they did there that's sneaky) but where is my damn balcony. To make matters worse every time I went down to deal with it at the front desk there was a huge line and only 1-2 people working the front desk ... Which seems a little short staffed considering its such a huge hotel on the weekends. I would always just give up and resolve to come back later. A couple times I tried calling on the phone and no one would even answer the phone just pick up the phone and hang it up. üò°. The major problem we had was the Valet service. SLOW, SLOW, SLOW. Again, because they are often parking your cars off site (we were told this by the actual staff) they DON'T have ENOUGH PEOPLE WORKING. I had read the reviews and peioke griping about the valet so I told me husband hey call about 20-30 min before we need our car. We would get the phone call to our room "please proceed down to valet your car will be ready in 5 min" and THEN STILL WAIT ANOTHER 15-20 MIN. This is ABSOLUTELY unacceptable especially when they are charging you $30/night and MANY other hotels in the city that are just as expensive are free or not nearly the cost. I dont mind paying, don't get me wrong I actually love the convenience of valet.... But DAMN you better get that service locked down because it is making your hotel look like ammature hour! Just because the inside is nice and reflects a Hyatt chain doesn't mean you can SKIMP on customer service because the word will get out and the Hyatt Brand will come calling. End of rant.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion:
Great place. Most convenient stay location in Savannah. Best views from Hotel.

Dated and in need of some repairs

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: This was one of the nicest places we have stayed in Georgia! Right in the river, perfect location

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Beautiful  place, large open friendly staff, clean rooms. Right on the river walk ‚ô° this pics are of around the building out front an on the boat.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: The team at the Hyatt Regency Savannah truly went above and beyond to make our stay accommodating and enjoyable. Jason, Cloe, Dre, and Tequila were fantastic! Thanks for all your hard work in this crazy covid times! We sincerely appreciate it!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Beautiful hotel in the heart of  Savannah. Great river view with some of the rooms and easy access to all the restaurants and shops. We love it.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion:
Great views of the River if you upgrade your room. The conference rooms are nice and keep the noise down from the adjoining rooms.

The bedrooms are clean, but the staff won't have most of the rooms done until late afternoon.

Signs are posted saying quiet hours are 10 pm to 7 am. The noise in the center area carries to the rooms and it was loud every night until around 1:30 am.

There are better options in the area and I was sad to see this was only slightly above an adequate hotel.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Checked in later than expected and the girl at the front desk graciously upgraded us to a riverfront balcony room. The view was amazing!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: The hotel looks nice and clean.  There are seats for relaxing in many corners, delicious food, good service, beautiful rooms on the river.  complete facilities.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: My wife and I had a very nice stop over here while traveling. The hotel has recently been updated and it's very well done. The rooms are nice and the beds are comfortable. We had a river view room which was really nice. Watching the cargo ships go past while fully loaded is a neat thing as well as the rest of the boats doing their thing. This hotel is also right in the middle of everything happening on River Street. VERY convenient location when walking the shops and restaurants while enjoying the river front. This hotel should be highly considered when planning a trip to Savannah.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: I had a great time good food great view awesome service

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion:
Great location by the river and conviniently located close to most downtown Savannah attractions. Very friendly staff responsive to most requests.
Nice rooms with river views.
Breakfast at the hotel was excellent (not included) with some items clearly labelled as gluten free.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion:
Excellent place to stay in Savannah if you want to be in the middle of the sights an views.
It can be expensive, Parking a $39 a day add. The rooms with a river view were worth an up charge.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: We stayed at the Hyatt to be central in our trip to downtown Savannah and it sure was. Everything we did was within walking distance. We used the valet parking and walked around our entire trip. The hotel is very large and the bar downstairs was good. The room had a balcony, but a super tiny one, just to stand and take in the scenes. You can see the boardwalk below and endless flow of river traffic as well as the bridge. The room was spacious and clean. I gave four stars for the price. I feel it was overpriced in relation to the view and type of room. Not sure why Google placed a figure of $137 on this review when I paid over $500/night ü§¶üèª‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è The staff were all meh üòë no one stood out. From the valet to the front desk.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: What a beautiful lobby! The staff continued to showcase that Savannah charm and equally matched hospitality. The room was clean, spacious, and ready when we arrived. You can't ask for much more being in the heart of the historic district.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion:
On arrival Jan.25, 2019 valet was a lil hectic around 5pm but check in went smoothly. Valet is $30.00 per day I think rather you move your vehicle or not.. We arrived and let a family member picked us up each day. So our truck just stayed parked.

We had  booked 2 king size riverview rooms. $424.46 each for 2 nights. You can see the Queen Mary right outside of our window. The room was nice and spacious. The bed was so comfortable. The elevator came quickly. There's a restaurant on site. The hotel is just absolutely beautiful.

You can hear the barge when it comes by early in the am it blows a loud horn.

You can exit the building and go right onto River Street. We went for a night scroll with everyone else out and enjoyed the night life. Thanks Hyatt

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Who still has full-size beds? Definitely need to upgrade to Queen-size. Otherwise, OK. Had to request the bath tub be unclogged, they fixed it within an hour. Great to be right on the river!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Great place to stay! Convenient cause it's right on the river walk. The rooms are spacious, comfortable, and clean. Tje staff are very nice and the service is great! This is our sunrise from our room ‚ù§

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Beautiful hotel. Really clean. The staff is incredibly accommodating and helpful. What I loved most was the lobby area, and the lounge spaces that overlook the river. Although our room also overlooked the river, my husband and I just sat and talked there for at least an hour. Valet is swift, but the location is in walking distance to almost everything. We had one very small hiccup which I wouldn‚Äôt even mention here, but I only do so to tell you how amazing and caring management was to rectify it IMMEDIATELY. This establishment prioritizes their visitors‚Äô experience from beginning to end. I will definitely stay here again.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.

In spite of what we went through we stayed because of you two ladies and your hospitality. I pray your manager know that he/she has two genuine members representing the company very well.
