prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: From the valet attendants to the nice and friendly individuals checking us in we felt welcomed.  The view from our room was gorgeous. The food was another great treat. I can't wait to book another stay at the Hyatt Regency.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: This hotel had the perfect view of the river and was in a great location. I stayed here for an on-site conference, and the customer service, facilities and food were top notch. I would highly recommend this hotel for your conference needs. This view is from the terrace which is a great spot to unwind after a long day.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: On the river with easy access to River Road. Lovely modern hotel with clean rooms. Price was right on Priceline.com Nice touches like cucumber water in the lobby, newspapers, free WiFi.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Clean rooms, pleasant staff, great views of the river, bridge and river front shops from the Hyatt.  This is our "go to" place any time we are in Savannah.  It is very convenient to walk from the Hyatt to many tourist attractions in the area.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion:
Absolutely wonderful hotel.

We stayed here for a drive from FL to Atlanta, and wanted a change of scenery instead of going up I75 again.

It's in an perfect location, on site valet parking is a bit pricey, but the Whitaker Street garage is a very short walk to the hotel and much cheaper to park at.

Walking along the river is quite nice too. Watching the ships is quite cool.

The sun deck on the 7th floor give a nice view of downtown Savannah, and the Garden Terrace on the 4th floor has a great view of the river with comfortable and quiet seating.

When we arrived we saw many signs for the Georgia Association of Realtors, so we were a little worried it'd be noisy, but it is dead silent in the room.

This is by far the quietest hotel room I've ever been in. In the hallway is quite a bit noisier, but in your room it's literally silent.

Even with someone above you, you can't hear them take a shower unless you are in the bathroom deliberately trying to hear it. It's fantasticly quiet.

The bathroom is fairly small, I will agree with those reviews, but it's not unreasonable at all.

In my opinion the only thing that gives away how old this hotel is are the elevators. They look so incredibly dated it's hilarious. The boxy glass elevators are in desperate need of modernization. One of the 3 are out of service for updates, but who knows when that will be done. There's enough reviews on here saying it's been in progress for a while. Only having two elevators was not a hindrance at all though.

The bar was pretty nice too, and the outdoor seating area has a great view of the river. I'd totally recommend the River Street Rendezvous cocktail. It's excellent if you like rum and pineapple juice.

Overall, I'd definitely stay here again. Hyatt continues to deliver on their legendary quality.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: We go here once a year and were so disappointed. We have never had a problem  checking in a little  early, but this time they said room wasn't ready. No problem. Walked by the river  & came back at 4 (check in time). Still not ready. Offered to comp us an appetizer or cocktail. Got one cocktail each and waited for them to contact us. 5:40 We were able to check in. We met the couple next door on the balcony and they had same problem. Just a shame because we loved coming here until  this.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion:
Great location right on the river.
We enjoyed the view from the public sitting room.
They offered us a free pack and play for our small travel companion and it came with some travel size goodies which I thought was a nice gesture (even though baby powder is a no go).
The room was modern, clean, and good overall.
The gym was great and the pool was good for a little swim (it‚Äôs on the smaller side).
Staff at check in was friendly.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion:
If you're looking for a nice, clean, upscale hotel, located centrally to all attractions, this is your place.

The front desk is exemplary. Far exceeds your ideas for the best customer service, and truly takes care of you.

Their marketplace was also top notch. They have a variety of quality goods, from banana bread, bagels, candies, gourmet sandwiches with chips, variety of beverages/sodas, fresh hot coffee, and an entire freezer full of Savannah's best ice cream, Leopold's! (Sandwich kit is a lil pricey at $15, but it was good).

Also, when the Hyatt's computers went down, they were still able to handle and help customers. Really impressed with the level of care and the helpfulness. The valet was also pretty good. They lost my keys initially, but it was due to the system being down, and in a downpour, the valet ran my car to us. I would recommend this hotel over any other in the downtown area.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: 1st class service from the minute you drive in. The valet service is excellent, the front staff were great and personable, the concierge was helpful with whatever we needed. Beautiful view from a corner room overlooking the river and Riverstreet. Beautiful room and grounds. The staff made our anniversary very memorable with  everything being so perfect.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: The hotel was in a great location on the river. The staff were very friendly and welcoming. Housekeeping could have been better, the curtains were stained, the carpet could have been vacuumed better and the bathroom was very dusty.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion:
We utilized this property for a work retreat, and over 4 days we saw the staff in action. Housekeeping was excellent, with the only less than excellent item being that they didn't vacuum my room each day. Front desk staff at reception was attentive. Lobby was spacious and beautifully decorated.

We also used a meeting room that was staffed by food service workers and hotel management, and this was an interesting situation because the first day we were there they took excellent care of us.  The second and third days of meetings, our service was noticeably dropping off. Staff on the first day were well aware of our dietary restrictions in the group and were very detailed to make sure everything was correct. Not so in following days. The last day they basically disappeared after lunch, zero dessert options or drink refills, and we did not see hotel staff again until the end of the day. However, food was good and our drink station was properly maintained most of the time. Views from the meeting room were beautiful, overlooking the river.
Overall this was a good experience and I would stay at another Hyatt for business travel.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.

My main issue is the cleaning I was trying to dry my hair with the hair dryer and it's the most disgusting thing that I had ever seen in my life. I'm adding a picture I'm marking in a circle the scratch to the dirt that I did with my nail just to see the amount of ( i don't want to know what is it ).
I'm on room 652 if someone from the hotel wants to take a look to it.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: This was our first weekend away from our 5 children in over 2 years and the Eden Resort and Suites did not disappoint. From the welcoming atmosphere, cleanliness, and phenomenal staff we will definitely make this our first choice for another staycation. The staff was accommodating and courteous.  While walking down the hall to my brother and sister-in-law's room carrying her birthday gifts a staff member in front of us turned around and asked if we needed assistance carrying anything.  The room was spacious and comfortable and we loved the adults-only floor. We all actually decided to not go out and do an activity but stayed in the room and had beverages and played cards till after 2 AM. A big plus is where our room was and the "J" entrance we were a mere 100 steps to the Sheetz :) The only complaint we have is with the pool. We have no problem and understand the booking of time slots to ensure everyone's safety I wish it was open later for adults. Most places we have visited only allow adults after 10 PM.  It was kind of hard to enjoy the hot tub. Otherwise, I really have no complaints at all. We easily made reservations for Arther's Terrace and the food was delicious.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion:

The pool was heated, but it was still cold in my opinion. They ran out of towels when I had arrived to the pool so I had to wait until I was ready to leave and they had just restocked the towels. The playground was small, but nice. The basketball court was also nice. The table tennis could have been maintained better, the net was broken so was the 1 paddle that was at the table. While I was there the restaurant was closed for renovations. So were unable to get room service despite the front desk telling me the other restaurant was opened, but I was unable to get connected to that restaurant.

Other than the few minor hiccups, we enjoyed our stay, I do feel the resort was overpriced based on what was offered.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: We went to the Eden for a banquet.  The courtyard and lobby were decorated beautifully and very festive for the holiday season.  The only complaint that I would have is that the line for the bar was very long and the people that wanted drinks were taken away from the event for about 20 minutes at a time. All in all it was an excellent night!!!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: I can't even guess how many times I've been to the Eden for events, numerous. From formal to more casual, buffet and served sit down dinners, we've always been pleased with the food and service given here. I was even on a committee once that organized an event and dealing with the staff was a breeze. Beautiful atmosphere, great location, you can't go wrong here.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion:
We stayed for an overnight stay this past weekend and had a wonderful time! We were in a poolside room which had a door right into the indoor pool. This was so nice to be able to walk right out, swim, and head right back into our room. The room was clean and comfortable and had plenty of space. The outdoor pool is a good size and has plenty of seating available. We used the mobile app for check-in, check-out, and the key to our room which worked great and it was so nice to not have to go to the front desk for anything.

We explored the hotel and the event rooms were so beautiful. The location isn't directly near much, but it is pretty close to downtown Lancaster which had some great restaurants and shopping.

The main issue I think worth noting is that the wifi in the hotel, at least in our room, was basically unusable. We had to use mobile data to use the internet and the app for our room key. If you need internet to do any work while you're there I would say it isn't going to happen. Overall our stay was great and we'll definitely consider going back!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: 10+ service! Not only was the staff attentive to our needs, the Resort itself was beautiful, our room was perfect, spacious, and included every resource we could need, IE microwave, fridge, cabinets for dry food/snacks, cereal, ext. The housekeeping, staff, front desk went far and beyond what we expected (Jacob was awesome!) We literally live not even 30 mins away and decided to stay at Eden for 2 days as a "Staycation" for our family of 5, so great we extended an extra day and I must say, we enjoyed every min, from the huge indoor heated pool to the playground and even mommy got to enjoy some time in the jacuzzi!:) Plenty of dining nearby if you choose not to use the delicious food at Arthur's, Bloody Mary's are outstanding! Needless to say, husband has vacation again in June, we are definitely looking forward to spending 5 fabulous days here again. Thank you Eden and staff for a wonderful few days away!:)

completion: The Eden never disappoints. Rooms are always clean and offer the right amount of space. The staff is nice and very helpful. The service desk is very quick to respond and are very helpful. prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: We came to Lancaster to enjoy the New Year. We stayed in the King Villas. The room itself was beautiful. The bathroom could have used some updating. Also the  kitchenware needed better cleaning, but nice nonetheless. The real issue with my stay and why I would never decide to visit again was the customer service and my personal property. I stayed overnight on New Year‚Äôs Eve. I woke up in the morning to find my white car parked in the lot COVERED with confetti. My car was the only one within that lot covered. I was understandably upset, and wanted to rectify the situation. I called the front desk and explained the issue. I understand it was not the hotel, but rather other guests and my personal property is not the responsibility of the resort. Where is the accountability for the guests they house? They offered minimal help or care. The most they could offer to assist was windex and paper towels or filing a police report. They had no usable hose on the property where I could have rinsed off my car. They offered no kind of compensation towards a car wash, even $5.00 would have gone a long way. The confetti had to later be POWER-WASHED from my car. Again, I understand it wasn‚Äôt the resort directly , but I would not trust my car on this property again, personally.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Been coming here for years, beautiful hotel, great salt water indoor pool & spa. Heated outdoor pool open until end of October. Also outside has small playground, basketball, pool table, ping pong table, shuffle board & bocce. Reasons for 3 stars, 1. had absolutely no WiFi the entire 4 days their in our room. It was located poolside by the indoor pool. WiFi worked outside of room & in lobby though. Spoke to front desk twice, & they said they didn‚Äôt need to come to the b/c router was outside of room. Was texting with someone & they gave me the password to another WiFi, but that didn‚Äôt work in the room. 2. Weddings all weekend so very hard to get a parking spot at night. Rooms lack USB ports to charge devices. No more free coffee in lobby. Gave a card now for towels, 1 towel per card, if you don‚Äôt turn card back in $25 charge, see pic. Hotel is $200 -$300 or more a night depending on when you go. 10-15 minute drive to Route 30, where all the stores & activities are.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion:
We checked in today and so far this place has exceeded our expectations. Staff has been incredibly friendly and helpful. We checked into on of the suites snd recived a text from. The concierges to help us with anything we needed. We texted them a few times to get some information and they were very prompt, helpful and really nice. The room is wonderful, very clean  and modern. See pics. Were going to us the heated pool , hot tub and will try the on site restaurant, will update our review post.
Update, we did goto the indoor pool and it was enchanting. Indoor heated pool was great. You get cards for towel service when you check in and get a fresh towel when you arrive to the pool. The jacuzzi was corded off due to maintenance. While that was dissapointing for our evening I greatly appreciated thier concern for guests safety.
We also had dinner at the restaurant and that was incredible. They have this seafood dish with a tomato broth that was divine. Everyone in our party raved about thier food.
Breakfast, we would advise to skip the buffet, it was not up to the rest of the standards. Pastries were days old, the hot fares were mediocre.  The fruit was nice but that was not worth the price. So I would suggest breakfast offsite and there close places to choose from.
Breakfast aside this place us great and we'll worth the price, we loved our stay.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion:
We stayed here over the Thanksgiving weekend to visit family.  We had a room right off the pool so our grandchildren could come visit and spend time swimming. It has a tropical atmosphere and a hot tub. The door to the pool is locked from the outside at night and there is an alarm that alerts you if someone opens the door from the room. This is great for safety for families with small children. The room we had was spacious with 2 queen beds. The room was clean.  I liked the vanity make up area outside the bathroom but the lighting should be more conducive to being able to see better. This hotel has a bar off the dining room and the dining room had certain hours of operation...which is ok as I like the option to eat in the dining room instead of going out.There was a convenience store which carried lots of goodies including great coffee from Lancaster County. I really like the classic charm throughout this whole resort and the  service of the staff was
superior throughout.  The only reason I did not give 5 stars is the comfort of the bed. We woke up each morning with backaches. Maybe mattresses should be upgraded ü§î. Otherwise a classic hotel which I enjoyed.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion:
This place doesn‚Äôt look like much when you pull up, but once inside you can tell that they take pride in this hotel.
Everything in the lobby was very clean, neat and orderly. It looked like this place had been remodeled recently.
The breakfast and sitting area are located right off of the main entrance across from the lobby.
It too was very clean and neat.
I stopped here for one night on my return trip home from Florida.
I always choose a Best Western because the rooms are very clean, they give you complimentary toiletries, blow dryer, iron and ironing board, a coffee pot and free coffee in your room. You also get a refrigerator and microwave in your room and free WiFi.
I always try to get a king size bedroom. The beds are super comfortable, and I‚Äôm able to get a good nights sleep.
With my room came with a complimentary breakfast. This is standard with most Best Westerns.
This Smithville Best Western has an indoor pool which is permanently closed and a gym. I did not use them.
For breakfast they serve scrambled eggs, ham or bacon, grits, homemade waffles, that you make yourself. Cold cereal, oatmeal, fresh fruit, yogurt, biscuits and sausage gravy, bagels, toast, muffins, pastries, coffee, tea, juices, or milk. You can have as much as you want. The breakfast is constantly replenished by a sweet older lady.
Checkin was very easy. The front desk staff was extremely nice, and made some recommendations when we asked. They have a free parking lot.
This hotel is located off I-95, this low-key hotel is an 8-minute walk from shopping at Carolina Premium Outlets and 2 miles from the Ava Gardner Museum. The prices were reasonable for this hotel.
I would definitely stay here again.

completion:
I was there the First day they opened in chaos. It was exciting and I wanted to see Bobby Flay üòò. It has changed so much now , with table games üé≤üé∞ and more restaurants. The expansion
of the Hotel just gave it more reasons for new business experiences. They also have great concerts at the Casino üéº. Being at the retail center is a plus for everyone, Arundel Mills is a full day or 2 adventure.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a casino.
completion:
We were visiting from out of town and we wanted to try out a new restaurant and check out a casino for the first time so we went here (we also ended up checking out Horseshoe Casino on another night and I would prefer Live! over Horseshoe if I gambled since it was more crowded and more tables going on at Live!). The main reason we visited was I have seen Bobby Flay on the cooking channel so wanted to try out his burger palace.
We did not gamble but we walked around the casino before and after dinner at BBP. This casino is also a hotel. A 4-star hotel. It is located in Hanover which really worked out for us since it is right next to the largest mall in Maryland - Arundel Mills. Quick walk from the mall to the casino.
We saw hundreds of slot machines and some table games going on like blackjack, poker, roulette, craps, etc. and playing the slots and table games range from 1 cent to a couple hundred dollars as far as what you can bet per slot or table. They did have a high betting area as well. I think it was at least $50 each bet but not 100% sure; we did not walk in there. In the main casino area, I saw video themed slots from dragons, anime, Simpsons, etc. Musicians and bands come here to perform such as Gladys Knight and Dwight Yoakam so check it out if you are in the area and want to go to a special event.
The bathrooms in the casino were clean. Everything was stocked with toilet paper, soap, paper towels, etc.
There are other restaurants/places to eat at that have American, Asian, seafood, and Italian dishes. There are a lot of casual places and a fine dining option. Go to the casino website to check out those options. There are TVs in this casino to watch sports on such as Sportscenter, baseball games, football games, etc. They had a Live! Casino gift shop as well. We didn't walk in there but it was big enough to get a souvenir with their logo on it, cigarettes, snacks, or whatever you wanted from there.
There was plenty of free parking. They also offer valet parking.
It was cool to go to a casino and have that experience but I am not sure we will be back again unless we were with a group of people who wanted to go or we chose to try out one of the other restaurants.

The appearance of this hotel is great but I hope you don‚Äôt have to call the front desk. You have to call for any towels, to have your room clean, etc‚Ä¶.. the wait times to call are greater than 5 minutes. Conference food was absolutely lacking any taste or creativity. Vegetarian option was pasta with a can of warmed tomato sauce dumped on top.
Hotel staff was very nice. The bathrooms were staffed with people for the conference area and were kept exceptionally clean‚Ä¶ I mean SPOTLESS! Overall, it‚Äôs an OK hotel but needed more staff. We were there for 6 days and wasn‚Äôt able to get a cart for the luggage when we arrived or left.
The location of the hotel seems good considering the proximity to BWI airport. You have to walk through the Casino to get to more food and the choices are slim. Vegetarian options were a negative. Some of the casino staff wouldn‚Äôt let you bring outside food back through the casino. You go up 3 floors, through the garage, and back down on the other side. When I tell you that this is dumb, it is an understatement!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a casino.
completion:
The newly open LIVE! Casino & Hotel. I booked this for a one night staycation and wanted to give it a shot.

We knew construction was still ongoing, so finding the entrance from the garage was a bit confusing but the best level to park on was P1 on the far side away from the Casino itself because this took you to the backside of the Casino which is where they have the new entrance for the Hotel. The moment you walk in to the hallway, you see the Gelato place and the gift shop all next to David's (the hotel restaurant). You honestly forget you were in the Live! Casino itself just a few seconds ago. The check-in staff was very attentive and helpful in finding our reservations and getting us on our way; the only bad part was I expected a $20 free play but because I had already gotten this credit a few years ago, they didn't give it to me.

We had our unit on the 8th floor for a King Suite with a bathtub and shower. It was a very spacious master suite, with a huge bathroom. The toilet and shower each had a separate glass door unit with a double vanity. The room had huge fantastic glass windows with a view to the Costco, still cool overall. The downside was the sound-proof of the room; we heard the planes outside since we were on the BWI runway side and also housekeeping having large conversations in the hallway sounded like they were inside our own room. I also was disappointed that they did not give hand soap (at least the little bars) for you to use. Also, the pillows were not what I expected in a luxury suite, not that comfortable.

The Keurig coffee machine was a nice plus to have in the room, along with an iron and ironing board. The attention to detail in having robes was also nice; the large screen TV was great (w/ plenty of channels and ability to link with your streaming apps). The nice touch of having a touch pad with your name was cool; it also has a built-in app for white noise which was helpful. Finally, having a couch (not that comfy), coffee table and office desk were nice pluses.

In regard to the Spa and Fitness center, we went down to see the Fitness center and overall were impressed with the equipment (mainly aerobics, but nice smith machines, kettle and dumbbells). We didn't see inside the Spa area but it looked very spacious. Otherwise, we went down to the Casino itself and played.

For the price we paid for a King suite, we expected a bit more (ie. some extras included). But definitely worth a shot!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a french restaurant.
completion:
You can consider LA CREME your go-to spot for small batch, organic artisan crepes. The Canela and Citron crepes are our favorites. Make sure to order them with strawberries.

The difference, as with most great restaurants, starts with using excellent ingredients. When we spoke to Kim, the owner of LA CREME, she explained that their toppings are either made in-house or sourced from high quality bakers and such is the whipped cream ‚Äî a delicious level of thickness with the right amount of sweet.

You can feel the attention to details in the decor. It‚Äôs down to earth with an elegant use of black and white with splashes of rose gold among the perfectly socially-distanced tables.

The staff is young, precise, and welcoming.

Overall a great experience that can rival those in Napa, where we‚Äôve been going for years.

One small change I would suggest is upgrading the coffee creamer. Pleased do away with the plastic containers. They just don‚Äôt fit within the ambiance LA CREME has created.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a bar & grill.
completion:
My wife and I stopped here for lunch following a trip to Chriskindlemart.

We were quickly greeted by the hostess and or waitress Kim came over to us to take our order relatively quickly. She greeted us with a smile in a very friendly manner.

We both ordered the strawberry lemonade which is a great thirst quencher. For appetizers,  we shared the crab dip and brown butter buffalo wings which were delicious.

For meals, my wife had the crab cakes with brussel sprouts and the bacon twice baked potato. She said the crab cakes were very good but said the brussel sprouts,  although extremely tasty and flavorful,  were not fully cooked and were somewhat hard. She also said the twice baked potato filling was very good, but the skin of the potato was very hard and overcooked.

I had the butter garlic strip steak medium well with the broccoli, potato wedges and the stuffed potato.

The steak was served already sliced, and although not a huge problem, not something that I prefer. It was slightly over cooked. To me, medium well it's slightly pink in the center (serving temp around 160*) but it was cooked well done. Also, the menu says roasted garlic and herb butter. I didn't sense any butter on it and it came with quartered garlic on top. The wedges were very tasty and seasoned nicely as was the stuffed potato.

For dessert we had the funnel cake fried Oreo's which was delicious!

The presentation of all the food was exceptional. The cleanliness of the restaurant was superb. There wasn't a time when we didn't see someone cleaning.

Lastly, the food was not very expensive for the portions.

Service - 10
Cleanliness - 10
Speed - 9
Quality - 8
Value - 10

Overall dining experience - 9.4

prompt: A Google Maps review about a casino.
completion: Absolutely recommend this resort! Beautiful decor and VERY friendly staff. The pool i recommend going early if enjoying adults only type of time, by 2-3pm lots of kiddos around. Bistecca was SUPER delicious and wait staff was very friendly and attentive. The live band playing last night 8/12 was jamming pretty well, i didnt stick around to give a full listen though. The cabanas were amazing to utilize, you also get to use the pool before/after checkout so thats a plus. Only gripes would be: unless you valet, theres no separate parking for the hotel, so you either walk thru the casino(which is probably designed on purpose) or walk around the outside, about a 5 min walk. Also, be prepared if going/leaving during peak times as your mixed in with regular casino goers so you may end up in the back of the lot. Secondly, theres not a lot of communication; in terms of staff to staff and promoting. Know before you go, the ONLY place to ACTUALLY get breakfast is Fieri's kitchen (other pption is a starbucks) unless you pay attention to the changing directory sign, you have no indication thats it for breakfast. Thirdly, the buffet opens an hour AFTER checkout, again, breakfast is the cheapest meal to execute so dropping the ball there too.

Few complaints: the parking. Your options are valet and waiting or self-parking outside the casino and making the trek up to your room. It is a bit slow moving process if you choose valet. prompt: A Google Maps review about a casino.

Don't even accidentally knock over a can of pretzels or you will be charged as it is weight sensitive. There is no microwave or refrigerator for personal use. You can rent a refrigerator for $26.50 per day. I believe that there is an option to rent the microwave as well. prompt: A Google Maps review about a boat rental service.
completion:
After a few years of renting boats from a local competitor that always had issues (non existent bimini, broken gas gauge, engine that was leaking gas, dirty and old boats, etc), i decided to try a new rental place.

I rented the 18 foot 150hp Bowrider.  There were no massive issues like before.  The boat was clean, fast, and fun.  The stereo didn't work but we had a wireless water proof speaker for this anyways.  We rented for 3 days and came back once for a fuel up in between.

The only downside was that we hit an underwater log in the middle of the lake.  They showed me the damage to the skeg and as I had taken a pic of the prop/skeg before the rental, it was undeniable.  Got hit with a $350 charge for repair, but I can't blame Yankee as this is part of the risk of boating.

I will be renting from Yankee from now on.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: I have visited Perdido Resort for Nine Years! It is simple an Excellent and Exceptional Service! They will make sure you had a great visit! The entire staff provide exceedingly service! I would love to mentioned each individually employee, but it would take long time. I never want to leave‚Ä¶after September 16, 2020, Hurricane Sally moved onshore in Gulf Shores, unfortunately the resort experienced some damages, but the Resort has been remodel‚Ä¶it is beautiful! The rooms have beautiful floors and decor! The lobby looks so exquisite and elegant! It was good to see the same staff, especially Lauren and the crew members. You can laid back, relax, listen to some music, drink at the bar, swim at the pool or get in the hot tub or you can stay all day at the beach! Enjoying the beautiful Atlantic Ocean. The location directly on the beach and 5miles to beautiful State Park. The entire resort and room were clean and well kept. The on-site restaurants and bars are wonderful with lots of food selections and price ranges. Want a snack or drink by the pool-right there. prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Beautiful and all inclusive resort. Rooms are wonderful. The views are awesome. The restaurants are really nice. There is no reason to leave once you get here. Indoor and outdoor pool. Beach area is beautiful. Staff is super friendly. It is a great place to visit.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion:
I was so impressed with Perdido Beach Resort at our recent conference. All of the staff went above and beyond to meet our needs and facilitate the conference. Front desk staff,  catering/restaurant staff, maid service staff were all excellent.  My hotel room was beautiful, clean and comfortable.  The complimentary valet parking was so appreciated upon arrival! The food at all meals was wonderful.  The lobby, with live music in the evenings, was such a pleasure.
Looking forward to returning.
One suggestion I would make is to get rid of the plastic table attached to the balcony railing in the ocean-front rooms. It obscures the view - not so much when you're standing in the doorway, but when you're seated in the room, it really blocks the view. And, while I see the benefit of the bar-height stools on the balcony, for enhanced viewing while on the balcony, they are very uncomfortable after about 5 minutes.  I have a bad back.  I called the desk to request a regular height chair for the balcony, but none were available.  I ended up buying a chair to use on the balcony - left it in the room, as I didn't have room to take it with me.  If you're planning to replace the rest of the balcony chairs with the plastic bar table and bar stool chairs, please reconsider - maybe offer both, or have some regular chairs available, upon request. If you've already committed to installing the balcony bar table, please consider moving it to the edge of the balcony so it doesn't obstruct the view so much from within the room. One small suggestion in a wonderful stay.
There was a very long wait (45 minutes) on the phone to make a reservation. We had to phone in to get the conference rate. Once I reached a reservationist, everything was great.
The live music in the lobby was most memorable. It just made me happy every time I walked through. The musician did an excellent job.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion:
As a local from Baldwin County, the Perdido Beach Resort is a great option for anyone wanting to spend some time at the beach! It could be challenging to someone not familiar with Orange Beach to decide where to stay, but this place will not disappoint!

Situated just west of Alabama Point at the bridge, the PB Resort is located near The Gulf, a great casual dining option, plus other dining options across the street and nearby. The famous Flora-Bama is just a short drive east!

The PB Resort offers ample parking, but it does fill up quickly. On-site valet is also available. To enter the hotel, you can walk up the side-facing stairs leading from the parking below or remain on the lower level and follow the sidewalk around beneath the upper level.

Upon checking in, we received elastic wristbands that were our room key. Definitely an easy way to keep up with your key instead of always fumbling around in pockets, etc.

Our room was very clean! There was no carpet in our room, just vinyl plank style flooring. A nice upgrade from gross hotel carpet you often find nowadays. We had a small balcony with a bar height table & chairs, that offered a great side view, West facing both the Gulf & the adjacent cove area/ Robinson Island across the street.

The outside bar/patio offers great drinks & food! I thought it was interesting that each time I ordered a Mango Margarita, I got something different but still tasty lol. Bartenders were friendly and quick! Food was also good.

The pool & surrounding grounds are great & create a nice relaxing atmosphere. There was also live music on the days we were there.

Voyagers, one of the many restaurants inside is great! Perfect for date night, or any other celebration.

Really love this hotel! Great for families and everyone visiting Orange Beach!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Great place. Was doing some work in the area brought my wife along so she could relax and shop while I worked. We decided to stay here. The staff is very nice and courteous and the restaurants have very good food and drinks.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion:
When I called to make arrangements with them. I told them what I wanted/expected and they delivered. I believe that we had the best room in the whole resort. I love the fact that everything is right there. We drove in instead of flying so after 12 hours we didn't want to be in the car any longer. They have everything. Your food, alchohol, and if u forgot anything from home, there is a good chance the gift shop has it.

The restaurants available had some amazing food. Not a huge pizza fan but the pizzeria is really good.

Oh and did I mention you can take your alchohol anywhere?  We loved that. You can bring your own or choose from a couple of different bars on site. One of the staff told us only rule was no glass outside. So if you choose to bring your own, make sure u buy cans or aluminum bottles. Also allow coolers on the beach but not in the pool area.

Hotel was very clean (yes I inspected it),every staff member we came in contact from bell hop to bar tenders were super nice and very helpful with any questions we had.

We recommend Perdido Beach Resort to anyone looking for a place in this area. We will definitely be back many times over.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.

Wifi and valet are complementary. Additionally, it is maintained well as we constantly saw the friendly staff working. Voyagers (the fine dining restaurant), Latitude 30, a pizza place ? Name with Icees and Hershey‚Äôs ice cream, and an outdoor bar and grill are all on site. They were all delicious (and great service). The rooms are not cleaned until after checkout unless a guest requests cleaning. Any extra towels or other necessities are available upon request. I always prefer not having cleaning service during my stays at hotels. I‚Äôm good with making my own bed, or not, because I‚Äôm on vacation. Bottom line is this resort exceeded all my expectations, and we were really impressed.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion:
Perdido Beach Resort starts first with the wonderful people who run the hotel like Susan Newsom who made sure our stay for our 38th anniversary was PERFECT.  The rooms are clean and quiet and the breakfast this morning was fast and the omelet chef made a creation that Wolfgang Puck would be proud to share.   If you want a great place to enjoy the beach with wonderful people to take care of you book now.

Update.

The last night we decided to dine at Voyager's.  Eddie got us the perfect window table and the cuisine is the best on the coast from Pensacola to Orange beach you won't find a better view or better service or better steaks.  Save room for dessert.  I do recommend reservations.

Final Thoughts

Well we have been gone for a few days and the glow of a wonderful weekend at PBR is still warning our hearts and we continue to smile.  We are looking forward to returning soon to enjoy the nicest people, the best food and the best service.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion:
It's a pretty nice place. Very convenient to have shops and restaurants on site. Beach access right off the pool is great. The beach is very well taken care of.

The chairs and umbrellas on the beach are for rent. We got out there early and we weren't away of that so we were told nicely to move our stuff. We didn't rent from them as we had our own things but the option is great.

The pool is a pretty big size. It was too cold for us enjoy it though but so was the beach. We went 5/23-5/27. It's not a heated pool. Wish it was and we could have enjoyed it. The temperature when we went was high 70s, 14mph winds and felt amazing outside of the water. If the pool was heated, it would have been amazing. The kiddie pool is also nice but also not heated.

We stayed in room 601 and Our room was nice, room service and house keeping were great. We didn't have enough towels or know how to turn on the shower on but we called house keeping and they were there in seconds with more towels and shower us the shower. (You just pull down on a fixture directly under faucet lol and to turn it off, you just shut the water off. I felt a little dumb haha) Our room had a fridge but no microwave. Beds are super comfy. But oh!!! The sliding door had me about to rip it out. The sliding balcony door has a frame that is above the floor. I stubbed my toe on that frame at least 15 times while I was there and by the last time I did it I wanted to rip out that door. My daughter also stubbed her toe a few times and cried every time. It hurts! So beware of that door. Not sure if all the rooms are like that but 601, yes. I warned you.

Breakfast buffet was super good! Definitely give it a go. Priced well too. The pizza downstairs is also really... Really good!

This was our first time to Orange Beach/Gulf shores and it was nice. If you plan on chilling on the beach of resort the whole time, I would recommend this place. We didn't find much else to do here. Yeah there's a park and The Track is pretty cool but I was expecting to see a bunch of restaurants and activities. None of that here. It's nothing compared to Destin which is just 90 min away but if I go back, and the price is right, I'll stay at this resort again.

Staff was super friendly and helpful. From the time time we checked in to the time we checked out, we felt super welcomed.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Beach side room with a gorgeous view! Poolside live music during the afternoon and poolside grill and an ice cream shop just inside. Live piano music in the evenings, too! Loved our stay there!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: A great place to take your family!!! We had a great time!! Next time we will stay longer!!!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: We stayed at Predido for an anniversary vacation and enjoyed a wonderful experience.  Can't say enough of the great staff. Special kudos for Brittany (the Club Level hostess), all the bellmen and valets. What great bunch for folks! We loved the pool area and overall facilities. Pool area bartenders were terrific. Food all downstairs grill and pizzeria was delicious.  Next time we stay in the area, it will be at Predido Resort!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion:
I stayed here for the NENA conference last year, and I'd heard only negative things about the hotel.  I'm happy to say they were wrong!

The hotel underwent a renovation at some point in the last few years so the rooms are more modern.  From what my co-worker said it "used to look like a dump".  There are some issues with quality of the rooms where it looks like a flipper did them.  An example is the shower doors where they will slide open on their own.  My room as well as my co-worker had this issue.

The pool is very large with a nice bar and a window to order food and drinks from while outside.  There is also a clear walking path to the beach.  There is an inside and outside pool area.  The inside area has a hot tub and a little area for swimming inside (it's connected to the main pool, so if it storms - you'll need to get out).  The inside area is slippery, so watch your footing and DO NOT LET YOUR KIDS RUN.  The main large pool has a walk over bridge and a gazebo where live music was played every day I was there.

If you want food, they have two restaurants that serve dinner (one casual and one fancy), but they are a little pricey.  The fancier option you'll need to make a reservation for as they are small and don't have space for walk ins.  There is also a little cafe that is open in the mornings with coffee and muffins.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Amazing resort. Comfortable rooms, valet parking, and the pool side bar and bartenders were the best

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Great resort! Location is perfect and the beach is so nice. The pizza kitchen down by the pool actually makes really good pizza. Close to lots of stores. The restaurant in the resort is really good too. Nice breakfast buffet.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: A very, very nice resort. We stayed there for a couple of days during the 4th of July. Their breakfast buffet was very good with omelettes made any way you like them. The fireworks display was right in front of the resort on the gulf. Great fireworks display with an all you can eat bbq buffet prior to the fireworks. We had excellent weather and the room very nice with an excellent view of the Gulf of Mexico! We attended a concert (Tedeschi Trucks Band and Blackberry Smoke) at the Wharf Amphitheater which was just a few miles away and needless to say the resort pool and the ocean was incredible! Plenty of things to do including boat rides, parasailing, restaurants galore and plenty of shopping. Over all, we had an excellent time with the only drawback being a whole week would have been nice!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Great view from the west tower. We were able to watch the boats come in to the harbor. Beds were bouncy but we both slept well

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: My mother in law, sister in law, and I took a short girls trip (my 3yr old son also tagged along) & spent 2 nights here and LOVED it. Everyone was extremely friendly. We enjoyed the pier that led to the private beach. It lit up at night, which was nice. I had wished that for the amount of money we were spending on the room, at least breakfast would be included. That and the fact that the separate 2ft kiddie pool was not well lit at night, no lights around it at all, are the only reasons I am giving less than 5 stars. However, although a bit pricy, I can say that the breakfast buffet was VERY good. The servers were great. I would definitely recommend having dinner at Cotton's up the road also! Overall, we had a great girls trip and I can say we will be back! ** I have added photos of the view from our room on the 4th level and a photo of the kiddie pool during the day. **

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion:
Did not stay here as a guest, but came for a conference hosted here. Indoor/outdoor pool looked awesome (didn't get to swim), did have a few drinks at the poolside bar, and there's easy direct access to the beach!
Can't speak to the guest rooms or accommodations for guests, but I would certainly consider coming here if ever on vacation in the area!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion:
Great resort.  Very clean and the customer service is excellent!!  This is the place to stay!
(Add on statement) This resort has live entertainment around the pool during the day and in the lobby at night.  The talent here is unbelievable!  We witnessed 3 gentleman that put on an impromptu show that was incredible!!  You could not walk through the lobby without stopping to listen.  The piano player (John Brust) is here regularly, the clarinet (Tom Owen) stops in occasionally, and the trumpet (Roger Reupert) was here on vacation and say in. This is well worth stopping in for a free (tips) show, even if you can't get a room here!!  See YouTube where I will post a video in a few days.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion:
The hotel phone and online reservation staff, parking lot, and conference staff are disconnected and disjointed.

I WOULD NOT recommend this place for a conference just based on trying to reserve a room and set up for conferences.

The front desk folks are nice and polite.

I COULD NOT stay at the hotel because they would answer the phone and transferred me to a number that would just disconnect you and emails go unanswered or vague responses with no answers to your questions.

They seem to be focused on valet services and conference fees but making vendors at conferences jump through hoops. You must leave keys with the valet to unload and you can't use the side doors because it bypasses the valet.

They respond with the ability to ignore your issues with short useless comments.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a italian restaurant.
completion: Very economical. This sampler I got had 4 different things on it using a big plate. For $3 more, you get a salad and drink. All said and done, about $12 for everything, and it was a ton of food. Service was great. Food was prepared quickly, very friendly people, and attentive to check up on you. Bread sticks (when dining in) are unlimited, and they come hot and fresh, buttered and seasoned with garlic. They are super soft and fluffy. Honestly, I rate their breadsticks above Olive Gardens. They are wonderful. Reasons why I‚Äôm not going with 5 stars, is nothing that this location has control over. It‚Äôs not a complaint of the individual location itself. First issue is, I felt the Alfredo sauce was very bland. I‚Äôve had stuff out of a jar at home that beats it. Secondly, the amount of sauce (all 3 pastas had the same issue) they put on is very little compared to the noodles you get. My feeling is, I can buy a pound of uncooked noodles for $1 at the store. After they absorb the water, you‚Äôve got 2lbs of noodles for $1. Commercially, they buy them much cheaper than that even. Noodles are incredibly cheap. Yet, you‚Äôre not really given enough sauce for them. Since pasta is so cheap, you‚Äôd think they could afford another 50 cents of sauce. The picture makes it look ok because it‚Äôs all on the top. It certainly looks like a decent amount of sauce. But you can‚Äôt see the noodle to sauce ratio. Also, I assume they have a pre-specified ladle size they are told to use. However, mix things up (or eat the top portion), and you‚Äôll quickly find yourself eating plain noodles. Again, I‚Äôm sure this is a corporate thing, and not location specific, but you‚Äôre reading my review because you want an honest review, right? So, I‚Äôm going to tell my experience as it was. Over all, I‚Äôm giving it 4 stars still, as service is good, breadsticks are wonderful, and food was pretty good, aside from the lack of sauce. Go in there prepared with this info, and see what you think. And remember, those wonderful breadsticks... they are unlimited. They will keep bringing more if you want. And, you‚Äôll likely want them to.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a american restaurant.
completion: I've eaten there, and now I work there. So I get to see the food "behind the scenes". Most, if not all, is homemade in the sense that whoever the cook is, they will cook it their own way with their own ingredients like they would in their own home. So you get to try the same food about 4 to 5 different ways which I think is pretty awesome. The cooks take allergy warnings very seriously. The owners come in pretty much every day to make sure we dont stray off of the path that they made to build this restaurant and its food upon. We have SO many return customers that when they're off work they will hang out with us from open to close. We strive to be extra friendly and helpful! And our MANY return customers can verify.  We have 2 flat screens to watch your sports on or for your child to watch cartoons so you can eat with some peace (lol). Our food is great tasting. Certain waitresses will buy 4 to 5 bowls of homemade cream of crab soup to take home for the night. As an example. So if we trust the food enough to eat it AND buy it in bulk, I'm sure you will love your dinner! Since I started working 1 month ago, I have yet to hear not even one complaint. If I work somewhere that's not all that good, I'm not afraid to say so. So I promise I'm not on here because anyone told me to, or to try to gain more customers etc. I simply rated it because my phone noticed how often I come here and asked me to review it LOL. Dont be afraid to give it a try. The portions range from "good size for the money" to "Massive"! We are located inside the Laurel De Truck Stop/gas station with the Hardees hooked to it. Come say hello if you've seen this review and I happen to be worki g when you come in! My name is Alyssa & I cant wait to meet yall!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a restaurant.
completion:
If you have a healthy appetite you gotta check out BullDawg's Burgers....and ask for Mike....who happens to be the Owner.

Mike is very personable and friendly he greeted me as soon as I walked in the door.....in other words he made me feel welcomed immediately and things only got better from there!

The food...all I can say is....OH MY GOODNESS!!!!! I ordered a chocolate shake (no whipped cream  HUMONGOUS BURGER and loaded fries and I was in delicious food heaven!!!

If you are located in Pittsburgh or ever find yourself visiting Pittsburgh make a bee line to BullDawg's Burgers and ask for Mike.......tell him The Disabled Vet sent ya'!!!!!!!

100% guarantee you won't leave hungry!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a restaurant.
completion:
Pretty decent little sandwich shop. They have hoagies, cheesesteaks, burgers, wings, and almost any other American type food. Tonight, I saw they had a great deal on Uber Eats offering buy 1 get one 1 free on select items. I decided to try the classic Philly cheesesteak, which also came with their hand cut fries (you also have the option of substituting chicken for steak).

The cheesesteak was about $12.50 each, which I think is an okay price. Portion size is decent too, not too big nor too small. I will say that there was quite a lot of bread in comparison to the meat, cheese, and vegetables. I believe the bun was too thick. The steak itself was pretty flavorful and had a good texture. They use an adequate amount of cheese. Good amount of mushrooms, and each mushroom is quite big, but they do have a slight canned flavor.

The fries were just okay. Quality probably declined due to them being in the car for delivery. Still, they were not bad, and definitely nice to get fries for free. As usual, I would have wanted a bit more salt or pepper, and they were a bit limp.

All in all, not a bad spot for a sandwich, wings, or other classic American fare. The cheesesteak was still enjoyable, just nothing special. I do appreciate the deal they had going on with Uber Eats, though.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a restaurant.
completion: So here's the deal.  The first time I ate at this spot was last month I got the steak hoagie and my bf got the BBQ chicken hoagie.  Both were amazing.  Tonight, we both decided to try the burgers.  I'm only going to give the burgers a 2 out of 5.  The bun was double the size of the burger. The burger was dry, and the bottom of the burger was hard as if it was precooked and sitting. They didn't even ask or include any veggies for the burger.  No lettuce. No tomatoes.  No onions, and I paid 13 bux for this burger. Next, you definitely have to work on a different way of delivering the fries.  They get soggie in plastic containers.  Some places use paper bags.  Just a thought.

Spent around 2 hrs. My 2 yo toddler enjoyed it. There is an animal encounter with feeding goats. Infront of the zoo is a playground and picnic area where we had a picnic lunch. Highly recommended.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a zoo.
completion: Really great little zoo! Some up close experiences with the animals. Everyone really enjoyed! Great gift shop too!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a zoo.
completion: Awesome zoo for a fraction of the price of a bigger zoo. My 2 yo loved it and had a blast. Less than 8 dollars for adults, 5 to feed the giraffes. Big park but not too big

prompt: A Google Maps review about a zoo.
completion: It's a little small but it was pretty fun

prompt: A Google Maps review about a zoo.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a zoo.
completion: Fun little zoo downtown Gainesville. Infants are free, kids up to the age of 12 are $5.50 and adults are $7.50. Great place locally to have a picnic lunch and get some exercising in!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a zoo.

The zoo is very clean and the animals have very spacious enclosures that allow visitors to see them up close. We will be back to bring our daughter here soon!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a zoo.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a zoo.
completion: This small zoo is a hidden gem in North Texas, particularly for families with small kiddos. It‚Äôs a lovely walk with some unique animals.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a zoo.
completion:
My kids and I enjoyed during our trip in Frank Buck Zoo in Gainesville. We saw animals we never saw before like the Cayote, Camel, Red Fox and more.
The zoo is small but it is way better than the one in Nashville, TN. Lol. My kids loves animals. We went to Nashville Zoo Aug 27 a week before we move back here in Texas... nothing to see in that zoo! Lol only few animals.
Finally back in Texas and we Went to Frank Buck Zoo Sept. 24 and we get more excited üòÅ

prompt: A Google Maps review about a zoo.
completion:
Really good!!! Great walkways, fair number of animals, clean & air conditioned restrooms, very reasonable price, wrist band so you can come and go and a fantastic playground for all ages.
Well worth the drive from Northlake; a successful spur of the moment outing with our daughter and 20 month old grand son.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a zoo.
completion: Wonderful little zoo! Kids had a blast! And there's a sweet old black bear that interacts with the kids really well! The park out front and train are definitely bonuses too!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a zoo.
completion: Great family zoo with some cool animals. Whole place is stroller friendly and easy to walk it. Kinda small but the place is definitely worth it. Cover was less than 10 bucks can't beat. And the park across makes it that much better to get the kids out the house on the weekend

prompt: A Google Maps review about a zoo.
completion: Went while visiting the grandkids, it was great. Just enough to keep their attention and not get bored. They loved the otters and groundhogs. The monkeys were a big hit, I loved the overlook for the giraffes. Perfect place to spend a few hours and a great park outside to run and play. Definitely will go back.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a zoo.
completion: My husband surprised me and took me today. We had such a great and wonderful time. The animals we're a bit sleepy but it was hot. Great time though! The exhibits were awesome!

prompt: A Google Maps review about a zoo.
completion: Just long enough for kids and old guys. And it was nice that the train was open for rides.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a zoo.
completion: Get there early, before it gets too hot, to see the animals more active.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a zoo.
completion: Great little zoo with well kept animals. The zoo is really well kept and they have a really good variety of animals. Their cages were clean and they all seemed happy and well-fed. The whole zoo isn't very big but definitely worth the price. The customer service is what needs a little work. Some of the employees were great and very friendly while others seemed to be bothered by questions. I also didn't like that there was only one very small restroom in the very beginning. But, overall a great ace to visit for a few hours. Also, as everyone has noted the free castle playground in the front is a major plus. The kids loved running around in it after the zoo visit.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a zoo.
completion: There were several empty cages and no giraffes.  The cat exhibit stunk horribly, which I imagine is normal because....cats.   However, the rest of the animals that were there seemed happy and well cared for.  The walkways were well maintained as were all the bushes/plants... Except for the spot in the first picture.... Which gave  me a giggle (look at the sign).

prompt: A Google Maps review about a zoo.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a zoo.

Plus there was no feed in the feed machine for the goats so they didn‚Äôt get to feed them either. Was a disappointment.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a zoo.

completion: I had lived in Gainesville 3 years and never been there my fiance asked me to go and it was so much fun especially  feeding the goats. They have a lot more animals than I was expecting  and so much to look at was great fun.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a zoo.

There is a water park next to them for an even more fun day for the kids.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a zoo.
completion:
Frank Buck Zoo is a definite 5 out of 5 experience. The entrance was cute and inviting. The Black Bears and Cheetahs were amazing to watch and experience so closely. My family loved watching the Otters perform acrobatic backflips. The zoo was well maintained and has clean Restrooms.
Although we weren‚Äôt able to see the giraffes we are excited to come back when the weather improves.
